school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Shivali Chhabra

reviews.comment: Weekly graded in class assignments, whether that be a test, group work/worksheet, or individual quizzes. Pearson graded assignments (like usual) are before every class and at the start of the week. She allows one note card for every test, which is very helpful. She does, however, come across as rude when students get questions wrong in class.
QUALITY

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Nirina Randrianarivony

reviews.comment: Best professor ever, if you go to lecture, you will learn. If you go to lecture and follow the problems she does in class and are able to do the problems on the reviews, then you can do the problems on the exam. Makes sure to show every single step to every single problem. Weekly quizzes keep you on track and makes studying for exams ez.

I am someone who learns well more so through seeing examples of how to do a problem. If you're like me take this class because that pretty much the entirety of her lectures. the first semester was great but near the end if second semester her lectures became harder to follow and less time was spent on topics that I felt needed more.

Lova was amazing, her lectures are clear, but if you dont pay attention you'll be lost. Attendance isnt graded but if you dont show up, you will fail. There's a weekly quiz, you get better at them as time goes on. She gives a content review ever 2 ish week, do them, it basically whats on the test. Class is straightforward, do the work to do well.
tags: you will fail. There's a weekly quiz

reviews.comment: I can tell she knows a lot about the Calc but she tends to teach in a way that most people don't understand. The average on quizzes and exams are usually a low C, and for the 15 minute quizzes are too short for most people. She doesn't seem to care though. She also rarely reads emails, I had to follow up on an email 4 times for her to see it.

Class was very lecture focused with one to two worksheet days a week. Her lectures were easy to follow and detailed. She provided helpful practice worksheets for every section that were similar to the weekly quiz. She also provided sample exams that were similar to the exams. Online homework was assigned for each section with unlimited attempts.

Very lecture-heavy class, but concepts are explained well and in detail. Smooth path if you took Calc 2 in high school. Attendance isn't mandatory, but missing lectures hurts you. There are worksheets given each week that will mirror the weekly quiz. She also might give out sample exams that mirror exams. I definitely recommend!

Super easy teacher, I got a 99% in the class. I took calc 1 in high school, but this was an even simpler course. She is slightly hard to understand and a little confusing at times, but her tests and quizzes are very easy.

pretty easy class. many of the worksheets are similar to the quizzes which are similar to the tests. i did not take ap calc and still was ok in class, she explains things pretty well and does a lot of practice problems. there is online homework but not a lot of it, overall good class good prof

Very easy class if you took Calc in high school. She is really good at explaining concepts if you wanted a refresher on math. But towards the end of the course, if you are learning the material for the first time, the class can feel really fast. The quizzes and exams were easy since you get a wkst the day of with the same concepts. do the wkshts
Do worksheets

Easy A if you took Calc in high school since it's the exact same type of vibe. Wouldn't recommend if you need to take any higher level math classes though. She goes slow, isn't really detailed, and you would be at a disadvantage if you had to take Calc 2 with a different prof. It's basically a memorization class, you don't apply info in new ways.

If you took CALC AB or BC is high school, you are golden. This class was not harder than the high school level AP course. She goes slow and she tells you exactly how she wants a problem to be done. You can definitely skip class as long as you come the day before the weekly quiz. Final wasn't bad, just study quizzes for the final and 3 exams.

You will not use canvas. I had to make an excel sheet using the syllabus so I could know my grade. You will also get one paper syllabus, do not use it. Her quizzes are very similar to the in class problems. Quizzes every Wednesday. As long as you go to class and take notes youll be fine
Didnt even use the textbook. Homework was always much harder than anything else. I had no idea what my grade was in the class for the whole semester
I'd give a 0/10 if i could.
Not a clear grader. Don't recommend

She explains each topic as if you had never learned about about math before. She is very helpful when you ask questions. Online homework can be annoying and once in a while an answer is straight up wrong, however this did not ruin my experience in her class. I enjoyed her class and am able to understand calculus much better after taking it.

She seems very hard and a little scary at first, but as the semester goes on, I started to really appreciate her and her teaching style. She starts from the very basics of calc and doesn't skip over things, and really goes over topics a lot to ensure you know how to do it. Online homework can be annoying and is hard but helps. Quiz every tuesday

Homework is always WAY harder than the tests, typically over material not covered in class. Rarely answers emails. Lectures are easy to understand, but tests and homework dont reflect them. No opportunity for extra credit, strict grader.

She explains things very clearly. She assumes that we know nothing about advanced math notations, so she doesn't skip over things that other math profs tend to skip assuming that we already know (like what certain phrases and symbols mean in math). Homeworks are hard and will take at least 2 days to complete, but do them and exams will be fine.
Very specific in terms of answers/results. Principles of math was not taught well.

She made things easy to understand but seems intimidating at first. She is willing to help if you ask. Quizzes every week and at least 4 tests. Online homework is once every week. As long as you do the study guides and practice/take good notes you will do fine.
She is an awesome professor! I would highly recommend taking her class. She goes over the material at a relatively slow pace and explains it very well.

One of the best, most clear, professors I've had. I had her for diff eq and all her exams were basically the graded assignments she gave us (sometimes even easier..). Make sure your work is clear for she is a bit picky but other than show up to class and take good notes and you'll get the grade you want!

She was such a great professor all around and didn't throw any curveballs on the exams. The quiz questions went along well with the lecture and the test questions were extremely similar to the quiz questions. She curved every test and there were plenty of chances to earn extra credit on exams and quizzes. I recommend her for Calc 2 for sure.

Optional suggested homework problems from the book after almost every lecture and makes up Grade Assignments that are turned in for credit (usually harder than average book problems). Her lectures are pretty clear, but tests are hard because they are super long. She grades really tough, but overall she's not bad and you'll learn if you attend class

She is a clear teacher and explains the concepts very well, and I understood the material for the most part. Quizzes and tests are nearly unbearable and are extremely difficult, and she is by no means an easy grader. Homework is never due, but I recommend doing it if you want to get better and do well in the class. Don't even try for extra credit.

Nice enough lady who is pretty clear in class, however when she gets that red pen in her hand she turns into the math demon of your nightmares and will take no mercy on your petty math soul as she wipes away your dreams with the swipe of her pen. Not a fan of partial credit, mess up at the beginning of a problem and you're done for.

She is amazing! Her lectures are clear and concise, and her exams accurately test what you have learned during the section. She's a tough grader on homework, but fair for exams. She is also super helpful in office hours. Brilliant, brilliant woman.

She is a great teacher, and really explains everything clearly in class. She is also really helpful in office hours. Honestly, she made Differential Equations easy and that is pretty hard to do. I definitely recommend her.

Great professor. I had no previous calc experience and did fine in the class. Study for the weekly quizzes and do the assigned textbook homework and WebWork and you should be fine. Test questions are often multi-step and tricky, but doable. Very helpful when approached.
Spend too much time on this class

Do not take this course if you do not have prior Calc experience. This professor was very pushy (would tell me to hurry every 5 seconds in a harsh tone if I was taking longer than others on a quiz) and she tended to neglect the students who really needed help, like myself. She seemed to pick favorites in the class. Good, but not for beginners.

had her for calc 1, very organized and a nice lady. Tests are pretty hard. Quizzes aren't too bad. Webworks can be a pain but thats a given. Doesn't drop tests. Doesn't offer extra credit. Other calc professors do. Take her if you don't know calc yet,, if you do and just need an easy grader(who sucks at teaching), take someone else.
Even though this lady has an accent, she is super easy to follow.

Beginning of the course was easy. Then came the last exam before the final, very difficult. She covered very little of what was on the exam. She gave the review problems one day before the test. Her take home quizzes are often extremely difficult. Seems like a very nice person, but she needs start giving more fundamental problems for quizzes/tests.

She is awesome! She has a slight accent but is not hard to understand at all, she just says cute things like "teda" for theta and "haych" for h. She writes very clear notes on the board and gives a lot of examples. Quizzes every week aren't hard if you do a few of the homework problems she assigns.

Despite the ease of her differential equations class and the clarity of her lectures, she was the most boring professor I've ever had. No personality in the least. Occasionally made lectures painful, but the class was fine.

This is one of the best math teachers I've ever had! The notes are straightforward and easy to understand. There are short quizzes every Friday over what you learned that week. The tests can be a little difficult at times, but aren't that bad overall. She is very nice and will make sure you understand the problems.

Don't be scared by the name. She is an excellent professor that doesn't make things more complicated than they need to be. One of the best math teachers I've ever had. Class consists of 4 tests and turning in HW. Always very nice and helpful. Highly recommended.
shes a great teacher!!! very polite and always willing to help at anytime. she really knows what shes doing and the test arnt that hard if you study for it.
She is an extremely nice professor. Very helpful and patient. No regret to take her classes. We love her.

She is very helpful if you attend her office hours and very willing to help you succeed. However, she holds a notebook and writes her same notes up on the board and expects you to follow along. for someone who hasnt taken calc before, its very confusing. you have to make time to get help.
She is really good at teaching and very organized. As long as you attend her class and not sleep, it is no problem to get a good grade.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: R. Alex Fajardo

reviews.comment: Instead of receiving specific comments on how I can improve, I see responses that don't provide ANY guidance or clarity on what needs to be done differently. You need to be better, and stop yelling at people to speak up when they finally get the courage to raise their hand. How come we do 1-3 examples in class and suddenly have 25+ questions on HW?

He may not be the best at answering doubts during class but teaching is okay. Behaves a arrogant sometimes and is not very understanding. Assigns waaay too much hw which ends up being discouraging as students have other work to do and cannot get it all completed.

Knows his stuff but has zero patience. Believes in stupid questions and has a bad temper. Partial credit is generous if you show your work. Grades may reflect how he feels about you if you suck up. Do the homework to understand the material, pay attention, follow his rules, and don't speak unless necessary. Only the brave ask questions during class

I registered for this class late so he was my last option. I wouldn't recommend him if math is not your strong suit. He is pretty nice most of the time, however, becomes a bit snippy when you ask a question that seems obvious to him. There's weekly quizzes, and hw load depends on the chapter. Overall, he's just okay.

Mr. Fajardo's Calc 1 course was AMAZING. All of the homework is just like the quizzes and exams. He might seem strict in class, but he's actually a very nice teacher if you go to office hours, just don't ask dumb questions. He gets the points across and is very clear on what will be on the exam. I would definitely recommend his class.

All in class materials are supplemental to the exams. Homework is often times more difficult than the exams. He can seem condescending at times and often answers questions poorly, but after the first month he lightens up a bit. Very caring to students and is flexible with them. Go to office hours, he is much nicer and more patient there.

Alex Fajardo is a very good calculus professor if you are strong in math. He doesn't like dumb questions, but if you were good in math in high school he would be a good fit for you. If you are an engineering major or have a math heavy degree, I highly recommend his class, but if math is not your strong suit maybe pick another professor.

He gets very crabby and a lot of his lectures just felt like definitions without giving many examples, but his tests are pretty easy bc he uses problems similar to what is done in class. I will say there is a lot of homework and I had to learn a lot of the content from videos online. offers a lot of extra credit.

If you don't follow his approach exactly, it will result in point deductions. However, he clearly informs students about these things in advance and does not include any material on the exam that wasn't covered in class. His class may not make us fall in love with math, but it's honest and pure.

The reviews for him overall were terrifying but he was my only option at the time. After taking his class I can say he is very intelligent in his area but not at all in social aspects. Often short tempered with students he offers office hours that I never attended in fear of being scolded. Tough class but at end of the sem some extra credit opps.
Run as fast as you can. SO rude and mean to students- yelled at us during class and genuinely made the class impossible to pass. Was incredibly mean and rude even during office hours.
Kind of an a-hole, tough grader, and his lectures w/ HW were incompatible.

He is very impatient when dealing with minor inconveniences. If you ask him a question that may be redundant he gets noticeably frustrated at the expense of the student who asked. When it comes to lecturing, at least for his calc 1 class, there is a lot of material to cover so he moves through it very quickly but he does a good job explaining.

As a Communication(s) major, I only needed one math class to fulfill the core requirement. That being said, this course was absolutely brutal and taxing; Fajardo makes you feel stupid when asking questions and most of the material was unlike anything I had ever seen - despite taking up to Pre-Calculus in high school and excelling. Don't take!

He was OK. Grants zero leniencies even if you are sick/granny died/you died. No retakes, homework late policy is 50% off if turned in a second after the due time. However, he works really hard to explain the lesson, not expecting prior knowledge. Took the time to go over stuff even if it seemed easy. You will get points if you make a valid effort

Selects favorites.Homework is time consuming yet is not alike to questions on quizzes. impossible to use outside resources. Is by far the WORST teacher i've had at slu. Does not answer questions and when does acts like it's a huge inconvenience for him. self-righteous prick. Never met a student who has liked him, most people dropped our course.

Weekly quizzes (sometimes open notes/book). He doesn't like when you ask questions and he isn't good at explaining things. His exams are kinda long, so make sure you can work fast and efficiently because you may run out of time. He allows you have to a notecard for exams, so that's a plus. Homework is easy and kinda pointless. Not a good teacher!
great class

The worst professor SLU has hired. Dont take him. Makes rude comments during class and is only helpful if you basically sit in his office asking for the answer. Half of the exams are nothing like what you cover in class. Overall, very rude personality and not good at teaching.

Isn't patient when responding to questions, especially if he thinks they're stupid questions. However, he was a good lecturer and I understood the material until the last section. You don't need the textbook but you technically have to buy it anyways for the online homework, which isn't too heavy a load. Allows notecards for exams.
Try to find another professor!

Mr. Fajardo was my favorite professor this semester. He was always available during office hours to help and his lectures were really engaging. I learnt a lot of relevant knowledge from his class that has helped me succeed in my divine and humanities courses as well.
Best Math1300 professor compared to others, easy A as long you attend lecture and pay attention. Tests come straight from lectures, minimal homework. TAKE HIS CLASS

The worst, not a very approachable professor. HW due dates make no sense. Makes you figure everything out on your own after rushing through it in class. Very quiz heavy, with weekly quizzes. Exam structure is bad, with very long exams for a very short class period. Save yourselves.

This professor is pretty harsh in teaching and grading for the most part he is ok at teaching but doesn't give a lot of practice he jumps through lectures like crazy. He doesn't like questions and he can be a bit sarcastic and makes his students feel bad for asking him questions outside and in class.

Mr. Fajardo was honestly one of my favorite teachers at SLU. He always cared about students individually and was very forgiving with deadlines and grade curves. Many of the reviews left by others really shocked me because I've known him as nothing but nice. He teaches in a regular lecture manner and it is fairly easy to get an A in his class.

Fajardo can give attitude, so don't get on his nerves. Participate in class, if not he will call on people at random (he does that anyway). Has extended office hours before exams, I recommend going. Make sure to study and go FAST on the exams, they are timed, and super long!

Not a bad professor, but sometimes he has difficulty clearly expressing concepts in a way that is easy to understand. He expects a lot of participation, and will wait in awkward silence until someone speaks up. However, he gets frustrated if you get things wrong. Tests aren't bad if you are a fast test-taker. Note cards for tests. Easy homework.

Potentially easy A if your learning style fits the professor's. He does not know how to explain things in a different way, and he gets upset/aggravated if you dare to be vulnerable and ask a question/or answer incorrectly. He does not cultivate an environment that is student-professor friendly. Again, an easy-ish A, but would not recommend.
He can not teach very well and the test can not match what is he teaching.
i had him for finite math and he is honestly one of the easiest teachers. he's very awkward but gives extra credit and easy tests/quizzes. do the hw and you'll get an A
As long as you show up to lectures and follow along you'll do great! Has weekly quizzes that normally aren't too hard if you pay attention. Has extra office hours during exam weeks and is super nice!

This class wasn't bad, but Fajardo wasn't a good professor. He wasn't able to explain things differently if students didn't understand, and he didn't understand some homework questions. But the content is easy, and he uses questions from the weekly quizzes on the tests & final, plus he gave a lot of bonus points! Take if you've taken precalc before

Let's you have notecards for tests which is nice. The homework is generally pretty useless but a lot of it is multiple choice and you can just keep guessing til you get it right lol. Isn't very good at explaining things at all. Doesn't explain it well enough so that you can apply it to problems that you don't do in class.

Around 27 chapters to cover and whenever you ask him about what topics you should be focusing on when preparing for a test, he would say" Everything is a fair game" He gives lots of homework, 12 quizzes, 3 exam and each one has a take-home portion that counts for 25% of the exam score. yet, to be fair, he is accessible,He gives real-life examples

He explains things very well and gives lots of examples. Attendance is required but he usually makes lectures entertaining. There are weekly quizzes but he drops the lowest ones, and on tests he allows a notecard with formulas and calculator commands. He also has alot of extra credit on tests that usually are quite easy.

Fajardo is a pretty good teacher. Seems like he's improved his teaching since the last rating. Class isn't too bad, just make sure to pay attention in class and learn to work the in class problems because similar ones show up on the weekly quizzes and exams. Other than that, my only complaint is that the online homework system is bad. Great class!

Overall easy class, and he is a nice guy. You either have a test or a quiz every week. Lets you have a notecard for tests with formulas on it. Not a bad teacher, just somewhat disorganized. Presents all necessary info, but I found the book helpful to organize the info.
Used MyMathLab, which by the way sucks. Besides that, not a bad professor. Only complaint: needs to let students complete practice problems, rather than spoon feeding on the board.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: David Letscher

reviews.comment: David Letscher reflects the overall quality of the computer science education you can expect at SLU. A major red flag arises when a professor says, “Hey! I can't teach this properly, go watch videos at home!” While he's a kind person and talented in mathematics, his code is often illogical, and his teaching methods are ineffective.

Do not take unless it delays graduation. Learned close to nothing in the course. Nice guy, but he kinda just talks at you about a topic and we move on, seems like his lectures are made up on the fly. 80 page reading assignments with 2/3 of the reading irrelevant to his assignments, if he even assigns them. Lied on syllabus, class is nothing like it

Kind & intelligent, but truly one of the WORST professors to teach at SLU. Disorganized, chaotic teaching style, not accessible through email, no clear rubrics, cancels class often and never grades anything. No one is my class knows their actual grade right now and the semester is ending tomorrow. His heavy lectures are useless for the assignments

Extremely unorganized. Missed class half of the time. Only graded things at the end of the semester. Hard to follow along. Assignments are not ready or instructions are out of date. Hesitant to admit he is wrong or made a mistake. Barely learned anything the whole semster.

He is probably one of the worst professors that I have ever had. He does not grade anything other than the midterm and final and blames the website for not posting grades, yet when directly asked, he cannot give you a straight answer about your grades. Class is unreasonably difficult and he has a lot of trouble explaining the course material.

Super nice guy, very eager to help after class. I took this during the summer and got a B but i def think an A would have been possible had I not taken physics simulataneously. Overall, makes it approachable to those of us who are not math people and is a pretty nice guy. I would reccomend him but you need to work for an A. Easy B, Hard A.

He lost my first exam but never admitted it. His office even looks like a mess. Contradicts his own grading system. Says a 90 is a guaranteed A- at least, but an 89.6 is a B, not a B+. Tried to implant false memories in me in order to give himself less work. I transferred to another college partially because of my experience with him.

Obviously an intelligent man and knowledgeable in his field, but seems to lack the personal skills necessary to communicate and relate to students. Asked for help on a couple of occasions and left none the wiser. Class was fairly hard and attending is necessary to do well on programs and tests. Speaking of tests, VERY DIFFICULT.
Fine teacher. Uses examples straight from the textbook. I learned a lot, but it is easy to not pay attention in class. I recommend paying attention

Good guy. The class is hard but it really leads you into the next class, data structures. Everything that we did in programing we are doing again in data just in more detail. I would recomend him but you have to do work
Good teacher. Easy tests. Homework once a week, but determined by a coin toss. Makes a lot of mistakes on the board, and uses a lot of examples, but he doesn't mind when you tell him hes wrong.

Decided he wanted to do compression algorithms the entire semester with a smattering of what we were supposed to be learning every couple weeks. It's 2 weeks until end of semester and still haven't received most of our grades. Good math teacher, needs to stick to that because he sucks at programmin

ruined this class. could have been very interesting, but he came up with a pet project early in the semester that was only half-way thought through and then babbled about crap for the rest of the semester that had very little to do with the course itself.

When I think back on what we learned in this class I come up with nothing... We had to do projects off of non-working code, we only got grades back once, just before the final, and it said this is what you have going into the final, no breakdown. Unstructured classes. Not that great of a class.
Very hard to get in contact with. Very unclear on class requirements. Workload isn't bad if you can understand what he wants done, which is a bit hard.
VERY unorganized. Very unclear. If you like structure for a class then do not take. We did not get anything back until well after midterms.

Best Math teacher. Period. Just incredible passion for the subject and highly organized lectures. He is so good at making the class seem less bloated. Really nice, understanding man as well. Very humble man. The material isn't easy, but he makes it.

Great Guy, Good Teacher. Wants everyone to do well. The test has a curve and possible extra credit. If you don't try on your homework you'll get a bad grade. He grades hard but for a purpose. I wish I had him for every math class I've had.
Very helpful teacher. He wants you to succeed, but calculus can be difficult. Tests are almost easier than the homework, which is done in groups, in a way.
For once Math Makes Sense!! He uses real examples so taht math isn't so boring. Go to class and you can't fail. He is willing to help always and expects you to ask questions to help clarify

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Benjamin Hutz

reviews.comment: Exams are all 20% of the grade, at least for Calc 1. Clear lectures make material digestible- homework is a pain though. He also brings in his dog so that's a plus.

Class is lecture heavy and he doesn't post notes, so you will want to attend class, but he doesn't take attendance for a grade. Homework is generally a little tougher than in class problems but not by much. He gives example exams online before tests that are very helpful for the real tests. If you use the resources he provides the class is easy.

2660 not 1660. Don't know where the low rating comes from but maybe things have changed in 5 years. Not a professor worth avoiding. Grades are just homework and tests, majority of which is tests. 10+ homework problems per unit. Usually he'll just lecture but there are *some* practice problems done in class. Most practice is homework though.

Attendance is mandatory, all he does is lecture on the board and half the time, you can't even read his handwriting. I usually did homework during that class. Tests are HARD but he gives massive curves. My raw grade was a 65% in the class but with the curve, it turned into a B. Learned absolutely nothing and you need a precalc background to succeed

Homework is annoying but exams aren't as bad as you'd expect. He goes through the material fast so take some time on your own to digest/understand. The material itself is not difficult it just seems that way because you go through each topic quickly.

By far one of the hardest teachers i have ever taken. He goes over the content extremely fast and his handwriting is very sloppy. Hutz is pretty intelligent and a nice person but not the greatest teacher.

Don't believe that comment with a 5.0 rating. In all honesty, he is a brilliant man. Too brilliant to the point where he teaches WAY too fast and the way only he could understand. He also has very poor handwriting. Nice guy, tough teacher. Has a cool dog with him, but I'd still rather take a discrete course or any math course with someone else.

Professor Hutz was one of my favorite math teachers I've had in a long time. His lectures are very clear and organized and his tests are exactly what you expect (although not easy). He has a dog that chills out during class and enjoys being pet and overall I would love to trade my current math professors for professor Hutz.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Robert Monjo

reviews.comment: He is Spanish and doesn't speak English very well. It was very hard to understand him and his class had no structure. He was always jumping around in the textbook and when he explained things on the board it made no sense.

I enjoyed having Professor Monjo quite a lot. He does a good job explaining the concepts in class and we spend a lot of time practicing and applying them. Monjo puts everyone in a position to succeed without too much outside work. However, he is not a native English speaker and sometimes it is difficult to understand lectures/communicate questions.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Bruce Washington

reviews.comment: He's a great guy and I think a good teacher, I do understand the criticism he gets sometimes and there can be a lot of homework but I think he's good.
Mr. Washington is very nice and enjoys saying his catchphrase "BooYea" - but other than that he is very tough. Lots of homework with impossible tests. I would not take him
Sometimes shows up a little late, heavy lecture user, but the best part about him is him being understanding and using “By Jove” alot

Bruce is a very caring and understanding teacher, this is one of his strong suits. This is where the positives end. He has a lack of ability to teach, but makes up for in loose grading. Almost all of the "lectures" are just him writing practice problems on the board, from the book, and "by jobe" he solves it for you. HE CANNOT USE CANVAS AT ALLLLLL

As nice as he is, do not take him!! He isn't tech savvy with Canvas (for example, he never posted study guide answers for the final despite saying he did) and gives an extensive amount of homework. Tests are not like the study guide and test averages are in the 40s-50s. Lectures are just examples, not teaching. Avoid him at all costs.

I regret not switching professors after reading the bad reviews, and I'm here to say they are true. I hate to say it because he is such a nice guy, but he's the worst professor I've had. His canvas consisted of one day of powerpoint notes from a different professor and a bad syllabus. He gives no resources at all, only does problems on the board

Bruce Washington is a kind and understanding person. However, he is not suited to be a college professor. He lacks a passion for teaching. If you want a gpa boost take his class, if you want to learn don't. You will pass if you complete your homework assignments, which he often pushed back the due dates to. He also lacks skill with technology.

Professor Washington is very kind and wants every student to succeed. His lessons are a bit difficult to follow as they are all examples. Although the teaching style is not good, the homework assignments make up for a lot of the grade.

As a person,Washington is a sweetie pie, in a grandpa sense. Unfortunately, he is not equipped to be a college professor. Little to no communication about assignment and exam dates, does not use canvas, spends class talking to himself. You are expected to know all material beforehand, and he will only solve problems, no teaching.
BOOYAH!!!

Bruce Washington has to be one of the worst professors i have experience in my time here at SLU. From not replying to emails to uploading homework wrong please do whatever you can to not take his class.
Do NOT take him. Although he is a nice person, he goes SO fast, is not clear about when things are due, and his exams are nothing like the reviews. Seriously, get out of his class if you can.
tags: is not clear about when things are due

reviews.comment: I have no clue how I am going to pass this class. When he lectures he stands in front of the problem and doesn't explain how he arrived at his answer so most of the time I'm left clueless. Has given us two tests that barely covered what we learned in class. If you can switch to a different professor, do it now and save yourself the headache.

If you can, please switch to a different math professor. Washington gave an unnecessary amount of homework, and the tests rarely reflected the study guides at all. The only reason a lot of people passed was due to the curve on the final exam.

If you can avoid taking this class then do so. His reviews are misleading and contain hardly any of the information on the test. The syllabus says that there is a quiz every Friday but we only had two this whole semester. There are multiple homework sets due every week that can be up to 30 questions each. the class was graded on maybe 7 things.
WHATEVER YOU DO, GET OUT OF THIS CLASS ASAP. BRUCE WASHINGTON WAS BY FAR THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE HAD IN ALL 14 YEARS OF MY EDUCATION.

Literally didnt care and i never showed up. he said "no one ever fails my class" I decided to test this and its true!. Horrible, boring teacher. BUT I failed every test and still passed. DONT with drawl, just see how it works out. Attendance doesnt matter at all. also he says he has a quiz every friday but thats a lie.

A ton of homework assignments but never really grades them. Only grades that go in are tests/quizzes. Tells you when test is a week in advance but you have to be in class to hear the announcement because he doesn't use Canvas. If you're not in class you won't know when things are due. Never had a bad math grade until taking this course.

Washington is a really nice guy, however the only things he graded us on is exams, a cumulative homework grade, and 2 quizzes. I have never had a bad math grade before taking this class, I really just wish he graded us on more stuff.

Syllabus is useless, we don't follow it. Did not have a Canvas for 2 months. Each homework is 25-30 questions long & we get several per week. Suppose to take 16 quizzes, but only took one that took up >10% of our grade. Never receive tests back. Sometimes reads from PPT & is impossible to follow along. Better off teaching yourself online.

If you have the choice not to take this professor, don't do it. He doesn't teach very well and won't give any feedback when you ask questions in class. He takes forever to grade tests and quizzes. He doesn't put any grades in canvas, so you never know what your grade in the class is, and doesn't answer emails whatsoever

Our homework would be due a couple classes before we learned the material, he stares at the board the entire time and mumbles to himself, doesn't answer questions clearly, and since he takes forever to grade, you probably won't get your previous test back until after you take your next one.

He Messed up problem in class. He added things to the test a day before the test without adding it to the practice test. The practice test was taken down early also he kept messing up the practice test and told no one to take it till he fixed it never truly fixed it. Changes dates that things are due regularly. Takes forever to email back if at all

The other reviews are right. It seems to be even worse during the pandemic. Worst style of teaching I have ever encountered, only thing keeping me going is having already taken pre-cal and calc in high school.

Bruce Washington is very bad. On the first test, I got below a 50 percent. I went in for office hours and he did not help at all. He could not even tell me my grade when I needed to decide to drop or stay in the class (I ended up dropping because of his lack of help and concern when I asked for help). Do not take him. Most of the class failed.

He does not teach well at all. For the first exam, at least half the class got less than a 50 on it, and he did not curve it. He sometimes uses a different book other than the textbook that is recommended, therefore making it useless and a waste. He does not have set office hours and is hard to get help from. He doesn't even have a grading scale.

I liked him as a professor. He gives 5 extra credit points if you go to his office after an exam to go over it and he'll give you additional points while going through each problem. Really nice guy too. His style of teaching may not be for everyone though. Study guides are almost identical to the exams with a few differences. I'd retake him tbh.

If you want an easy A and honestly do not care if you learn or not take it. Be ready to be the most frustrated you have ever been in your life. He prepares for class during class, RUDE, hates when you ask questions, so I ask my peers. Just like everyone else, I do not understand how he has not been fired yet.

My prior knowledge (took precalc junior year of hs) is what helped me do ok. "Teaches" the class more as a review instead actually teaching. Gets mad/flustered when asked questions and answers condescendingly. If you haven't already took precalc, I highly suggest not taking his class. His way of teaching doesn't align with the book or homework.

He lectures to the board and answers his own questions. He is horrible at explaining anything and gets confused by student's questions. He would hand out the test reviews the last class before the test and most of the time did not give an answer key so you literally have no idea if you actually knew how to do the problem. His tests are also long.

Honestly not a good teacher. I'm unsire why SLU hired him considering that it is a very good school. he talks to the board and himself during lectue notes. Honestly, you're better reading the book if not dropping his class and getting a new professor. Also, he probably won't respond to your emails about class questions or tests. good luck.

The other reviews are very accurate. Taking his math 185 at STLCC, paid for a $200 book, he refuses to teach from. Takes an older text book and starts writing questions on the board, never truly explaining how he got the answer. He gives a study guide, that I studied heavily, only to see the test had material he never covered. Nice Nice man though

The worst teacher I have ever had in my entire life. Does not explain anything. Writes and mumbles things on the board. No one ever knows what's going on. Marks you off for no reason and then won't give points back. Does not respond to email ever. Doesn't even announce what chapter he is teaching. Honestly not sure how he is still allowed to teach.
EASY CLASS, just show up, pay attention, and you'll get an A. It is sooooo boring tho so be prepared. Also he is the most unorganized teacher ever, dont worry though he gives most kids an A

Taking STLCC night class with him. Nice man but a horrible teacher. Didn't find out final grade until the date of the exam because he hasn't touched grades for 2 mos. I've learned more from classmates than his entire course. DO NOT TAKE if you like organization and actually want to understand calc 2. As an engineering student, this class ruined me.

Currently taking him at Meramec STLCC as a night class. Over half the class has dropped. No one knows what's going on. Never specifies anything and always forgets everything. Cramming 2 of 5 tests into the last 2 weeks. Still hasn't given us as worksheet he promised 2 months ago for extra credit. Worst professor. So disorganized.
He's horrible!! I regret enrolling in his class, he is exactly how everyone explains him!

The bad reviews are completely justified. I withdrew after two class sessions. Don't say math is your passion if your idea of "passion" involves racing through the problem to get to the answer--and pausing several seconds to see if any of us knows the answer--without explaining WHY the answer is justified by the problem. Amateur hour.

Basically had to teach myself the material which wasn't hard after I read the book. An A is very doable and math isn't my major. I just skimmed the chapters and did the problems in the textbook starting a few days before the tests and did just fine. Don't expect to get much out of class.
worst teacher i have ever had. tells you to buy book you dont need it. easy class but he does not teach anything. taught myself most of it.

Terrible teacher. Consistently made mistakes on the board confusing students. He seemed to not know the material and always have to resort to the book to answer questions. His tests always contained questions and material never covered by him in class. His grading scale is unclear and has failed to fix grades where credit is due.
very nice teacher and he is very understanding welling to explain if you didn't understand
very nice person but very boring teaches everything out of text book he explains one question is so many ways that It confuses the hell out of you

This class was incredibly boring! But it was pretty easy. He teaches straight out of the textbook and he's hard to understand sometimes. He's also not very helpful if you ask him a question. However, the tests are pretty easy.
Unbelievably boring. Not a bad guy, but he teaches class facing the chalkboard and teaching directly out of the textbook.

Class is ridiculously boring and not that helpful. The class itself is not too difficult because there is virtually no homework, only a few tests, and attendance is only taken occasionally. Nice guy, but average teacher.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: John Kalliongis

reviews.comment: I had a horrible calc 1 experience. Dr. Kalliongis was a DREAM professor. He loves when people go to his office hours and ask questions. His tests are exactly the same as the practice tests with the numbers changed. He genuinely wants students to succeed and teaches like it. This guy gets that we're just trying to get through calc 2 afloat.

Does a good job at explaining material, as long as you're good with attendance and pay attention to lectures. Good with office hours, not very tech literate so you might have to be patient with online grading/assignments.

This professor is hmmm... how do I say this kindly... disgustingly bad. He stands in front of everything he writes and works through the lecture so fast that you have no idea of what you are meant to take in. He starts a problem, then not even half way through, stops and moves on to another subject. If you want to pass this class, teach yourself.

He seems to enjoy calculas & he has no idea how to explain the concepts. He talks ridiculously fast and stands in front of whatever he is writing. Your grade will come down to the exams. He's often condicending if you ask a question and has a difficult time understanding how the student could not be grasping the material.

Uses a chalk board for his lectures. His handwriting is sloppy which makes it hard to understand. If you ask questions, he does not answer them well or just laughs and continues lecturing. If you already understand concepts the class is fine, but if it's new information, have fun teaching yourself. He doesn't make homework so its harder than class.
Easy A. Do the homework and make sure you read the textbook because sometimes lectures arent helpful. the practice tests he hands out are identical to the real exam.

His exams are identical to the practice tests that he hands out. I would recommend reading the textbook bc his lectures are incredibly fast. He is a super easy grader. No webwork so you have to be disciplined enough to do the hw he assigns. Sometimes the questions on the exam are questions he assigned for hw so make sure you do those.

Dr. Kalliongis is exceedingly fair in all aspects of his teaching. He prepares practice tests which are a godsend for Calc 2. This class would be rather difficult if you don't have the self control to do the homework because he doesn't grade it, students don't do many in class problems, and this class would be near impossible without practicing

Lectures are very theoretical but if you do a little bit of the homework each time you will succeed in this class. His review tests are basically the tests he gives but with slightly different questions. Homework is a lot if you strictly follow it but its not necessary as your grade is just tests.
Easy grading

PLEASE TAKE DR. K. I am trying to save you. He literally goes over last years test with you the class before the exam, which identical to the exam, but just with different numbers. If you took calc in high school, and you somewhat get what you're doing, you only have to show up for review and test days. Get ready for easy 4 credits of 4.0 GPA.

Dr. Kalliongis was one of my favorite teachers for Calc. He had a unique sense of humor that was fresh and taught the class with joy and passion. The tests and quizzes were not bad. Ask him questions because he loves questions from students. Participation does not matter, but it will help you tremendously.

Took CalcBC & still learned new stuff. Would take his class again in a heartbeat. No online homework-gives HW problems to do from the textbook everyday. Gave reviews which were just like tests. Some say the way he shows proofs is unnecessary, but I think it's fundamental to understanding calculus. Always ended class with "I had fun today" :)

Dr. Kalliongis was the sweetest professor I have ever had! He truly cared about all of his students and wanted them to succeed. He gave practice tests before his tests and went over them during class, and they were basically identical to the real test. If you do these, it's an easy A. While class isn't mandatory, Dr. K was so great I hated skipping

Super enthusiastic about math. His lectures are not that bad but it really helps if you do the homework and ask questions. It also helps to be in class as much as possible, missing a day can really confuse you. If you work with a decent amount of effort you should be able to get an A.

Prof. Kalliongis is just a nice guy. he has incredible passion for math and shows it with his enthusiasm. He is always willing to do extra problems when asked as well. You don't really need the textbook if you are ok at math and take good notes, but it does help explain things.

Dr. Kalliongis is very enthusiastic about math. He often explains problems in a very complicated manner and will go off on tangents about other concepts that do not relate to what we are learning. He's a nice guy, but not the best professor.

His enthusiasm made this class super great. He gives example tests (the year before's test) and they follow the same format of kinds of problems so you know exactly what to expect. Assigns group homework (graded) and goes over optional HW problems at the start of every class and will always go over one if someone is confused.

After a bad experience in Calc 2, I was surprised to find that Kalliongis explained everything so that I understood it. He wants to see all students succeed, so take advantage of his office hours. The class grade was based on 3 exams, a final, and group homework, so make sure you have a good group. Other than that, enjoy the class!

Dr. Kalliongis loves math and you can tell. This was one of the first times he's taught this course and you can also tell. While he's comfortable with the math, he isn't entirely comfortable with the computer, though I suspect he'll get better the more he uses it. He's always open for questions beforeafter class and none of the homework is graded.

Kalliongis is the best teacher I had at Slu. I took college algebra over the summer in a 6 week course, and he was so nice. took the time to go over material again if you don't get it. Assigns homework that wasn't graded but you could ask questions on it next class period. Review guide is straight forward and exactly like the exam. Got an A-.
Professor Kalliongis was awful. This was a online course yet, he did not reply to e-mails or other messages for a week. He never once taught the class, or provide notes.

Best math teacher I've had a SLU. He truly cares that you learn the material. He is a very easy grader and will bump you up if you come to class regular and come to his office hours. Tests are straight from hw. TAKE HIM as close to as an easy A in calc 3 as it gets!

Moves his Calculus III class MUCH faster than the other Calc III classes at SLU, but that's how he keeps it interesting. He is very clear in his lectures, and you can tell that he really enjoys teaching. He get's really excited about math, and he ends many lectures by saying, "Did you have fun today? I did!" Grade is based almost entirely on tests.
tags: and he ends many lectures by saying

reviews.comment: Great prof that really knows his stuff and will not hesitate to help anyone at the start of every class. Legitimately cares about his students' grades and also assigns projects that are awesome grade boosters.
Dr. Kalliongis is an amazing professor. He is extremely enthusiastic and he genuinely enjoys teaching. If you think that mathematics is fun then Dr. Kalliongis is the teacher for you.

Lectures are a complete snooze fest, but the assigned homework and tests are, for the most part, straightforward. Obviously if you're taking him for Linear Algebra, you don't have much of a choice professor-wise since there's probably only one section. So overall, there are many worse professors who could teach the class--consider yourself lucky.
tags: but the assigned homework and tests are

reviews.comment: Mr. K is SO nice! He wants you to learn the material and will answer ANY questions you have, even if it takes up a whole class. It was 3 tests that, yes, were hard, because it's Diff EQ, but he curves quite well in the end. Really enjoys teaching math, it's funny to watch him get so excited about Eigenvalues. :P
Easy class. 3 exams which will be easy if you go to class and do your homework. I recommend taking him.

This is a challenging course if Math is not your thing. Go to class and pay attention. Make sure that you ask questions and do the homework. The best way to study is to do the homework. Don't rely on him to give you all of the formulas, so make sure you at least look over some of the more challenging sections in the book.

3 tests - that's all! They're hard and not curved. If you're a good test taker than this is your class - but the only grade in the class are those 3 tests... He isn't very clear - I don't recommend him for a teacher!

he is so nice!! it's almost weird how nice he is. he also loves to teach math a lot. he'll sometimes end the class saying, "i had fun today." his tests come straight from the homework but make sure you do it because he will go over as many problems as he has to at the start of next class to make sure everyone understands. GREAT TEACHER!
Dr. Kalliongis is a good teacher. The material is not too difficult. Do the assigned problems, because many of his tests questions come from the homework problems.

Dr. K is amazing. He may talk fast, but he will make sure you know the subject backwards, forwards, sideways, you name it. He will spend an entire day going over homework problems if the class tells him they need help. Tells you what problems are on tests - and sticks to it. Very helpful and easy!
he is terrible...dont take him for this class
I haven't taken every math prof. at SLU, but I'm still confident in saying Dr. K is the best! If you can manage to fit him into your schedule for one of your classes, do it!
Although I enjoyed this class, I thought he was a little unclear in his assignments.
Great teacher. Very clear and explains everything. Friendly and willing to help. One of the best teachers I have had. Great for calc III.
He's a great teacher. He really helps you if you need it. I had him for calc I and only took calc II because he was teaching it. Take this guy's class
Great teacher. Very nice and understanding, really loves math. Test are straight forward. Hes willing to help anyone who needs it.
K is awesome, take his class.

after coming from a hard calc 2 teacher I studied for a total of about 4 hours for the entire semester and my average was a 97. Final was EXTREMELY easy. It was a nice GPA booster, but I hope I dont get screwed over in later math courses
Tells you exactly what is on the test. Never picked up a book until the day before the test and got A's

He is not meant for upper division math classes. He goes through everything very throughly (too much). He takes all his notes directly from the book so if you know how to read you will do fine. Also gets some of the test questions from the book. Easy teacher if you just had Dowdy.
SPECIAL K IS THE MAN!!! HE WASTES NO TIME IN CLASS... WORKS EVERY PROBLEM THOROUGHLY AND LEAVES NO QUESTIONS COME CLASS TIME. TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!
Dr. K is great. He's always willing to help, and his course is the easiest in comparison to the other Calc II and III courses.
Makes class very easy. Would definately choose Dr. K over any other math teacher at SLU.
this guy knows his stuff!
Great teacher and a great class. You really cannot lose with Kalliongis.
awful.

I had him for Calc I through Calc III , honestly the best math teacher I have ever had in my life, he loves what he does, make you appreciate math. Take him , especially if you are in Engineering. Looks like Gomez from the Addams Family!
Great teacher. Very clear and helpful. He gets really enthusiastic about calculus and has math appreciation days.
Easy as mest. If your programs run, you'll get an A

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Greg Marks

reviews.comment: His weekly calculus homework was extremely unnecessarily long (requiring all answers in complete sentences explaining why you did it that way). He also does not use Canvas, instead using his own website that is super janky and hard to navigate. He is pretty clear about his expectations from the get-go, though. Avoid if you can.

Gang, I am telling you, you are not as tough as you think you are. This class was the one I had to dedicate most of my time to. The assignments are so long, it will take you hours to do. There are 3 tests, and if you miss one you get an auto 0. The tests are a max of 5 questions and can even give you negative scores on them. Don't take him!!!!!!!!!

In the history of my college career, this is the first time I failed a test, and I tried my best to prepare for it. He assigns lots of problems on the homework and the problems are hard. The first exam, which I thought I did well on, I failed. However, he is pretty nice. Had to go to his office hours. Not helpful for the general case.
You need a PHD to clearly understand his incredibly fast paced lectures. Choose any other professor if your not trying to be a mathematics major.

This class was my first ever B, and I FOUGHT for it. Dr. Marks is very smart, but isn't great at explaining in a way that makes sense to people lacking a doctorate in mathematics. Don't be fooled by what he puts on the practice exams (it's all fair game), read the textbook before lectures, and utilize tutoring. It'll save your life.

Dont be fooled by the positive reviews. Half our class for our first calc test received scores below a 50 since his tests are only 5 questions, He also has weird standards with how he wants answers. 7 of us dropped midway and switched to another calc professor (took begging). And don't get me started on his homework. Do ur mental a favor and SWITC.

Warning. Please do not take this man. His homework, lectures, practice tests, and tests are all in tangents. He only has 3 tests and a midterm, with the tests being 5 questions each. The practice tests did not reflect the concepts seen on the actual test. Also, he over complicates everything and tutors are unable to help with his hw questions.

If you are looking for a class to take Calculus I, this is not the professor you should take. Although he is a nice guy, I went to the bush student center for math tutoring and the tutor had to take out his Calc 2 and Calc 3 notes to understand the additional questions that are on his homework. You will not have a strong base in calc DONOTTAKE.

His lectures are extremely confusing, unless your really smart in math like im saying extremely smart then think about taking this. Professor Marks is really smart so he complicates everything and makes it seem way harder than it is i would not recommend if you want to learn actual calculus please just dont, but hes nice

Dr. Marks is wildly intelligent and passionate about math. While attending his lectures aren't necessarily required you will want to make sure you attend as he does unique problems that aren't in the textbook but will show up on your exams. He is probably harder than other professors but he will also teach you three times as much. He loves matrices

Professor Marks is interesting, intelligent, and clearly passionate about the course material. Unfortunately he expects you to also be at the level he is in terms of your engagement with the course which entails a lot of time and hard work which could be better spent if you just took an easier professor.

Tests are like 80% of your grade. He's a genius but his lectures are very fast paced, can get really confusing, and it's super easy to fall behind. If math is not your strong subject please do not take this man. Homework is 10-15 questions per week, individual questions might take hours. We occasionally spent entire class periods over one question.

Dr. Marks is a very tough teacher. He appears to be one of the most intelligent and well-read teachers I have come across but expects a lot from his students and is not as receptive to asking for help as some other teachers have been. The homework is a lot. Dr. Marks applies a pretty heavy curve to almost everything we do which relieves much stress

He seems to care about his students and 100% loves math, but not the best professor. I had him for calc 1. he didn't explain the concepts well, only taught via writing on the chalkboard, and most problems given were difficult (homework, in class, & tests). There were 4 tests (including final) & only the top score is your grade

The BEST Math Professor I have ever had. If you are good at math, take him and you will absolutely fall in love with the course, materials, and the way he teaches. DO NOT TAKE if you are not good at math, seriously. You will have a hard time keeping up with how fast he goes. Homework and attendance are optional.

This professor was the worst. He asks many open-ended questions on esoteric subsets of problems but does not teach critical concepts. You are better off teaching yourself this course. He does not synthesize different ideas, and seems to enjoy the confusion and struggle of his students sadistically. There are 3 exams total(noncalculator) DO NOT TAKE

Dr. Marks is hands down the worst teacher I have ever met. He takes pride in seeing people confused when he teaches new concepts and will never explain something in more depth unless you go to his office hours. Also, over half of your grade is decided in the last week of class. The last test and final is worth almost 60 percent of the overall grade
Hard class. Does not give extra credit. Strict grading.

Prof. Marks is a very clear lecturer. He presented material logically and made it interesting, always encouraged questions and rescheduled office hours to accommodate student schedules. He's very approachable, one of the few professors I've had who I felt cared a lot about their students.
A terrible professor. Does not explain in enough detail compared to homework or exams. No wiggle room in exams either; only 4-5 problems per test.

This is the worst class I've ever taken. I have no clue how people can give him anything above a 1. Never take anyclass by this man. This is Calc G (Greg) because it's his own breed of math. 58% of your grade is decided by finals week so don't even go to class. HW is useless w/ each question counting as less than 1% of your final grade, would r8 0

PF Marks is an enigma. He may just be the most confusing teacher I've had in my life but also I come out of his class better. He is a bit robotic but also clearly kind and passionate. The class is hard so hit the books if you want to do well and for the love of god try to pay attention in class and enjoy the ride! Also he programmed his own website

His lectures can be very confusing because he processes math very fast. You won't understand much concepts deeply if you just attend class and not do any extra work like reading, doing hw, or searching up Youtube videos. The materials for the class are also different from other computational math classes so it will be harder to adjust.

Although he is a nice guy and a math genius, avoid his Calc2 class if possible. In class he focuses on overly complex, esoteric applications/extensions. You essentially have to teach yourself everything. He grades very harshly on tests and gives little partial credit. If you have to take his class (like I did), make sure you study A LOT.

Professor Marks is hands down my favorite professor at SLU. His classes are by no means easy, and he makes you work HARD for your grade. He challenges you in ways you never would have expected in math, and I have never learned more in a semester course. If you are truly interested in math, the grade will come with the work you put in.

Awesome professor. Had him for 3550 and 3110 and made me fall in love with differential equations and linear algebra. Incredibly passionate about math. Really cares about his students. Take him if you can; you will learn a lot of math!

This is the worst professor I've ever had in college. Completely does not know how to teach the material and expects you to know everything beforehand. Will most likely be dropping this class because it is nearly impossible. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

I've never had a professor quite like Marks. Highly inrelligent, but lacks the ability to teach and communicate with class. Workload was tough and infuriating considering it's little impact on your final grade. Tutors couldn't help, and if you've never taken a calc class before this one is definitely not for you.

Horrible teacher. None of the tutors could help me. They told me I very Knowledgeable in calculus. However I still manage to a 5 out of 100 even though on one of the questions all I did was forget to simplify and he gave me 0 points on that question. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

He gives homework as if you have no other classes. You'll seriously work on homework for 15-25 hours per week won't understand any of it. Don't bother going to the tutors for help on his homework; I've been to three different ones, and none of them could solve any of the problems I had questions on. Masters' help center is just as useless.

He really cares about his students and knows what he's talking about. The material was just so different that it took time to get used to it. You should spend lots of time outside reading the book and reviewing the class notes to fully understand the concepts. There were only 4 tests and he always promoted his office hours that were almost everyday

I took Calculus II and Discrete Math, and both courses were extremely difficult. I took Calculus AB in high school and did very well, but these courses were very difficult for me to excel in due to a very heavy course load. The homework was worth 6% of our grade in each of these classes, and I worked roughly 25 hours a week per class.

He's one of those professors who is very intelligent but does not really know how to teach. I can learn more by watching Khan Academy than actually going to his lectures. Test are also tough, but the huge curve in his grading scale at least makes them fair. Overall, he's not a nightmare, but would recommend someone else if they fit in your schedule
He is awesome.

One of the toughest professors I've ever had. He has a 20% curve, yet people still do extremely "low" on tests, so DO NOT come into this class expect the curve to save your grade. He is a GREAT teacher, knows his material and can explain, however, WRITES AND PROCESSES math very fast, would be hard to write and keep track. Extremely open to help

Marks is a wonderful teacher. Go to his office hours whenever you can. He is so helpful and will above and beyond for his students. Tests are difficult, but he gives practice exams, do those. His grading scale is very fair, and if you put in effort you will pass easily.

Great Professor. Intimidating at first, sometimes he even seems too smart to be teaching Calc 3. He was extremely helpful during office hours and was very approachable. Although his tests are difficult, the grading scale is fair. You will learn far more in his class than in any other class - and you will really learn the material he covers.

I was scared going into the class because I heard it was impossible. His tests are incredibly difficult but fortunately he is very willing to provide help outside of class and genuinely cares about his students. He will go out of his way to help you (i.e. extra office hours, lots of handouts) great guy.

His tests are super hard. I thought I was failing the class, but ended up with a B in Prob & Stat for Engineers. If I got a B then there are probably quite a few people that got A's...I could never find my P-values in the book's tables..He impossible to reach in office hours sometimes because he will talk with one student as long as it takes.

Recommended, if you're truly interested in learning mathematics. If you just want to get through it, go elsewhere. Tends to teach a bit above the students heads, which isn't a bad thing, as it shows them the next level to strive for. Talks quickly, but will gladly spend as much time as you want/need to clarify. Nice, approachable guy, too.

He is really smart and really loves math, unfortunately his intelligence is almost overwhelming when he is explaining examples. He is really nice, but his tests can be incredibly difficult. He is almost too smart to be teaching Calc III. I am pretty sure I left the final exam in tears. He is a really nice person though.

Dr. Marks is VERY smart and enthusiastic about statistics/math. The material was fairly tough, but it was interesting and the tests were easier than they could have been. Tests were open book and open note, and his grading scale was definately in the students' favor. I highly recommend Dr. Marks' class.

Pros-Incredibly smart and interested in his subject. Very devoted, adaptable, and free with his time. Cons-First two tests, EASY. Last two, RIDICULOUS. I had a very comfortable A before those two. Has trouble dumbing it down. If I can emphasize anything, it would be that he gave me the heaviest workload I have ever received. Huge weekly packets.
none

He's a brilliant man, but his expectations for students are unrealistic. I worked hard on the homework, and sometimes the pHD student math tutors couldn't even help me. Tests are impossible. I just finished calc 3 and I can't even do the tests he gives to calc 1 students. If you want to learn math realistically, and value your GPA, DON'T TAKE MARKS

great prof! you will probably understand concepts during class. but his tsts are really hard! practice tests and homework problems are not the same as his tests. he expects you to use your creativity and work very very very very hard for an A.
Very helpful in class and out, goes out his way to explain stuff, definitely recommend!!

Dr. Marks is a great professor, definitely the best math teacher I've ever had. He made prob/stat fun, and was always willing to help. His examples are interesting, and his class in general is very enjoyable. His class is NOT EASY, but if you work hard, you'll get the grade you deserve.
Brilliant prof.
Hardest class I've taken here, but the professor explains the concepts very clearly.

The last two exams, which were two days apart and comprised 50% of the grade, were based on creativity and not an objective understanding of course material. What should be reserved for Math competitions is the main determining factor of 4 hours of GPA. Your entire semester of work can crumble beneath you at his whim, leaving you nothing to show.

He is a brilliant man, but he can't teach. His inability to teach made me lose more than a letter grade. I studied 24 hours for his final, so I knew all the material, but Marks was still able to screw me over. He put material on the test that we never covered in class; the text was useless. His class was a death sentence to my gpa.

You will learn the material very well, but unfortunately, you won't be tested on the material. Instead, you will be tested on derivations of the material after extreme mutilation. Be prepared for 10+ hours of homework each week and thoughts of suicide after each test.

I actually took four classes from Dr Marks as an undergrad at SLU. I just completed my PhD at another university. :D I am eternally grateful to Dr Marks for the countless hours he spend helping me, and I honestly don't think I would have survived grad school without the foundation he gave me. Wonderful, amazing professor.

EXTREMELY DIFFICULT! Only take his class if you have taken Calculus before. Make sure to get resource books, too, because the one used is AWFUL in explaining anything. The problems he gives are intense. The tests are your only grades, besides some board work, and they are nearly impossible. The only thing I liked was his grading scale. It is LOW!

best math teacher so far at slu! interesting, funny, really smart. u can tell he loves what hes doing, very helpful and eager to explain things to you outside of the class. the first exam was way too long but doable if you remembered everything in the homework.

his explanations are sometimes a little lofty, he is obviously a very good mathematician with a vigorous interest in teh subject but sometimes what he said went over our heads. However, when you tell him so he is quick adn gracious to simplify matters.
Great! I learned more in Dr. Marks' class than all my other math classes put together.

What will kill you in this class is not engaging Dr.Marks. He will answer questions, he will explain any step about anything on the board. He doesn't check homework, but part of the grade is giving homework solutions up on the board.

Hardest class I have ever taken. His tests are only five questions but are nearly impossible. His final if 45% of your grade and you won't have enough time to finish it. Spent 10 hours a week on the homework alone.

The smartest decision I made last semester was to DROP GREG MARKS' CALC II CLASS!! He is too smart to be a professor! Even though we want to study math, maybe not everybody is a genius who can teach themselves calculus. This man is the reason people have to retake Calc II...beware freshmen!

Marks is a nice guy, but a real ignoramous, despite getting a PhD from berkeley. He thinks everyone is as smart as he is, and he makes the tests accordingly, including an impossible final that is worth 45% of the final grade. AVOID HIM

He will give you extra review time if you ask him. But IMO the final is freaking ridiculous. Hardest possible questions and worth 45% of your grade! Even if you were doing well in the class prior to the final, be prepared to bomb if you mess up the final! Silly Gregory, proof by induction is for advanced math students! Not FRESHMAN undergrads!
AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Does not care about teaching. Strays wildly from other sections, paces poorly, and is not interested in offering help (only available 1 hour per day). Waste of YOUR money!

Class is challenging if you can't speak math. Material is very interesting and Marks teaches through example. If you don't understand something, either 1) ask him or 2) read the section in the book. Grading is very lenient. I recommend.

He's very very smart, pretty easy going (especially if you take the Putnam.) Sometimes he gets a distant stare on his face and looks up at the corner of the room, and just rambles about stuff that noone comprehends, then tells you its not on the test. But, it's pretty funny, you can tell it's coming. Overall, not bad if you like Calc.

his logic is crazy, he comes up with the strangest things. It is better to just find a study buddy in the class than to listen to him because he doesn't understand that you don't know what he is talking about. when asked to explain something he says it in the exact same way that the did the first time.

Excellent Teacher. Absolutely Brilliant. Willing to help like no other. Class is very demanding. Tests are only 5 questions and they are really hard. If you never heard of Putnam you will. Lets just say his homework takes hours and hours when done by a group in his office with his help each week. If you actually work really hard you can learn alot.
Do the homework early in the week to leave time to ask questions - you'll need it. Go to class, do the homework. Easy B, doable A.
Absolutely ridiculous! If you value your GPA, do NOT take this class! I used to like math, but this class made me hate it. He goes way too fast and thinks everyone is a genius like he is.

Insane teacher. Very hard and demanding. he is a theoretical thinker. Final is 40% of the final grade. Very enthusiastic, but his hw problems will kill you. only ONE TA could help with ANY of his homework. Though group work was not permitted on 1/2 the assignments, it occurred regardless.

Difficult? maybe but if you have any question he will help you. Calc 2 is an important fundamental class and should take a bit of your time. Study for the test by using the homework and if you understand it then youll do fine

Enthusiastic teacher, willing to help but if your not a math genius, you'll hate this class. Final is 40% of the final grade so if you bomb it, your screwed. Test questions are unclear and not anything like the homework. I wouldn't recommend him unless your great at math.

Very enthusiastic teacher. 80%=A- now. Very kind. Doesn't take attendance, but go to class because he covers concepts not in book. Takes a genuine interest in how you are doing. He's a math genius. Just talk to him about the millenium problems. you'll learn more than you ever wanted to know. Chooses hw problems randomly and grades randomly too

Gives HW as if Calc is the only class you are taking. Test questions not based on work done in hw nor class. Teaches material not useful for doing well Very Enthusiastic but not focused on teaching course material.Teaches unsolved problems in the history of math.Very random test questions. Unless you know calc 2 frontwards backwards left and right

Dr. Marks is a good guy, very helpful. He makes himself really available to ask questions and is a very easy grader on exams. His grading scale is awesome. Take him if you're serious about learning math, not just getting a class out of the way.

Although his hw problem sets can be hard at times he's a great teacher. I love the grading scale...a 50% is a C...he really makes you work for your grade! Always willing to help and really loves math. He's awesome! :-)

he's ok. he's one of those teachers that's smart but can't really show his thought process very well. he's actually said that he doesn't know how to explain key concepts in my class. hw is hard so find a calc friend in your building. tests are fairly easy. if you go for help sometimes he helps you to get the wrong answer and then takes off points

If you're taking Calc II, take Marks! 80% is an A, and he really knows his stuff. He explains concepts well, and is always willing to help you outside of class. The tests are pretty much repeats of homework and in-class problems. He's also big on group work.
If you took any math at all in high school, this class is just a repeat of it. Easy. Doesn't take attendance, but go to class b/c he'll do homework problems on the board for you.

if uwanna take this class..make sure u get a tutor because he is the most worthless teacher i ahve hadd....talks about one thing in class and assigns something else for hw....if you like teaching yourself, be my guest and take this class..!!!

Marks is a friggin' genius! He's insane! He explains things extremely well and answers any of your questions. It's a tough class but he adjusts the grading for it. I got an A with an 80%! I definitely reccommend his course :0)
horrible. extremely hard.
real good, knows what he is talking about
Great teacher. Only made it to about 7 classes out of the whole sem due to it being a 8 in the morning. Very smart and very fair. If you like math take this genius.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James Gill

reviews.comment: Thinks his class is the only one that matters. Zero empathy for students with jobs, other classes, or personal issues. No flexibility, unrealistic expectations, overwhelming workload, and unclear policies. If you have a life outside school, good luck. One of the most frustrating professors I've ever had.
He teaches very well sometimes it can get a little confusing but he'll still teach in a way everyone can understand.

Warning! This class is very quiz, homework and test heavy, lots of required homework (up to 10 pages worth of work) every week and quizzes every week. Very tough professor, first test had average score of 50%. Teaches too fast and not beginner friendly.

Unless you already know calculus 2 by heart, do not take this teacher. He teaches in a way where it seems like he's reviewing for himself rather than teach the students.
