There have been many occasions where he pulls out a random sign in an equation and doesn't explain it. It's test heavy and the homwork is insanely long. 10 pages a week average.

Dr. Gill's course is a rather challenging introduction to Calculus, however, he is extremely knowledgeable on the subject, and gives pretty good lectures. He has a no-nonsense kind of attitude, which is rather unpopular with many students, but I appreciated his commitment to the subject. Take him if you care about learning something interesting.

Please refrain from considering him if you can; I urge you to take this advice seriously. Disregard the positive reviews and pay attention to this one: the class is barely acceptable, but it is unpleasant, and he is not an effective teacher.

Dr. Gill is one of the better math teachers I have had at SLU and that is saying quite a bit because I have been pretty happy with the faculty in the math department for most of my classes. Dr. Gill was very understanding of how tough the material is in real analysis and he communicated his expectations well.
Very knowledgable about the material and lectures were excellent. Also pretty funny at times. Tests can be pretty tough and he assigns a lot of homework, but if you want to learn his class is great.

If this is your first time Calculus, he was quite difficult to learn from. His examples in class do not meet the level and problems that are put on the exams. He provides study guides only sometimes and no answer keys are provided.

Dr. Gill was extremely knowledgeable about the course material but also good at explaining it. His lectures were concise and well thought out. He assigns a fair bit of homework but almost always takes time at the beginning of class to go over it. Highly recommend taking from him if you have the opportunity.

Dr Gill made a very difficult subject very accessible. His expectations are clear for exams. The homework is very difficult, but thats because Analysis is difficult. Would highly recommend taking. His lectures are also entertaining. Reminds me of Shawn from Psych.
He's making students take math final exams in a "verbal form." It's a huge comedy and disgrace. The hws are unnecessarily difficult when compared to the exams.

Dr. Gill gave tons of homework and extremely hard tests that were unpredictable. But, he made himself extremely accessible outside of class. Honestly, I would avoid taking his class, because he expected much more from a student than any of the other math department professors at SLU, unless you're taking physics. He taught

Dr. Gill is a very proficient instructor; he knows how to teach concepts unlike many. But he does not "go easy" on students when it comes to homework, test questions, and grading. If you want to learn Calc 1 really well and build a good foundation for higher math classes, take Dr. Gill. If you're just trying to fulfill a requirement, do not take.

If you like lectures that give a ton of examples Professor Gill is your guy. During Calc 1 he gives a lot of homework and gives us homework quizzes every friday, but if you do all the homework correctly you will do well on the quizzes. The tests are similar to the quizzes/homework so if you do well on those you should be fine.
Very great professor. Giving high scores for your quizzes even if you make a few mistakes.

Dr. Gill is an excellent lecturer, and does a great job of providing context for the mathematical topics covered, which is particularly helpful in this sort of course. He will not hand out easy A's, but if you put in the effort and ask questions, he is more than happy to answer them.

Showed up to class almost everyday, paid attention, and did the homework. It was pretty easy. He clearly understood the material. First time teaching the course, but you wouldn't know it. Show up and listen and you can get an A.

Professor Gill is a great instructor. I am not the best at math, but he explained topics clearly which made the material much easier. He's also funny, so that makes class go by a little bit faster. Although his tests are difficult (he's the only math professor I know to give truefalse questions) I think he cares about the success of his students.

You have to write papers because he is a math researcher. He gives you a ridiculous amount of homework problems and it doesn't pertain to the test or homework at all. He belittles you in class and at office hours. When asked questions he will almost say duh with his answer and his rudeness. DO NOT TAKE.
He is a very tough professor and as of right now about half his class including me are below a D+.
Not helpful at all, when asked questions will go completely around them. But, always very persistent on coming to office hours where he is of no help.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Asma Zangana

reviews.comment: Not to rake with her. She has no books and she wants students to look for lectures. She requires students to spend about 10 hours on work only without studying for exam

I actually MTH 220 Analytical Geometry and Calculus 2 with her at St. Louis community college at Forest Park. She is a great Teacher, who cares about her students. Her classes involve short lectures and all of the notes are online. Time is given in class to try problems and her explanations are good. Couldn't recommend more, just hard class.

I'm not the best at math but this class felt especially difficult. Prof Zangana is an amazing person, but her teaching style just didn't mesh with me. There are times when she moves very fast and on homework, you're often times left to fend for yourself in terms of finding out how to do some problems. Love her but the class was not for me.

All tests are open note and she's very understanding when it comes to scheduling conflicts throughout the semester. As a person working full time the statistics class itself is a lot of work, but she did a good job answering any questions.

I had taken a Statistics course over the Spring semester and didn't receive a B or higher need for nursing school. So I signed up for Professor Zangana online/hybrid 6-week summer course and received an A. She was accommodating, ensured we understood the information and was a great professor. I have all good things to say about her.
I have no bad things to say about Ms. Zangana. She's caring, does her job great, and is a reasonable grader. She's easy to talk to and will do whatever she can to make sure you succeed.

The way she has her online class set up is so absolutely ridiculous. She has you relying on other students (no matter if they're not participating) for an overall grade in group projects. The workload is ridiculous, and she is slightly sarcastic. I write this now because I couldn't even wait until the semester was over to rate her.

If you want a certain grade, she will do everything she can to get you to your goal. She truly cares about her students succeeding, and she is good at what she does. The only critique I could give her is to be more strict, believe it or not!

Zangana is great. She tailored the class to what the students wanted. Very clear about what was going to be on the tests. It was almost impossible not to get an A in the class, even if you didn't show up

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael May

reviews.comment: A teacher that does NOT teach. Expects people to already know how to do stuff, and is not helpful when reaching out for help. If you're seeing this, please retire.

Had this guy for Calc II—he's got a reputation, and yep, it's deserved. Nice enough guy, but you won't learn much. It's not that the material's hard, it's just that he doesn't teach it. You'll be teaching yourself the whole time. If you're into self-study, you'll survive. If not, good luck, ‘cause you're gonna need it.

Honestly, the class by itself is not super hard, however, the professor you have can change this fact. I didn't leave class feeling as though I learned something new and if anything was even more confused. Get ready to go home and teach yourself. There were NO helpful test preparations.
he did not give us a study guide for any test/quiz and when we wanted to know what was going to be on those tests/quiz he would not tell us specific chapters

I found this professor's teaching style challenging for students without a strong math background. Explanations often felt cryptic, making it essential to be well-versed in mathematical terminology. Attendance is mandatory and exams constitute 63% of the grade. Expect to spend 3x the amount he suggests on studying split between HW, recitation, etc

I had May as a substitute for a few weeks as my prof was ill. His lectures were rough at best. We spent most of class doing warmups and then learned nothing about the concepts. Avoid him if you want to go on in math.

He's a great person, but not the best teaching style. Sporadic & will call on people & ask questions about the reading, so read the notes before class! Only 4 exams but 1 weekly quiz, 3 reading assignments & HW assignments a week + the gateway. He goes really fast and it's hard to read what he writes sometimes. He has decent office hours though.

It's just not worth it. Father May himself is a nice person but it's quite possibly the worst style of 'teaching' I've ever seen. Each class he spends half of it doing a couple warmup problems and the last 10 mins is rushing through the material from the textbook, which is terrible. His lectures are god awful, but his exams and quizzes aren't bad.

Very nice professor but did not teach much at all. I dropped his class after the first week because I knew I would probably fail the class since he did not teach and there was no guidance at all. He seems like a very nice person but should not be teaching math.

Bro please just do not take him if you can unless you're confident you can teach yourself Calc II. Only good thing about him is that his practice exams are very similar to the test, but they're both still extremely difficult, no answer keys either.

His "method" of teaching is terrible. He doesn't lecture but instead spends half the class time to do 3 problems from last class, where he constantly makes mistakes and it takes so long to get through, leaving no time to learn the new material, but nevertheless, he moves pass the new material anyways as if he just taught it. Don't take him.

He makes our lives difficult by not teaching properly and expecting us to do the reading assignments without clear guidance. He often makes mistakes. Additionally, the due time for assignments is unusual and inconvenient, as it is one hour before midnight. Overall, I would not recommend him as a professor, but he seems to be a nice person.

Father May's class was frustrating. Getting a hold of him was hard. Grading took weeks to a month, and assignments lacked due dates, making them hard to find. His struggles with technology made everything more difficult. Would not recommend if you value your sanity, not to mention he consistently was very rude. Luckily he is not a hard grader

fr may is a tough teacher. if you miss 5 classes, he drops your grade by a letter. if you get under a 70% on a test, you are required to come to office hours twice a week for the rest of the semester or get a 0 on the rest of the tests. (calc 2)
Rude. So Much Homework Given. Such A Difficult Class. A W F U L.

class is a heavy "do it yourself" class. He tends to make lots of mistakes on his won calculations whether it be during lectures or on answer keys on tests and quizzes. Make sure to double check his work. He has group quizzes on fridays and every friday after an exam he'll have a solo quiz are over the most missed questions. No calculator is needed

I want to submit an update after I wrote a review that may have been unfairly mean about Abstract Algebra. Father May has been substantially better in linear algebra, and is one of the most accessible professors I know. His style is perfect for a class where you have some foundation to build off of to go deeper. Exams are very fair as well.

I hope this will be a balanced and fair take of Dr. May. Abstract Algebra was Legitimately awful. It shatters all expectations. I'm here to say that is a good thing. Many people want math to be told to them and expect that going to class and listening is enough. The truth the Dr. May reveals is that you and your classmates are your best teachers.

I have never understood a class less. I took Abstract Algebra with Professor May and cannot tell you more than 10 things I learned this semester. Class lectures are incredibly unhelpful, I relied on the text book for any learning at all. He is an incredibly nice person and is available to his students, but even that couldn't help with this material

Abstract algebra is hard. Prof May made it much harder. Especially at the beginning, incoherent classes, did not prepare any material. He just expected us to read an extremely difficult textbook and even know where to begin asking questions. Gave no feedback on homework prior to the first exam, a month into school. Nice and accessible person tho.

For students thinking about taking a math course at SLU with Fr. Mike May, you need to reconsider. He obviously understands the content, but does not teach it well at all. He uses a textbook that he wrote called "Business Calc With Excel" (on the internet), and it is horrible. I spent 16 hours a week on his class and still struggled. Do not take

He gets off topic sometimes but if I asked him to clarify something he never had a problem with it and explained very well. He gives lots of quizzes throughout the week but most of them you can take in groups and he drops the lowest at the end of the semester. He also allows as many tries as you need to get 100 on the homework

Yeah, I got an A in the class but it's only because I already took Calc. Fr. May is a nice person but he cannot teach. He is not very good at communicating. Also, he gives AT LEAST 1 test/quiz per week. Sometimes two. You also have all types: individual quizzes, group quizzes, tests, practice tests, practice quizzes (the last two are rare). Nope.

He's a nice person and he wants you to pass, but he is a terrible teacher. He drops 2 of your lowest quizzes and most are done in groups. He also gives practice tests that are similar to the real test. There's a lot of homework and I constantly went to tutoring because he doesn't teach well. Overall you can pass the class but it's a lot of stress.

He does not email back ever so don't expect him to. I asked for an extension on the homework from the first week of school because I transferred in late and he still hasn't responded and keeps pushing off appointments I've set up. This class is literally the worst class i've ever taken at slu because he doesn't help at all.

I had already taken Calc1, so the class wasn't too bad. He will try to trick you on tests. He is very smart and nice, but that does not help him teaching. He wants people to ask questions, but most people don't. He gives tests from previous years which is a godsend. Most quizzes are taken as a group. If you live in Nert, he can help at any hour

Very very sweet man, just a terrible teacher. Attended every class and scheduled tutoring each week and still barely got by. Exams contained nothing discussed in class. It is a self-taught class. I learned nothing from his teaching. He does give you the opportunity to raise your grade with dropped assignments but exams tank your grade anyway.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. You read material before class and he goes around the room asking what the reading was about until someone gets it correct. Completes an average of two problems in class and tells you to solve it without explaining anything. Tests are completely unfair when compared to what is taught in class.

Hardest class ever. Lots of homework and its really hard. Tests are somewhat unpredicatble, but he gives you past tests to study from. Sometimes hed put questions that we had never even gone over. it seemed like he expected students to already know all the material

Avoid father May like the black plague. His explanations of concepts are good, but he does a terrible job explaining how to apply the theories and theorems. If you ABSOLUTELY MUST have May for math, study the previous tests to a T. They are very similar. But for the homework, good luck. I struggled through it all. (p.s. it's all online).

SLU's math dept sucks in general, but May takes the cake. Don't take him if you can avoid it. If you have to tho, don't bother with tutoring--they can't help. The HW will make you want to kill yourself, but they're doable. Study the previous tests like there's no tomorrow, bc his only saving grace is that his tests are almost identical.

Father May's class was one of the only math classes I have actually enjoyed in my life. He makes you read a section per night, and you have a 1-question online quiz on it--with unlimited tries. He assigns homework two Friday's out, and it is easy. There is a group quiz every Friday, and he posts 5 practice tests before each test, 4 total.

He assigns a lot of unnecessary homework, but if you complete all the homework (yes, you should actually read the textbook) and pay attention in class, it's an easy A. He also allows you to take group quizzes which helps a lot. If you have questions, ask! He will only clarify if he feels like students don't understand.

If you are not mathematical savant, you will find this 'Professor' ridiculous. He doesn't know how to teach, he cannot instruct, and his helpfulness is nonexistent. May is a nice enough guy, but has no place in education. He will not explain what he shows you. He sometimes has difficulty helping cause he forgets the answers as well. Skip this guy!

Nice guy but class is tough. If you make less than a 70 on the test you are forced into going to office hours or else you'll make a zero on every assignmenttest. Lectures are confusing & the only way to understand them is to already know the material.

Fr.May knows the material, however he cannot explain it to save his life. His reading quizzes are set up as one question, so if you're missing anything, webwork won't accept your answer. No make ups on test, even if you're traveling with a D1 sport w/ a note. No curve on any test. Loves taking off points for any reason. If you value learning, avoid

I recieved a bad grade but not for lack of effort and an attempt to meet with Fr. May outside of class and get assistance in other ways. He is a bad teacher who is unable to clarify a point unless you happen to be an extremely gifted math student. Stay away from Fr. May at all costs.

Absolutely worst teacher I have ever had. He looks for reasons to take off points and he cannot explain the material to save his life. The weekly quizzes were difficult and the test would have questions that had not appeared in the homework, text or in class. Even though more then 50% of the people failed the test he would not put a curve on it.

I never understood what he was talking abnout in class. Not only is he hard to follow but he is also uber boring. I thought I was going to fail his class until I studies for a week straight before the final and pulled off a B. If you can avoid the class do it.

Took May's Survey of Calc on Excel. The entire class was confused, he moved too quickly and couldn't teach. The homework assignments never made sense because we were barely taught the material. Extra credit is useless because we weren't taught that either. Doesn't respond to e-mails or show up for office hours. However, he does give study guides.

The class was really difficult, but I somehow pulled off an A. There are really hard quizzes every Friday, but they were the best study guides for the tests. The quizzes aren't worth much of the final grade and he drops the lowest 2 quiz grades. I thought they really helped me prepare for the exams. The homework was useless.

In beta class for MATH 132 w/Excel. Really hard to follow. The entire class is failing but he wont do a curve. Almost all quizzes and homework are group (you form study groups at beginning). Offers extra credit, but moves very quickly so odds of you knowing the material for the extra credit is slim. Excel portion makes sense. Wont answer email

He doesnt talkdown/insult students. he just expects you to be more advanc than u should be hes a genius so its hard to relate. if he did i would have been one them. Hes act an aright guy. His lectures are all over the place though,will spend half class on a useless prob. studying with group is only way i did well. he gives u old tests to look over.

Very smart, but does not know how to teach. Somehow dept. head. Allows groups for most hw and quizzes. Only way to pass the class, he even says so at the beginning of class. Expects too much in reading, hw, and quizzes. Does not relate to students. Therefore as said talks down to students. Do not take.

ridiculous professor. expects you to have knowledge of calc, finance, stats, and accounting in a class lower than precalc. often fails to inform the class of impending assignments due online and expects you to find them yourself. not fun, very irritating, very easy to get distracted.

He likes to spring random questions on students and regularly talks down to students. He gives a TON of homework. He lets you work in groups and take most quizzes in groups but sadly that's about the only way most people pass the class.

Fr. May left me more confused about calculus after this course than i was before i took it. This man cannot explain anything relevant to the class. If he uses examples, they are useless and extremely difficult questions that he calls "foreshadowing" for future courses. Wonder if its possible to go to confessiom to tell him how bad he is
This man cannot explain himself to save his soul (and he is a father). He might be the department head however he is useless. My advise would be if you are in his class you should drop right away.

The man uses Maple more than he does actual teaching. He tries to explain things, but he is just a horrible teacher. If you want to teach yourself, take him. If you want to be taught, and understand the material, take someone else. There is a reason he only teaches one class a semester!!!

Knows his math, but doesn't quite teach it well. Not many notes on the board, you just have to kind of get it off the bat, or teach yourself. If you actually READ and understand the book, do the homework, and study from the study guides you will do fine. He is helpful during office hours and really does want you to understand the material.

This guy is horrible. He thrives on an array of difficult material which he barely summarizes in lectures but expects fill competency on homework and exams. Dont expect any problems he does to be complete or well concieved and avoid his classes at all costs- he clearly has brilliant understanding and expects us to reach his level independently
very nice guy, but horrible teacher, i leave class more confused than when i entered, rarely does examples, and it doesn't help that the book is horrible, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS IF YOU CAN!
Does not give examples of problems in the homework. Problems on Tests and quizzes are wordy and confusing. Answers questions with questions. DOES NOT TEACH THE LESSON.
Good guy, but he is confusing. He answers my questions with more questions.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Phil Huling

reviews.comment: this class is free if you have prior coding knowledge. if not he has everything pretty much laid out for you on his website. i barely went to this class or studied and still did fine. he doesn't really put grades into canvas. he keeps it all on his computer and will show you your grade if asked. the final was IDENTICAL to the two semester exams.
Went into the final not knowing my grade in the class. Slow grader, do not expect feedback on your work. Little to no structure during class and when he helped you was often times demeaning.

Dr. Phil was a decent calc professor. If your not math oriented you'll struggle a bit, but he has clear office hours and there are lots of resources to help you. Do the homework, it helps, and DO THE EXTRA CREDIT. the whole semester is a few quizzes, 2 tests, homework and a final, so be prepared for them. If youre visual hes great because desmos.
Very slow grader. He was a very nice guy and friendly. I have no idea what grade I have and finals have just finished, he did not put anything in the grade book all semester provides zero feedback.

His lectures are kind of hard to follow because he goes very fast. Expect homework assignments every single night, sometimes multiple per night. You can tell he knows what he's talking about, and he will answer questions. However, since he is so used to doing math, sometimes he will forget that he's talking to a room of people who don't know math.

Nice guy, but awful professor. Insanely unorganized and has yet to grade a single assignment (including 2 exams, and 3 projects). There are less than 2 weeks left of the semester, and I have absolutely zero clue what my final grade is going to look like. Don't bother.

Funny and nice professor but horrible at grading and explaining concepts. I took AP STAT in high school and thought this would be an easy class. He very poorly explains the actual statistics concepts and instead just shows you how to put them into r studio. It's almost Thanksgiving and he still hasn't graded anything, no midterm grades were given.

A good guy, but his class is absolutely awful. Would be significantly better if he actually graded things at a reasonable pace, but he doesn't. It took him a month and a half to give back one of our projects (with no feedback), so it's difficult to navigate your grades until the end of the semester. He also gets somewhat condescending when asked.

Caring & funny guy, nothing bad to say about him personally. His class was not my favorite. There were 3 tests & a final, 3 group projects, & 1 article report. Although there was originally supposed to be more projects and article reports. He is a very, very slow grader. Uses MyLab/Pearson for lectures & homework. Doesn't explain things that well

He does not grade at all...the final is tomorrow and there is still 3 ungraded projects. Exams are all free response and he gives no feedback on mistakes so you don't know why the points were taken off. In class instruction has no relation to exams but he gives class time for homework and answers homework questions. Nice person but horrible grader
Never taught and does not grade at all. You are responsible to teach yourself everything.

I would not recommend this professor if it's something that you actually need to learn, and not just a filler class. He didn't really have "lectures", he just kind of read from the textbook and explained it from there. Attendance isn't mandatory, but I would not recommend skipping because there no way to see what you missed if you do.

His class was kinda difficult. His tests are all theory based and all free response. You should be prepared to write a lot. The homework assignments are pretty easy to complete, but can be very time consuming. I would recommend his class if you have to take a math class, but if you don't have to take it then don't.

I will admit, my heart wasn't in it for this class, however, I've taken a precalculus before and retook it again to just reinstall my knowledge before taking Calculus. If you are not a mathematically minded person, passing his class will take a lot of outside work. His lectures are very short and not in depth. He often uses Desmos to teach.

webworks have a 'due' date but he reopens the whole chapter at the end of each chapter so try to take pics of the solutions. scales the whole class to make sure (nearly everyone) passes since his tests are so hard (40s on tests become 70/80s). i put barely any work in and there's no way i should've passed. group quizzes and he provided a book.
Favorite professor I had
For this class- reading the book, doing practice problems, and showing up for class is a must if you want to do well. In addition, he gives a lot of partial credit on tests.

This class was extremely challenging. Professor Huling was nice for the most part, but the assignments were terrible. Textbook work was due at the end of each unit before the test. Granted, I often put off doing the work throughout the unit, but the workload was insane, taking several hours each time. Rarely responded to emails promptly.

Dr. Phil has a large ego and I never found his lectures helpful. However, I was able to pass the class by filling out the guided notes. The exams are difficult, but he bases them off of the reviews and practice exams. Also, if you show your work, but dont get the answer correct he does give a lot of partial credit. Lots of teaching yourself!

SO narcissistic, had to withdraw from his class. He always shows up late/cancels class. The FIRST time he actually wrote a problem on the board was after 2 full weeks of school. You have to teach yourself. When I asked for studying tips, he just said "hmm couldn't tell ya, I slept through undergrad, but ended with a 4.0 GPA" ... like bro did I ask?

This mans likes to cancel class too often, then when we have class he doesnt explain things well. Ive learned more from online videos than himself, and then his exams are impossible; homework is easy points, though. Whoever said he was eye candy on this site is lying to you. Dont take him, youll regret it.

I took this class asynchronously and it was terrible. The course itself isn't difficult considering it consists of unlimited attempts to weekly online assignment problems, take home tests, and worksheets. Professor Huling does not respond to emails for days/weeks after submitting, is late on returning assignments, and does not give feedback.

Calc II, one of the hardest Calc classes, and instead of giving lectures - even asynchronous lectures - we get nothing. He has uploaded a couple videos going over problems but that's it. He doesn't go over the material. It's an entirely self taught course. Do not take him for any online class, especially Calc II.

Just the worst. Thinks hes the smartest person in the world and does not understand when students don't understand. Barely teaches and has impossible tests. Luckily he grades super easily because everyone does bad. Switch out unless you want to be sad.
Sometimes I wonder how much different my life would be if I didn't take his class, I would be happier.

I took his hybrid online/one class a week and it was a solid class. The worksheets he gives are difficult but he is more than willing to help. Office hours can be a bit random and he is often not there. Test questions are taken entirely from textbook

I'm in the specialized new class (only meet once a week). Whole class is an unrealistic workload. Over 100 homework problems due most weeks on Monday, a 10ish page packet on Wednesdays. Can't learn the material because you're always scrambling to just get it done. Worksheets in class are impossible and you can never get them done but still graded.
I haven't seen this man in four weeks. Should up for the exams only. Didn't cancel class though???

Huling is just unable to teach. Many students in the class failed and dropped out. He only uses Desmos (graphing calculator) to teach. He refuses to answer emails and questions, cancels office hours, and classes. I just sit in class learning nothing. Earned an A+ but had to teach myself. He give answers to homework if he can't explain the concept.

Dr. Huling is clearly a very intelligent, savvy man. Imagine a powerful frame wearing indoor soccer cleats to every class. However, his inspirational lectures are oftentimes easily distracted from by his distant gaze. Take this class for the eye candy.

Dr. Phil was absolutely awesome for Calc II. I went in fearing it would be my most difficult math class and he did an amazing job at teaching it. Tests were difficult but he was more than fair with grading. Would absolutely recommend if you actually want to learn lectures were interesting every day. Great teacher, but an even better person.

Absolutely terrible teacher, would highly recommend against him. He is so intelligent that he can not teach a basic course such as Pre-Calculus. Would recommend taking the class at a community college or other place. He apoligized at the end of the semester for being a bad teacher due to persoanl issues. Overall great guy but he is much too smart

If anyone could be a spokesman for Desmos, it would be Phil Huling. He uses it every class. He's a very intelligent man, but it is difficult to learn from him. I often got distracted by the fact that he kind of looks like Dexter, but I think he is a good man deep down. He takes a VERY long time to grade tests.

Only grades are exams and 100 points for online homework (600 total). All test questions came from Chapter Reviews, so if you did them and memorized the answers, you're guaranteed to get at least a B on the exam, if not higher. He took a while to get grades back, but bumped up our exam grades if it took too long.

He's the easiest calc professor i've ever had! I took the class online over the summer so he gave us a lot of opportunities to get an A in the class. 3 exams, a couple quizzes, online hw, and a final! The exam questions come right from the textbook and he's considerate about how busy people are in the summer! Just takes forever to reply to emails!

Never have I met someone more genuinely enthralled by the subject of Calculus. Dr. Phil gave lectures that left me thinking and genuinely interested in the subject matter every single day. Furthermore, he is the most caring professor I have had at SLU so far. He really wants his students to succeed. His class is tough, but he is more than fair.

He's a good, approachable guy, however, he does have a specific teaching style. He will speed through topics and then give a few days to work on problems regarding the topics he covered. He won't go through specifics because he assumes you read the section before class. He is happy to answer questions, and he is very patient if you are confused.

This professor doesnt know how to teach. He expects you to know & understand everything with very little to no explanation of problems/chapter lessons. The class had no structure at all, no lesson plans made.. just lazy professor overall.

He never actually teaches. It's like he just expects you to know everything. I am usually okay at math but I really, really struggled in this class. He is not helpful at all in answering questions. Talks really fast and expects you to know everything without his help. Purposely tries to mess you up on tests.

DOES HE KNOW WHAT TEACHING IS? He stands in front of the board and does his version of the problem then erases it before you can comprehend it, all without explaining anything. I have never met a worse professor.

Teacher taught decently. Homework was a bit unreasonable in terms of length but it you got unlimited try's to solve it so it was just a matter of putting in the time. All his test questions were pulled right from the chapter guides in the back of the book and offered lots of extra credit. Also, his final was word for word the study guide.

Tough teacher but very fair. If you do the homework, read the chapters in the textbook (one chapter 15 every 2 weeks so not too bad), you should do fine. Weekly quizzes that you can take in groups which helps if you're not always on top of your game like myself. 3 tests (drops lowest) and a final. He pulls almost all test questions from the book
HORRIBLE teacher! HE WILL SURPRISE YOU AT THE END

He gives us just 4 pop quizzes in whole semester then he counted as 25 % of your overall grade. He is an unjustifiable teacher. Also we could not focus on his lectures because every 5 min he stooped lectures to look to his email on his apple watch.

Dr. Phil seemed reasonable at first, but then told us homework was likely not to be graded, then changed his mind. I thought I would receive at least a B in the course and received a D, not due to lack of understanding. He will not have any pity on you, but he expects you to understand his personal situations. Do NOT fall behind in his classes.

Dr. Phil is a fantastic math teacher. He really cares about improving his teaching skills also and readily takes feedback from his students on his teaching style. He expects students to put time in outside of class but will not hesitate to help you if you reach out. He can be a tough grader but is always fair.

Calculus is generally not an easy class, you have to put work in. Huling is an extraordinary teacher. He adds humor to the class and gives off a relaxed feel. Homework is required but it helps boost your grade. He teaches the class by providing a lot of examples. If you ever feel behind, he is always there for office hours and happy to help!

He's a nice guy, but unless you've taken math all your life and are good at it, this class will be a challenge. There are only two tests and a final as far as exams go, so if you fail one you're stuck. He's very good at math and doesn't seem to understand that not everyone else will get the concept as fast as he can. Would not recommend.

If you really like math or have been good at it all your life, this is the guy for you. otherwise, find someone else. doesn't dull down the material at all. it was hard to keep up. pretty easy going though.
Very Nice Guy! Very Knowlegeable in Mathmatics. However his class was difficult because I thought he didn't explain things very well.
Very relaxed, helpful and approachable. Quizzes and bonus hmwk problems were done with a group. When exam grades were not very good he offered several opportunities to boost grades.

Phil Huling is a great guy and his class is challenging but not an impossible A. If you put time and effort into it you can get a good grade. Also, he tends to give a lot of free points away, whether it be bonus problems, a free 100% on a quiz or a makeup test if people did bad. Do the homework and keep up!

Phil Huling is an IMPOSSIBLE teacher. if we would not have been allowed to have groups for all quizzes and homework i would have failed his class. Too much homework and too difficult of tests. he does give extra credit but it is near impossible for a student with normal math capabilities.
Overall, nice guy but HORRIBLE teacher!

This class is brutal by itself, but with Huling, it is downright impossible! He copies from his notes straight to the chalkboard, then talks to his notes/papers. It is impossible to keep up with him! He grades a little too harshly, I think. He also bases too much of grade on tests/exams. So miss one, and you're screwed. Overall, would not recommend

I didn't do so well in his Calc I class, but then I didn't study much either. Phil is a good guy, and he really loves math. He calls math problems "cute". He is a good professor and can relate to students' situation. He gives out TONS of extra credit, and also a project to help boost your grade. Calc I is hard, but if you make an effort, he'll help
The class is hard but there is soo much extra credit just stay up with the homework take the class!
Phil will not let you fail. The class isnt easy, but the tests are very hard. There is, however, FAR MORE than enough extra credit, so going to class is a pretty good idea.
tags: FAR MORE than enough extra credit

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Bryan Clair

reviews.comment: Dr. Clair is a great professor. Weekly group projects but you shouldn't have to work on them outside of class much

I have had Dr. Clair before and he always is a great professor. He is very kind, relatable, and accessible outside of class, and he is very reasonable. He records all lectures, he assigns interesting work, and he accepts HW extensions constantly. The class also seems extremely relevant for future reference. The textbook was free. Excellent course!

Bryan Clair was just such a great prof. I have never met someone more excited about statistics and he did such a good job at making the class engaging. Weekly homework and tests aren't easy but if you go to class you'll be fine!

Best Professor in the department! Took him for Time Series and it was the best decision. Extremely caring and flexible and the work is doable. He is humble and is always walking around in class to help!

Outstanding professor! Foundations was a fast-paced course that covered a lot of mathematical stats, computer-aided data manipulation, and such. Dr. Clair writes his own textbook but offers it for free. He is very knowledgeable about the material and how it fits into the scope of math as a whole. Homework is tougher than exams but he offers help.
Great professor, one of my favorites at SLU!

New project every week, but I rarely had to work on them outside of class. They're all group projects and you get time to work on them in class. Class structure is the same every day, which can get kind of boring. Starts with lecture then ends with time to work on projects. Overall, should be a pretty easy A if you show up and pay attention.

I got the chance to do Mastery Grading with Dr. C and it was amazing. He found a way to take the stress of Calc away so all you had to focus on was learning the material, not the grade. I definitely had to work for my grade but his lectures made sense and he was always very nice and understanding. I definitely recommend.

If you can take another professor for the class, I would recommend that professor. I had to teach myself almost all of the course work because his exams did not reflect what we were taught in class or in the homework.

Professor Clair is a great teacher and makes sure his students understand the concepts. He would give worksheets and walk around to help/answer any questions someone may have. We had a relatively easy 10 minute quiz at the beginning of class Friday and had homework due. The content (Calc 2) was difficult, but Dr. Clair made it easier to understand.
He is very condescending when it comes to giving advice but all in all he likes what he does and in general, he's an okay grader. Homework is a lot of the grade so pay attention to that
nice teacher though

Dr. Clair is a great guy, and a fairly good teacher. He always is willing to help you out with all the material, and his door is always open. He assigns a weekly quiz every friday, and thats really the only time you need to be there besides tests.

Very easy to get an A in this class but it's not for very bright students. You might get stuck with a really dumb group. Material is easy though and the professor makes it very clear. He has lots of office hours, too.
He is the best professor I've ever had. I had him for Probability & Statistics. The material was hard at times, but he is extremely helpful and will make it clear. Go to his office hours!
Class is really fun, took me back to like 5th grade on the way you learn. A lot of in class group work. teacher is anal about homeworks, but the tests are super easy along with the projects
Great guy, loves what he teaches. Explains well during lectures, helpful and gives a lot of in class assignments which pad grade a lot. Reccommend!

Awesome, Awesome dude. He very interested in his material. He makes homework and tests doable. Clair focuses more on his students learning and doing, rather than test taking. Tests are open book/notes. He is kinda a fidgety/nerdy guy, but that is what makes him so cool. His jokes and sense of humor is hilarious, random, and witty.

He is a squirrely and figedty guy but he knows his stuff. He gives a quiz every fri. that is 3 questions long... very easy. Homework is harder than tests and there are only 4 tests with 10 questions on each. He is a tough grader though!! Beware of that.
I felt that he did not want to help when asked to. Also you have to becareful to double check each assignment for points taken off for questions not assigned.

Fabulous! He is incredibly organized and very clear. His notes are good and understandable. He's also a funny guy and always in a good mood. He is very helpful and completely approachable. I would absolutely recommend him!

excellent teacher, excellent programmer, extremely helpful. has a knack for showing you exactly how something works. assigns a project a week, will make you a better programmer if you take note of his comments. sharp, sharp, sharp.

He is not a bad teacher. Better person. Too many projects. It demostrates he doesn't program too much. Doesn't cleary specifies the projects. Bad grading, he will take points of if you write your name bad. That course could be better teached for sure. Gets nervous in class,doesn't stop moving.

Homework every week. Lots of programming projects. Midterm and final. He gives a lot of work but he helps you through and gives examples for the programming projects. Overall a very good professor. Prepare to write everything down, because he puts all of the notes on the board.
No Comments
Excellent instructor--recommend highly.
Math and Art of MC Escher was a new way to look at math. Clair is spastic at first, but calms down and relaxes towards the end. He's a good teacher.
No Comments

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Cody Gilbert

reviews.comment: Wonderful professor--if you have a chance to take a class with him, you definitely should. His lectures were well organized and he was easy to follow along. Tests are average difficulty, as in it's a calculus class, so you have to know your stuff, but it's nothing you wouldn't expect. You are allowed a notecard for formulas.

Note sheets and in-class problems are very helpful. While attendance is not mandatory, you should go to class to keep up with coursework. He records and uploads each of his lectures in case you miss one. The exams are not hard, you can use a note card to write formulas (which is rarely needed) and the study guides are useful. Final exam is not bad.
Great professor, and super chill.
W guy. Kinda want to take him to humphreys

Truly an amazing professor who cares about student success. He's always eager to help and explains tough concepts clearly. He's also generous with partial credit on exams. Overall, the workload isn't too heavy. Definitely take him if you get the chance.

He is a very good professor. I had him for Calculus II and he always provided us with notes for each section, and always went over homework problems. We got reviews for every exam and he made sure we were well prepared. He made Calculus II easy.
Super nice, great teacher, very manageable HW load, go to office hours before exams, give partial credit on exams, all lectures a recorded and posted
Great Professor!
As you can tell by the other ratings, Cody is an S-tier professor by a large margin. If you can take a class with him, do it, and build the rest of your schedule around it, it's worth it.

Cody is an awesome teacher! The material was tough in this class but he explained the concepts really well. He records lecture videos for the people that miss class, and his tests were fair with good study guides.
High key want to gatekeep this guy but he is so good he deserves a perfect 5 stars.

AMAZING PROFESSOR, made me understand calculus, is very down to earth and really nice, one of the best, if not the best, math teachers at slu, hopefully he stays before a bigger college sees what a good teacher he is and snatches him up. if you can take him, take him, if another class is blocking his on degree planner, drop it and take him, trust.

Gilbert is a great professor and I would retake his class if given the chance. He's pretty reasonable with homework, cutting out unnecessary work, and gives take-home quizzes. Almost all lectures are recorded and uploaded to Canvas and reviews are beneficial for test. Overall, great professor.
Extremely fair and reasonable, worked to help students, clear grading.

Mr. Gilbert was an amazing teacher! At the time of this review, it was his first semester teaching. He did a really good job teaching and he definitely knew his stuff. He was very understanding with late work. This class was difficult though, as many calculus 1 classes are, but the homework really helps with understanding the work.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ozlem Ugurlu

reviews.comment: Great prof, she is very knowledgeable and teaches well. Good sense of humor, too. Most teaching is done through online modules that you do in groups, but she is around to help and explain concepts at all times. Overall, she made a tough class easy and enjoyable.

Best math teacher I've ever had. Made discrete mathematics so enjoyable and understandable. She is super nice, sometimes the group work was awkward but because of the class, not her. Attendance is important bc there's group work like everyday but she's understanding and will work things out with you. 10/10, I wish all my math classes were with her!
One of the best teachers. Definitely recommend for Discrete Mathematics.
Very attendance heavy. I personally didn't like her teaching style, but I know some people did. It's mainly note pages that you learn from. Quizes every week over course material.
great

Phenomenal professor. The class itself is tough, but Professor Ugurlu makes it super easy. She explains super complex topics with easy to understand lessons. The one downside is the class is attendance heavy, but you get to work in groups and a bunch of the attendance points are dropped at the end of the semester. 10/10 would take this class again.
Overall a good teacher and very knowledgable in her field.
Really great teaching style and is very interactive with students. A lot of homework but the tests are pretty easy, easier than the groupwork.

Dr. Oz was amazing! Lecture notes are clear, gives group work with test-style questions, very helpful in office hours, wants students to succeed! Gives LOTS of achieve assignments (completion grades, but annoying since problems are harder than her tests). If you took AP calc before this like I did, this class is not harder than the AP version.
Classes are collaborative and she will go out of her way to help you understand the course work

Weekly homework and quiz, and reading assignment before each class. 4 tests + group work the friday before each test. Bonus question on last 2 tests. 4 person groups where each person has a job. Don't be the recorder as it's the only role that actually does anything (writes a group report). Material itself is easy: logic, proofs, sets, some graphs.

Dr. Oz was an amazing professor. Her lectures were good and she took the time to explain difficult concepts that students often struggle with. There is a lot of homework (reading assignments, take-home quizzes, and general homework) but as long as you stay on top of it you should be fine, and they can bring up your grade significantly.

Super caring and wants students to succeed. Has few homework assignments, re-takable at-home quizzes, and 4 tests Test questions covered in the notes and homework, so they're easy to pass as long as you attend class. The lectures are good. Sometimes, her lectures were hard to understand due to her accent, but she takes time to explain and reexplain

Dr. Ugurlu is a great professor and is very engaging. She creates note packets for students to follow along which helps so much with understanding her class. She does give lots of homework and take-home quizzes but they help bring up your grade.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Kimberly Druschel

reviews.comment: Dr. Druschel was very sweet and makes the class very applicable to health science. She is a lenient grader and gives lots of opportunities for extra credit. Exams (quests) are exactly like the study guide and you are allowed to bring a notecard. She also has a sheep farm, which is cool. Lectures can be boring but are engaging if you participate.

Incredibly patient, extremely intelligent, sets up the class so that you have no choice but to do well. Most of the grade comes from group projects that apply to your major, which was a nice change of pace. Exams are identical to the practice exams and you are allowed a notecard. Your grade on the (cumulative) final replaces your lowest exam grade.

Her teaching style is not open to everyone and she does not communicate with the class at all, the entire time you had to fend for yourself and try to learn the material best you could because guess what? the review was nothing like the test!!! tests were long and very hard. I don't recommend her at all especially if you need to move on to Calc 2.

Dr. Druschel is absolutely amazing. She is not only kind and accommodating but also a phenomenal instructor. Everything that I didn't understand during high school statistics, I understood completely by her explanations. She also does easy group projects that relate to our future as health care professionals.

She's very old, but she is very sweet. You do get homework but they are not bad at all. There are a lot of group projects which get annoying but they honestly aren't bad. She gives study guides for the tests which are super helpful. She is not necessarily the greatest teacher, but all the work is easy to learn by yourself. very understanding.

I enjoy her class. There are group projects that help bring your grade up a lot. She is an easy grader and the tests are very similar to practice exams (meaning its super easy to study for her exams). She is good 1 on 1 and eager to help as needed. She is very kind and lenient with due dates and deadlines. Would definitely recommend.

Dr. Druschel is a wonderful teacher. She is not a harsh grader, offers many opportunities for help outside of class, and is very open to reworking quiz and test dates in order to help students not become overwhelmed.That being said, somtimes her lectures can be hard to follow, and she gives a large amount of homework. Overall an amazing teacher.

Test similar to practice test. lets you use desmos during test. homework is busy work, most professors just assign webwork so you cant escape it. office hours are amazing, they will save your grade. one of the most caring professors ive ever met.

Dr.Druschel is very kind. Her lectures are not as bad as people make them out to be. test are similar to review. go to office hours and youll learn a lot. web work is what all math professors use and its busy works. she is probably one of the better teachers you could get for calc one.

Druschel is a caring teacher she knows the material lecturing isnt her strong suit asking questions in lecture helps a lot and she doesnt mind them, likes it when students have questions. All Teachers at slu Use Webwork Which Is Busy Work Cant Avoided It. Test are very similar to her test review. Her office hours are helpful She loves her students

She's a nice professor but explaining isn't her strong suit. If you've taken AP Calculus AB, you will do well in this class. However, if you are taking Calculus 1 for the first time, you will want to choose someone different. The homework varies on toughness but it is usually doable. Tests are similar to practice tests.

Druschel is not the best at lecturing during class but her officer hours are very helpful. She gets tripped up easily during lecture in front of a big group so go to her office hours. her exams are pretty easy, but she uses webwork which can be a pain. on top of webwork, nightly book work is also expected.

It is honestly very disappointing that the university allows professors like her to teach. Anyways, here are my two cents. This class was extremely stressful. She cannot teach the subject and the class is so disorganized, which gives extra stress. She can't teach the subject and we had to learn everything by ourselves. People walk out crying.
She makes my head hurt, very unorganized, doesn't know what she is talking about half the time.

Dr. Druschel is nice, but explaining isn't her strong suit. She allows notecards for exams. And is very accommodating in changing exam schedules to cause the least amount of stress. Even confused about everything I was still able to get B's on the exams. She uses a program called R and it is pretty complicated.

Dr. Druschel is kind and understanding that the majority of her class is taking it because they have to. She is a bit scatterbrained but as long as you do the homework (which is online and an easy 100% every time) and study off the practice test she gives you, you will get an A. She isn't the best at lecturing but you get the info you need to know.
If you show up to class and do the homework, you will get an A. Great professor, very sweet.

She cares alot about her students, but she is an awful teacher. I can tell shes smart, but explaining isnt her strong suit. She is willing to extend homework, IF YOU ASK. Get to know her after class, she sometimes brings her doggie into class! Tests are not close to practice tests, but easy material. To succeed take notes before class from the book
Dr. Druschel cares very much about her students and enjoys getting to know them personally.

Professor Druschel is not a good professor whatsoever. Her tests are ridiculous and she'll expect all of your homework at the end of the year which she doesn't expect in the first half of the semester. DO NOT TAKE no matter your circumstances.

Avoid. Class went 10 or 15 min extra every day. She refuses to review for any tests. Promised easy numbers on the test since calculators were not allowed but gave hard problems. Ran out of time to teach the important material. Assigns homework that is not mandatory and is angry when no one does it.

Dr. Druschel did an excellent job teaching this class. She covered everything that showed up on the tests and was very willing to work with students if you didn't understand something quite well enough.

I did not enjoy this class at all pretty much had to teach it to myself. She knew the information but she didn't know how to teach it. I also didn't enjoy that we were graded on our artistic ability when it was a math class.

Nice lady, I've been to her office hours, and she really wants to help. But she isn't a very good teacher and she gets really flustered when speaking in front of the class. It's her first time teaching the class, but she doesn't seem to know what she's doing when it comes to teaching the subject.
SUPER helpful if you go to her office hours. She really likes to get to know her students and I appreciated it. She also took a lot of class census for when to have tests and quizzes.

Taught everything to myself. She means well but gets flustered in front of the class. Luckily the material for the class wasn't too hard but I definitely struggled way more than necessary because of her poor teaching skills.

Be prepared to learn EVERYTHING YOURSELF. Class time is confusing and unorganized. Tons of HW. Avoid completely. Tries to help but doesn't know how to teach, so it's not much use. Nice lady, but not a good professor at all. Exams are hard because you dont cover even half the info or it was incomplete. DON'T TAKE unless you dont care about your GPA.
Be prepared to teach yourself everything from the book. Makes up each days assignment at the beginning of class, and tests are overly hard compared to assigned homework. Avoid if at all possible.

You will end up teaching yourself all of the material. She might know a little about what she is doing but she can in no way teach. Shame on the University for allowing this lady to teach this class. You can do well but it is going to take a lot of work on your own. Avoid if possible otherwise you will learn to ignore everything that she says

The material for this class was quite a challenge for me, but she is a great professor - does tons of examples from the book (including assigned homework problems) every day, grades generously, and replaces your lowest exam score with the final. My best advice is to try your best to keep up with the homework though - procrastination kicked my butt!

She is a nice lady, and I thought she was a great teacher. She did a good job explaining the information. She was always willing to answer any questions and help you understand the information outside of class.

do the class assignments in class. pay attention to new info introduced, but after that just work on the hw. then you get it done. little to no time in class to work on assignments. she's nice and the projects are easy. open book/note tests and final. they are easy too.

A really nice lady who is always willing to help outside of class and wants everyone to do well. Matlab did not seem to be her forte, but the class covers c++ as well, and moves at a good pace for an introductory class. Makes me thoroughly interested in programming!

This lady doesn't seem to really understand what TEACHING really is. She will always make time out of class to see that you understand and will go out of her way to do so. She is really cool but i wouldn't recomend taking any classes with her unless you have lots of time to learn everything on your own.

This class required alot of work. Her lectures were confusing, but she was very helpful if you asked her questions after class. She wants everyone to do well in her class, and gives a lot of extra credit. I ended up with a b+ even though i did not have a good grasp of the material. very nice lady

I took C++ from this lady. Let's just say this, I don't think she's really a coder. She does random stuff in class, and falls behind what you need to know for you labs. I would say take someone else but for the fact that the CS department as a whole is headed downhill.
take a class from her because you need to pass, not to learn anything. tends to decide what to lecture about and what to assign shortly after class has begun that day.
Very cool teacher, always will find time for you to explain stuff you do not understand. As long as you pay attention in class and do your homework, you will do good in the class.
No Comments
SHE IS SOO NICE, YOU ARE GOING TO GET A GOOD GRADE NO MATTER IF YOU SCREW UP ON HW OR TESTS

Decent Calc III teacher. Seems to get more boring and unclear towards second half of semester. Not a good lecturer, but I actually kinda liked this lady. She was concerned and has a good sense of humor. Tests are fair and she has good grading.
No Comments
She does not collect the homework that she assigns. The tests are pretty hard. Avoid if possible
if you have this teacher, get used to learning it yourself from the book. it's like she's speaking a whole other language to you.
No Comments

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael Landry

reviews.comment: Clear and understandable lectures, grades farily and test follows the lectures.

If you put in the effort to do well in this class, you will do well. He doesn't give insane amounts of homework like the other calc I profs and he is great at answering questions. I would highly recommend taking this class.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Russel Blyth

reviews.comment: When making my journey from Gries to Ritter Hall four times a week, I didn't look both ways before walking across Grand Crossing in hopes that a car would seal my fate and I wouldn't have to attend this class.

Very fast paced course, study every day, and do your homework problems. No use in trying to skimp out because it will come back to haunt you. Not many problems on the tests so each problem is worth 10-15 points so if you miss one your already at a B. Study everything from the in class lectures and textbook. Also the daily quizzes are horrendous.

by far the worst experience i have ever had. i would avoid at all costs. his exams are nearly impossible to finish and his homework are incredibly hard. do NOT take. he is a very nice person though. his lectures are impossible to understand and he makes frequent errors and his handwriting is horrendous. please do not take him.

He's a very nice guy. But he teaches solely by theory; he often doesn't show example problems and just expects you to figure them out. His practice exams, homework, and in-class activities do not at all represent the actual exams you take. He will lecture you about failing an exam and to study better when the highest grade was an uncurved 60%.

Dr. Blyth was an incredibly nice professor who love math. That being said, this class was the single most difficult class I have every been through. The course pace was extremely fast and the exams were extremely unforgiving. Most exams, the class average was a C-D, and he does not curve. If you have to take him, study 3 hours a day minimum.

He's just very hard professor who's tests are a lot harder then the practice exams and his homework's don't always make since. And the in class work is not always very reflective of the class homework's.

Dr. Blyth is truly a good person who is fun to talk to outside of class; however, in the classroom, Dr. Blyth is not great. He sprints through problems and focuses on the theory behind them, often overcomplicating them. He does have very accessible/helpful office hours though and I highly recommend attending them; they're often one-on-one!

Dr. Blyth is one of the worst professors I have had. He arrogantly lectures to us in cryptic and complex mathematical jargon as if we're PHD mathematics graduates. Thank you for ruining my semester, Russell. I learned nothing and hopefully our class boosted your ego! I think Russell loves the idea of being a hard professor.
Fire this man asap
He dgaf
He is a great professor! He teaches very well and the office hours helps a lot. No mandatory HWs . Only downside is that the grades are not curved.

This professor does not curve anything. Our class would have only 1 or 2 A's and the rest would be like D's and F's. The tests are very hard and long. He grades very harshly and will deduct points even if you show your work and get the right answer. Horrible professor who drops people's gpa. Almost failed even though I pulled multiple all-nighters.

If you do not like group work, do not take Blyth's class. He is a pretty good teacher and is somewhat helpful outside of class, but for me my group combined with Calc III being difficult in general I suffered. The homework is not always helpful with the material, but the group work did relate more to what ended up being on quizzes and tests. STUDY!

He was terrible. Did not do anything but proofs in class then gave a bunch of group homework to do and individual work. He then made the tests extremely hard with no curve. Our class through 3 tests had 2 total As and more than 20 Fs

He is a very nice person and has a great personality, but in the classroom his course feel extremely unfair to the student. The class was largely theory based with little to no examples done in class. The tests were extremely difficult and feel impossible to completed during the class period. There was only 1 A on 1 test our of the entire class.

Professor showed up to all classes and taught for the first 30 minutes and then instructs you to work in groups to figure out the days lesson with no problems to use as examples. Tests felt drastically unfair and were not similar to practices tests. The only useful feedback ever received from the instructor was when I went to office hours.

One of the best math teachers I've had at SLU so far and easily the best online. Most of the class was spent figuring out the problems on our own with our groups. However he was always ready, willing, and enthusiastic to help out if you had any questions. If you don't see good feedback on a test, ask for a better explanation & he will gladly help.

Perhaps one of the hardest classes I've ever done especially for an online class. Professor Blyth will push you to the limits on every assignment and test However, Blyth is also there to help you and he was extremely flexible and willing to work around our groups schedule to make sure that we got the help when needed. Very kind and helpful prof.

He was a very hard professor. He gave an ungodly amount of homework and lectures. We pretty much had to learn everything by ourselves. The tests are long with little time. The problems in the tests are long and complicated. The review he gives are not that useful.

Had Blyth for 1510 (calc 1) and actually enjoyed it! It can be challenging at times but he is so accessible outside of class and truly loves helping! HIGHLY recommend going to office hours. Find a good group at the beginning of the semester (you take group quizzes: good group good score).

good teacher but his tests are nothing like the homework assigned. He assigns easy plug and chug and a few difficult ones but on the test you get hammered on difficult questions unlike anything youve seen and almost no one finishes. took hrns calc 2 in high school and Im having difficult time in this calc 1. test three highest grade was 85 no curve

His tests are hard and worth most of your grade. I realized he was a jerk when 3/4 of the class got below a 65% on his test and he said I guess I gave the test to early, but one person got an A so I won't change anything. No curve, extra credit or good grading scale. He's really good at making you feel it's your fault but he's looking out for you.

Dr. Blyth was super sweet and really passionate about math. He tried to help the best he could. He always offered extra help outside of class. Great professor. If you like group work, take this class. Don't let my grade scare you, I just really really suck at math.

I loved Professor Blyth! He is very sweet and did a good job teaching our class. His tests are not difficult and he gives out study guides. There is only written homework and two easy projects. This is a fantastic class to take if you love writing and are interested in mathematical thinking, rather than the math itself.

We pretty much taught ourselves most of the class through groupwork. Make sure you get a good group from the beginning or you're screwed. Don't take this class if you prefer the teacher to do practice problems with you, because he doesn't.
An easy class, but watch out for his testing policy. I was extremely sick the day of one of the tests, and ended up going from a high A at midterm to a B for my final grade.
He is a great professor and is extremely helpful. Great guy that will do anything for his students. I highly recommend this class for non-math majors because it really clicks for that type of mind.

Calc 3 isn't easy but he tries to make it as painless as possible. However If ur like me and hate group work don't take him bc he is a huge fan of it. Group quizzes can screw u over if u have a crappy group.

This class ate my life, and I had taken AP Calc BC prior to taking the class. I lived in this man's office hours,did all the assigned problems, and studied a ton before the tests- and got a A. He's very enthusiastic and helpful- but do not blow off the 'reading quizzes' and the challenging problems he assigns.

I really luv this professor sooooo much~~ He encourage us to do lot of interesting and creative work and I had a lot of fun there. The test is easy, he will provide several study questions and all the questions on the test would be in those study questions~! He made me luv Maths.
He is sooo eager to help you. The class was really interesting. It is my only math requirement and it was wonderful. I am an English major, but I still loved the class.

CLASS WAS A HARD CLASS!! HOMEWORK EVERY NITE HARD TO KEEP UP WITH CAUSE IF YOU MISS SOMETHING YOUR LIKELY NOT TO EVER GET IT!! FIND A GOOD GROUP TO WORK WITH OTHERWISE ITS HARD ON YOUR OWN!!! GREAT FOR QUIZZES THOUGH

Fair. Class requires doing hw every night but if you stay caught up and ask questions on stuff you don't get you'll be fine. Maple is terrible though, don't know why he insists on using that- big waste of time.

This guy is a total genius and a great professor. I agree that he knows everything there is to know about math. Cute accent. Warnings: Class is VERY FAST PACED, and make sure you get yourself a reliable,responsible group for the group work. I had a terrible experience in Calc3 with a crappy group, but a good group in this class made for a good one

Renewed my faith in Math, even if there is hardly any math involved. Very helpful, very willing to review material. Tests are a breeze if you study the review sheets, and the homework paragraphs are free points if you do them.
He's great! He loves teaching, and he's really into math. What more can I say! He's from New Zealand originally and has a cool accent. Just be respectful and you've got it made!
Best math class I ever took (I hate math, btw). And I'm not being facetious. Great teacher.

I hate math and this class was sooo hard for me but he is really really helpful and is willing to spend time with you on the material. He moves fast in class but almost everything is done in groups which is nice. He is always so excited about teaching and is VERY intelligent. I highly recommend him, but go to him for help and don't get behind

Professor Blyth is an extremely hard teacher. His test questions are nothing like the quizzes. He doesn't curve anything. He does have an accent but it's not worth taking his class. The only good thing about him is you get to take all the quizzes in groups.
He's just the greatest.
Very good, clear professor... nice guy.

Nice guy who I think knows everything there is to know about mathematics. Always willing to help his students during class time or office hours. Gives daily homework assignments but does not collect them. Goes through material faster than your average math teacher.
Math is a drug for this man.
Professor Blyth is so nice. His class is challenging and he moves fast, but if you ever need help, he is more than willing to meet with you. I would highly recommend him, plus I love his accent.
He just seems so completly happy to be doing math problems. Makes the subject much more enjoyable.
Dr. Blyth is one of the best instructors I have ever had the pleasure of learning from.
love the accent!

teaching is fast but very clear. this guy knows his stuff. if you like to skip class you had btter be able to read math books with phd understanding. you will work but you will know calculus better than any other class. good for engineers that have to go
No Comments
He's an awesome teacher. You will have to work in his class, but it's worth it!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ana Portilla

reviews.comment: Very difficult to access documents on canvas, tough grader, wants us to follow her own methods to solve problems, has difficulty conveying her ideas and explaining content.

Great professor. Clear and engaging lectures. Homework is helpful in understanding the material. Very organized Canvas page with everything clearly outlined. Provides questions from former exams for preparation for midterm/final exams. Exams questions are hard by content but by the amount of work needed to solve them.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michelle Kreienkamp

reviews.comment: she is very kind and very nice! her class can get boring but she tries to make it fun! there's a lot of pearson homework tho :(

One of the best professors I have ever had, so engaging. Effort needs to be put in but she makes it so easy and if you ever need help she is so good at making it work. So sweet especially if you're on her good side and are engaged.

Mrs. K is a great professor if you don't love math or are intimidated by a math class. She is very understanding and is just like a math mom. However, this stats class is mostly group projects, so beware of that. She does cover a lot of material but in a way it is easy to understand and is flexible with the schedule depending on how the class is.

Mrs Kreienekamp is honestly amazing and the perfect teacher for those who think they're bad or math or don't like math in general. She is genuinely so caring that she pushes back test dates until the whole class understands the material. It's so easy to ask her for help because she isn't judgemental at all. She's hilarious too. I 100% recommend!

Professor Kreienkamp is so sweet. Not only that, but she's an amazing math teacher. You can tell she genuinely cares about her students and she's passionate about what she does. She explains everything clearly and she's organized, so it is easy to follow along in class and understand the homework. She's also goofy, which makes class enjoyable.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Natalie Shivers

reviews.comment: One of the first times I went after class for help she belittled me on my lack of knowledge of Excel- I had no response. Overall, I liked her class because I need structure and it was only one path to pass the class

Do not take her if you struggle at all in math,it will be a nightmare.She is not nice at all and very intimidating which causes students to not ask for help.I think you'll be fine if you are quick and pick concepts up easily in her class.There is "classwork" which you have to sign partner contracts with, alongside the mymathlab which isn't bad.

She was not helpful to me at all and everyday she would assign homework then she realized the students were telling her that she was bombarding us with homework due within every 24 hours and the equations were different containing 26 questions each!

Shivers is a great professor. Homework is assigned after every class and due by the next. It's similar to the notes, so pay attention—they'll help with Friday quizzes and tests. If you're stuck, email her; she's happy to help. Success depends on effort—what you put in is what you get out.
Do not take her class if you are bad at math. She doesn't explain how to do the problems, just writes them down. Quiz or test every week and lots of homework. Tutoring could not save me.

Probably the worst teacher I have ever had. I do not ask questions in very many of my classes but the few that I did ask in this class were answered by somewhat snarky replies and little to no help. Very condescending and acts like she is available for help but is often preoccupied by something else on her computer during office hours.

Worst professor I've ever taken, she is very mean and doesn't care for her students. When asking her a question she barely explains it and will sometimes tell you to figure it out yourself. She clearly doesn't care about her job or her students and makes it very clear to you when you first start her class. STEER CLEAR FROM THIS PROFESSOR.
condescending, clearly hates her job, puts no effort into actually helping students
Worst professor i have ever had in my whole life.
The least caring person I've ever met, as if she weren't a human being.

Do not take this class if you are bad at math. She is extremely condescending and does not care for her students. She does not teach anything. All she does is read off slides and solve the problems without explaining. Very strict with attendance and is not understanding at all. Avoid this class for your mental well-being!

Only good thing ab her is she's fast at responding to emails. Extremely condescending towards students. Rushes thru lessons & gets mad when students don't understand. Super strict ab attendance.
