Weekly quizzes & tests every other week. Inconvenient office hours. My class only had 30 students at the beginning of the semester & 1/3 dropped halfway.
Not recommend if you not good at math

Bruh, she did not teach us how to do shit, I am sitting here crying at 2:26 AM because she didn't teach us how to do some of the problems on the homework, the class is structured in a way where she just kind of reads off of something, and doesn't really teach

Don't take if you struggle in math. Terrible at explaining/rushes through lectures. Office hours are always during class times so be wary of that. She tells you to go to the math help center (not helpful), she refused to round my 79.42 to an B. Hated her class, only take it you're good at math or can access resources to help if you're struggling.

She is super nice but can seem intimidating. She does have office hours where you can meet with her for help or others but she gives you the answers without explanation. I try to be open-minded, but she isn't the best professor in the end. She says to go to the math help center, but they always suck. She gives pop quizzes throughout the semester.

I loved Shivers! I thought that she was super nice and easy to understand. She does grade attendance though, which is really annoying. You cannot be excused from anything (classwork, homework, attendance, etc.) without a note either.

She is very fast during teaching. She comes off as condescending in emails. She may or may not call you out in front of the whole class if you are 2 minutes late (happened to me). Would not recommend. I do have to take personal responsibility for my grade in the class but, improvement on her part needs to happen.

Shivers is a rude tough and confusing teacher, her style of teaching is unhelpful and gets upset when you don't understand new concepts every other day. Teaching style isn't fair without high knowledge beforehand and the outside practice and help is pretty much none

I liked Professor Shivers for survey of calc. Can be a tough class but as long as you pay attention in class and write down everything she does, you'll do well. Homework and quizzes were on Webwork when I took this class fall 2020. I think you only had 15 minutes for 2-question quizzes so you gotta know what you're doing to do well on the quizzes.

probably the best option for all the survey of calc teacher, teaches the material in a clear cut way that makes it as easy as possible for the student. Attending office hours always helps if struggling with a concept
tried to be personal & get help with the work & having a good student/prof relationship but she did not care. won't answer questions you have in class.

I took Shivers for biz calc this semester and wasn't sure how I would do bc of all the negative reviews. This class covers lots of challenging material but it is not impossible. had an A in the class for a while. def take an excel class first & go to her office hours. she is happy to assist if needed. do not skip class and use txbk for hw help.

I'm currently taking this course and I cannot wait to get out. Shivers is one of the least understanding and condescending professors I've had thus far. She expects you to immediately understand material and reference past material at the drop of a hat even after her subpar lectures and inability to answer questions without condescension

Absolutely horrible "professor" if you can even go as far as to call this woman a teacher. Does not explain any of the material in class and is even worse when approached outside of class. Constantly contradicts herself when you're lucky enough to get any instruction from her and blames students for not understanding material. Shivers f-ing sucks.

She gives a reasonable amount of hmwk for a class that could be harder. Textbook and homework websites are free! Starting her class with an idea of Excel's basic functions will give you the upper hand. Follow along during lectures and try to do the homework immediately after class for the best chance of success. Tests are identical to study guides.

She moves too fast during lectures. The one day she gave us a handout instead of writing notes was when she taught us derivatives. She said everything we needed to know was on the sheet. To this day, I still do not know how to do derivatives because I was never properly taught how to do them. She gets annoyed when you ask for help outside of class.

Mrs. Shivers lacks empathy and support outside of the classroom. The only way to be online for a singular class period is to claim that you are sick, but will immediately guilt you in her response email. The "textbook" does very little help, and she gets frustrated at students when asking questions on material that was taught in previous chapters.

Professor shivers has got to be one of the worst professors I have crossed paths with. She is no help when it comes to asking questions because she hates to respond and wants you to figure it out on your own. She made going to her class a living nightmare and I couldn't wait to get out! Avoid her at ALL COSTS if you want to remain mentally stable.

I really think Shivers gets a bad name for no reason. She is a good teacher but sometimes a little more clarification is needed but she's always willing to help during classwork time. I had her for intermediate algebra and chose to take her again for college algebra. After two semesters I'd definitely say ask questions during class and show up.
DO NOT TAKE

Expects you to care when you can tell she couldn't care less. Unapproachable so even if you want help, don't go to her office hours because she obviously doesn't want you there. Stay away at all costs.

Professor Shivers is a fantastic teacher. She is always available for help and answers her emails like a speed demon. The material can be challenging, but she is a very effective teacher. Show up to class, do the homework immediately after class, and take notes. She offers a lot of extra credit as well. Overall, this was a great class.
tags: do the homework immediately after class

reviews.comment: Easily one of the worst professors at SLU. Doesn't give out examples, just works out the problem and expects students to know how to do it after that. Don't take the class if you are a student that likes things to be explained, because she just expects students to know everything.

She is a very rude, malicous and a terrible professor at that. She doesn't know how to teach, she writes notes on the board but doesn't explain them, and when you ask questions she makes you feel stupid, yet she gets mad when students aren't asking questions and do bad. The homework is nothing like the classwork or tests, and she isn't helpful!

She can be kind of hard to understand because she briefly does example problems and goes through it pretty quick. However, she tells you exactly whats on the test and never puts trick questions. There is some busywork in class but just do it, do the homework & practice test and you can easily get an A.
worst teacher Evererr

Shivers was consistently condescending, negative, and rude towards us as students. She treated students with disrespect, treating us like high schoolers and was especially rude to the international students. She would give us tests and quizzes with content much harder than what we learned in class and taught in a very rushed way. Avoid this class.
Overall, if you put in the time to do ALL the homework problems, her tests were not difficult to pass. She was really good about giving a study guide before the test and sticking to it.

Do NOT take Professor Shivers. She is easily the WORST teacher I've had. She is rude, doesn't respect her students, and does a horrible job teaching the content. Her "lessons" are her doing example problems on the board then we do some on our own. This method DOESN'T WORK! She also berates for not asking questions but is rude when someone does ask.

This class was tough, because I did not practice the homework problems often. She is very nice and helpful. She will not reach out to you if you do not do well on exams, shell just move on and will continue the course. You have to go to her office hours inorder to get help. Quizzes are giving every Friday and do come from the homework problems.

Shivers, at the time I took her class, was a mediocre professor. She provided very little explanation to concepts in class. She quickly scribbled out a few example problems and finished teaching after 20-30 minutes. She often provided wrong answers and had to be corrected by students. Very strict grader. Overall, avoid this class if possible.

Don't take with Shivers if you don't consider yourself to be a fast learner in Math. She doesn't teach, just works 1-2 examples on the board and calls it good. You get out of class 20-30 minutes early every time though, so that's a plus.

Easily one of the worst teachers I have ever had, be ready if you can't finish your quizzes in under 10 minute because you'll fail. Told our class she was too lazy to teach us properly because we were the second class of the day. Gets mad if you ask for something during class, but if you ask someone near you she spends the time to yell at you. Fun.

If you got bad vision you don't want to be at the back of the class. It's not her fault really but more of SLU's for giving us dusty chalkboards that make it almost impossible to see anything. One complaint about her is that one time she marked off a point because she said I made a V shaped graph when it was supposed to be a U. Um it was a U sweaty

Not helpful at all. I would email her for help on her tests and she would tell me to look in the text book but the text book has incorrect answers. She was very rude and treated the class like it was a high school class, talked down to us constantly. Went through material quickly which made it hard to ask questions. DO NOT take her.

Natalie Shivers is a great professor for College Algebra--take her if you can! The class is very structured so if you do the assignments, you will get a good grade. She posts a practice exam before each test and the test is the exact same with different numbers (plus she adds extra credit problems)! Overall, an easy class.
Gives study guides that are worth 5% of your grade. The book has a ton of wrong answers. She goes very fast and does not explain things very well

I've taken Shivers for college algebra AND pre calc and I'm not really understanding all the harsh ratings. For pre-calc ,the grade is based on mostly test and weekly quizzes that are based off the homeowork. The homework isn't worth anything but this is a class were you NEED to do the hw because it mimics the test. She is also always avaliable.

The professor is alright at teaching new information to the class, but she's a really strict grader on tests and will dock off points if you don't show your work the way she wanted you to, even if the answer was correct.
She does not teach. The book has lots of wrong answers and she works to quickly. Do not take survey of calc with her.

Shivers is mediocre. She spent the majority of this Excel-based calculus class being completely confused at how to do the problems. I will add that this was her first time teaching the class, and she does a great job at replying to emails when you need more clarification. Plan on doing a lot of out-of-class studying, unless you've taken calc before

Shivers wants her students to do well and provides amble resources and communicates well with students. I understood her lectures very well and her tests were exactly like the practice tests that were online on MyMathLab. I think she is a very good professor and cares about her students for sure.

Her first time teaching the class after only auditing it. She wasn't prepared to teach an Excel course and was constantly being corrected by students. Bad attitude and is always rolling her eyes as if this isn't her job. We're always out of class at least 20 minutes early, you'll have to put in effort and teach yourself in order to pass.

Shivers was really unprepared to teach this Excel-based calc class. She didn't really know what she was doing, and she moves really fast in class so it's hard to keep up and even write down what she writes down. Grades are 100% based on weekly 10 minute quizzes, 4 tests, and the final. Do the homework to prepare. I would avoid taking her class.
the teacher has low voice and I fell asleep.
hard to pass

Professor Shivers is honestly the worst professor I have ever had in my time at SLU. While her lectures are confusing and unorganized, she often has the wrong answers and trips over her own teachings. She does not know how to explain examples. Get a tutor right away if you want any chance at passing her class because she won't be good enough.

Really nice accessible professor. She's very approachable and writes her own exams, (minus the final) so they're really easy. She isn't the most knowledge;e teacher, is often corrected by the students, and has to email the class a ton of emails correcting her answer keys. As long as you understand how to do the examples in class, you're good.

Go to class, take the notes on the lecture, do the classwork, use the notes for the homework due by every class, and take the tests. Easy class if you are responsible and study the material. Try not to miss class, as it will affect you.
tags: take the notes on the lecture

reviews.comment: Professor Shivers is the best math teacher I have ever had. The notes we take in class are easy and then we do classwork that is basically completion. The tests are super easy because the practice tests given are exactly like the test, just different numbers. If you pay attention in class, it will be an easy grade. Her office hours are helpful too!

By far the best math professor I've had at SLU. If you complete all the homework and practice tests you will end up with an A. Only allowed to miss 6 classes but class is essentially note taking and a practice sheet. Also she replaces your lowest test grad if you do better on the final exam.

Natalie was the best math professor I've had at SLU. I took pre-calc the semester before, and dropped because the teacher was horrendous. Professor Shivers tells you what will be on the exam, helps you with anything, and her notes are pretty clear. Would strongly recommend for anyone who needs to be taught the math "basics"

She is a very nice lady, the homework is straight off the notes on My Math Lab. She is willing to help you and meet with you. She puts practice tests a few days before the exam and they are very similar to the actual exam. She also tells you what will not be on the test when we do the notes. Overall, I've gotten an A on every single test.
super easy professor. easiest class ive ever taken

She was really straight forward in the lessons. She cares a lot of her students and is more than willing to meet outside of class to go over and review things you didn't understand in class. Awesome teacher! NOTE: all homework is online (mymathlab) so the "textbook" isn't necessary.
Really good professor, class was fair and tests were straight from her lectures. Really easy to understand

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Anneke Bart

reviews.comment: This is one of the best teachers ever! I am afraid that I wont be getting someone like her again. She is very helpful and actually cares about her students. She makes everything so easy and is ready to help with anything. She made calc so easy for me!

Dr. Bart is amazing! I came into her class with no calculus experience, not even pre-calc. She is so easy to approach and obviously cares about your success. She provides multiple exam retakes and is very lenient with extensions and regrading of assignments. There is a decent amount of homework assigned online, but she will reopen it if it's late.

So kind and caring. Calc 2 is a hard class but she makes it so you really do understand the material. If you dont understand a concept + go to her office hours she will clear it up. Her reviews are VERY similar to the exam (problems on review appear on exam). She tells you exactly what you need to know for exams.

Her lectures are a bit confusing, and she assigns a decent amount of homework. She tells you exactly what is going to be on each exam/final, and drops a lot of homework, reading assignments, and quizzes at the end of the year. Incredibly understanding and will help you succeed. Not difficult to do well in her class.
tags: and drops a lot of homework

reviews.comment: I had a very hard time adjusting to her teaching style. I had her for 8 am calc and she was late almost every day. She assigns a lot of achieve homework that can be very lengthy and confusing. The homework doesn't even help with learning the content of the exams. I personally wouldn't take her again, but maybe she just wasn't for me.

Dr. Bart is a very kind person. Although her lectures tend to be confusing, she makes her exam grading criteria very clear. Also forgives a good amount of missed classwork at the end of the semester. Definitely understands that we are humans, very forgiving. Only downside is that she mainly teaches 8ams.

Dr.Bart was the sweetest professor. She was kind and accommodating, her lectures are heavy in regards to having most of the content given to you in class. Participation is vital for in-class assignments and occasional quizzes.

Please take her if you want an A. I am terrible at math but have an A. If you get a solid C in every exam but get 100% on all webwork & recitation worksheets (which she gives extensions anytime you ask and you can get help on it from tutors), you are guaranteed to have a solid A. Her grading is beyond fair & there is lots of partial credit!

Dr. Bart was understanding and allowed extensions when needed. She offers many examples in class and focused on knowing that you understand how to find an answer instead of concentrating on slight errors in calculation. This means she gives lots of partial or even full credit if you show that you understand the concepts even if you make a mistake.

Dr. Bart is amazing! I have loved her clarity in lectures and she is super helpful when you have questions. You do have to take notes and do the homework if you want to pass the tests but she gives lots of partial credit so no worries. Would take this course again if I could!

Dr. Bart is the BEST calc 2 prof. Her lectures are fine and recitation & webwork are easy points that can really bring up your grade. There are 5 exams but they are identical to the study guide so its really easy to get an A if you do them (she even gives solutions for them sometimes). Dr. Bart is also extremely understanding and accommodating.

I took her for online calc2. lectures were boring and she basically mumbles her way through it. i like how she gave the previous exams as study guides and the tests were almost identical. my grade is higher than i expected but i feel like ive learned absolutely nothing. also takes forever to grade things

I took Calc 2 as an asynchronous class during Fall 2020. She did office hours a few times before tests and that was always really helpful, so if you're taking her class in person I would probably recommend her. However, as an asynchronous online professor she often didn't respond to emails or make herself available.

She seems better than other math professors I have had at SLU but still not the best. She seems like she does the bare minimum. She is nice but again had to watch some youtube vids to fully understand certain concepts. She wants people to do good in her class but didn't seem that accessible outside of it.

Professor Bart is a great calc teacher. She is flexible with due dates and exam dates, and her tests are very straightforward and similar to problems done in class. Attendance is not mandatory but you do worksheets in class which are sometimes graded. Homework is done on webwork which is a pain, but you have unlimited attempts to try the problems.

Dr. Bart's class is pretty easy. I recommend attending every class because she does hand out worksheets, but you don't really have to pay attention. Her due dates are not completely clear, but if you do good on the tests and not the homework you can still do good. She gives out a study guide for the final exam that is basically the same exact thing

I thoroughly enjoyed this class. She is VERY fair as well as lenient on turning in assignments. Her graded assignments are difficult, but she is SO helpful in her office hours. Gives review sheets for the tests, they are basically the test. Easy to get an A as long as you complete, and understand the homework and the reviews. Doesnt take attendence

She is an amazing Calc teacher and very fair. Compared to a lot of the Calc professors, she is lenient with due dates for homework and with exam days. She will extend homework if you are swamped with another class. She allowed us to re-take a test too and Calculus was by far the worst subject for me until now. TAKE HER!

Take her class! Math is by far the worst subject for me, but she made Calculus less painful! Yes of course there is work that you need to do, but she's pretty cool about pushing back an assignment if you are busy with other classes and she's willing to help. Definitely take calculus I with her!
Dr. Bart is a great Calc II prof. She is always willing to help. Responds to emails quickly and has flexible office hours. Assigns mostly online hw, some from book. 3 tests, final and lots of hw

Dr. Bart is great. She will always help and respond to your emails. If you need to push back an assignment, she's totally flexible. She basically assigns test based on when the student's want them. Take her class.

Great professor. Will push assignments back if you email her. Definitely wants her students to do well and explains things very clearly. Tests are straightforward and fair. Make sure to do homework because they are easy points

Really cares about helping students understand the material; the class moves fast, but she will spend time going over something if she sees that people are having a hard time with it. While Calc II is a difficult class, she certainly makes it doable.

Excellent professor. Do the webworks. She draws test questions from them, and they are worth a decent amount of points! Also, make sure you study your series. That test, and the final are the hardest tests in her class. I do recommend her though.

Dr. Bart is a very helpful teacher. She doesn't really take attendance but everything she talks about in class is pretty much on the test. You really don't have to read the book, she hands out worksheets and she explains EVERYTHING. Really easy to understand
reviews.attendance: but everything she talks about in class is pretty much on the test

reviews.comment: Dr. Bart is a good teacher and is willing to help everyone. She gives homework via email if requested or by office hours. She moves a little fast sometimes but overall the class is pretty easy just do all of the work and go to class!! If you do, you'll get an A for sure.

Great teacher. Tests are easy, and she gives you old tests and practice questions before which are just like the tests. Very helpful. Gives good examples in class and moves at a good pace. Just don't get behind at the end of the year. Take her!

Really great professor! Dr. Bart knows her stuff. Gives many excellent examples and homework problems. She goes out of her way to help you succeed. Test are fair and well written. Office hours are very helpful. Many inclass worksheets that are accurate reflection of test questions. Couldn't ask for a better Calc teacher. A+++++++
is a good teacher, but tests are sometimes difficult. make sure to do and know homework!
She is a good teacher. Easy to get a good grade by studing. Very good at showing examples and test are like the homework and worksheets
Moves fast but very helpful. I'll you have to do is go in and talk to her and she'll make sure you understand the material. I highly recommend her.
Awesome teacher and awesome class. Basically like a junior high Geometry class but really interesting. She is the sweetest, most helpful teacher I have encountered thus far
Very helpful,easy subject matter if you need an easy math class take this one. easy tests, assignments almost every week, attendence is required, however there is leniance.
Grading was very fair. Tests were predictable. Must study hard. Teacher tried hard, but math classes are always tough to teach well.

Had her two semesters. Enjoyed her class, although at times I wondered what was going on, but come on this is Calc. She was always willing to help, and always understanding, has a heart. You will learn your material.
No Comments
Best math teacher i ever had, explains everything very well, gives u her old test to study
Nice teacher, willing to help students, but tests are very difficult for the course material studied.
Icky.

Grades on a curve,but doesn't *teach* everything that is on the test.Kinda easy if you're a self-learner,but the textbook is horrible.Quiz(every Friday,sometimes a group quiz).Too much group work.It isn't a substitute for teaching.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Hugo Panzo

reviews.comment: Dr. Panzo was an awesome professor, he made calc 2 easy. He explains things in a very straightforward way and is always there outside of class. He provides a lot of review material for the exam and attendance was not mandatory or part of the grade.

Dr. Panzo was an amazing professor. Initially, I had my doubts as he was new to the institution, but he is among my favorites now. While he does follow the textbook, I never had to reference it much. In class, everything was smooth and constructive. Dr. Panzo is a great explainer and ensures there is a surplus of study material before exams.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ashish Srivastava

reviews.comment: Had this prof for Calc 3—solid guy, knows his stuff, and keeps things light with some jokes. Talks fast, so ya gotta keep up, but he'll slow down if you ask. His accent takes a minute to adjust to, but not a big deal. Approachable if you don't mind some sarcasm. If you put in the effort, you'll do fine.

Not a great professor if you don't already know how to do everything. He skips many of the intermediate steps and gets confused when students don't understand. Going to office hours doesn't help as he simply repeats the same steps and gets angry that you still don't understand.

Dr. Srivastava is a fine professor if you have strong mathematical intuition. However, when going through problems in class, he often skips intermediate steps and then seems confused when students ask how he got from one part of the problem to another. Is he a nice guy? Yes. Is he good at teaching material students have never seen before? No.
DO NOT TAKE THIS MAN. HE MADE ME HATE MATH AS A MATH MAJOR. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Dr. Srivastava is the most caring professor I've ever had. He is willing to work with students. Whenever we asked for extra credit or gave suggestions on what should be on the exam, 99.99% of the time he agreed. He says that there is nothing more fun than doing math. I am not a math person and I found myself looking forward to his class every day.

Prof likes to say he is "generous" and he truly is. When students are stuggling he adjusts the tests and gives extra credit. He is very funny and made me enjoy going to calc, almost always lets class out a little early. I'm not a math person so having a good TA helped the most. Prof can be hard to understand sometimes but always answers questions!

I came into this class with ZERO background of calculus and I will say Srivastava is pretty hard to follow because he doesn't explain topics super well. He gives lots of options for extra credit (you have to ask for it though DURING class and 99% of the time he will grant it) and he also allows a cheat sheet for each test (of any size andanylength)

Dr. Srivastava is a bit complicated to understand and he's a bit confusing sometimes. He loves participation and when people are engaged so get ready to listen. But, hes a very funny and understanding professor. He let us ask and contribute to things we did and didn't want on exams and visiting his office hours is very important!

He is an amazing professor one of the best professors I have ever had I really recommend any to take any of his classes I had him for two semesters in a row one class for calculus 3 and the other class for differential equations and he was one of the only professors in which I was never was confused in his class and in general such a great man!!!

2660 with him was awesome. His lectures are clear and the content is pretty easy, and on top of that he's just hilarious. Exams look VERY similar to homework/lecture problems and sometimes have the exact same questions. I was honestly shocked by this; you can definitely take advantage of it by taking good notes during lectures and doing the hw.

Dr. Srivastava cares a lot about his students understanding of math. He omitted a section from one of our tests because he saw the class was having a hard time with the content. He does have kind of a thick accent, so he can be hard to understand at times, but he doesn't hesitate to repeat himself if asked. Gave extra credit multiple times.

Dr. Srivastava was a good professor. Heads up, his lectures do drag on. The start of the semester was pretty bad with me doing terrible on my first midterm. But once I started going to his office hours, my understanding of the concepts being taught got better and so did my grade in the class! He is really nice and I highly suggest office hours.

Srivastava was a generous professor. He wants his students to learn and understand the material. The first exam was difficult, but he helped encourage students along the way to improve. I recommend going to his office hours. Expect to put in a lot of work to get a good grade in his class. He rewards hard working students.

Professor Srivastava is a really good professor for Calc 3, his tests are difficult, but as long as you do the homework you should be fine. He gives plenty of classtime to work on practice problems, and I think he explains things well. If you give the wrong answer, he will tease a little bit, but that is just his personality, he's a funny guy.

Terrible communicator - thick accent, strange handwriting, poor communication of expectations, will not give a schedule for the semester at all, especially not exams. (So yeah, have testing accommodations? You're screwed.) Only e-mails assignments/exam dates sometimes. Oh yeah, and if you ask a question, be prepared to be chastised and humiliated.
He taught mainly through practice problems. He was an okay teacher but if you did not understand something he had a hard time explaining it in a different way for you to understand.

Tests are just the homework and class examples, so write them down. If you don't understand something just go to office hours and ask. The textbook can be found online, but we never used it, so don't bother buying it. Overall I think he is a good teacher and makes Linear Algebra pretty easy.

First things first: google "Linear Algebra Done Right solutions" because plenty of his homework problems come from the book. But yeah basically it's your job as a student to memorize A LOT of examples. Not fun. But, in the end he gave me an A, which I did not expect. Homework is important as is studying for multiple days before the tests.

Disliked the class very much. He assumes the class knows what he is talking about it, but when a student asks a question, he gets very frustrated. Mostly had to teach myself. I learned way more from our group work that in his lessons.
Great teacher. Homework is 25% of grade, and group work is 5%. Exams are easy as long as you come to class, pay attention, and do the Webwork. He is a very straightforward teacher.

He is a good teacher. He teaches through example problems. I would recommend attending class. His accent is easy to understand but his hand writing is hard to read because he writes his letters differently from most people. His tests are hard and long but he gives extra credit after the test. Homework is webwork for 25% of the grade.
Keeps things simple. Is very much concerned with students understanding material. He is very patient.
Ashish was helpful outside of class, but tests and final were very hard.
Ashish is a good professor. He gives fair tests and is incredibly helpful if you go to his office hours. Sometimes he can be a little unclear in class. Very funny, and overall an easy course.

He is a laid back person, who makes the abstract, or the most complex of things, concise and simple to understand. Tests are an exemplification of homework problems or problems that were done in class. No "surprises" on tests. Just plain and straightforward.
Ashish was a really easy professor. He might be hard to understand in class but if you ever ask him questions in office hours, he is extremely helpful. If you work at it, you will get an A.

Makes math jokes that are sort of funny, but is a terrible teacher. He was not helpful at all during office hours, and would get flustered when asked a question and would not explain it. If you don't need much math help, it's an easy class though.

He was one of the most caring professors I've had at SLU thus far. You need to study and attend class everyday. He really cares about students learning the material. He can be make jokes here and there but overall is a very serious and intelligent professor.

very good teacher, if you work hard and study you will get an A, very helpful only if u ask questions which he highly encourages; gives opportunities for extra credit and definitely wants everyone to succeed

Ashish is amazing. It may seem like he is trying to embarrass you when he asks people who don't know the answers to do problems on the board, but he is only trying to get you to learn it. Lenient grader. Tells funny math jokes and is really chill in general. He will assume that you know the answer if you don't ask questions.. so ASK!
Amazing teacher. Makes lame math jokes. Very interested in students getting a good grade.
I mostly agree with poster below, especially his teaching style, or lack thereof. Barely covers a few examples then makes students go to the board and expects them to immediately be an expert.

Avoid at all costs! This guys spends at most 15 minutes on the subject before either throwing you into groups to try and figure it out other problems together with little help or bring you up to the chalkboard and make fun of you as you screw up. Wanted nothing to do with me when I asked him for help after class. Overall a terrible experience!

Tests are straightforward - he more or less takes some of the most basic problems from homework/notes. But this man can be EXTREMELY condescending, to the point where I wanted to throw things at him. Expects students to catch onto the material right after he teaches it. But overall, things could've been worse I guess.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ella Sachs

reviews.comment: Ella Sachs is one of THE best instructors at SLU. Like others, I do not understand the low rating for this professor. She goes out of her way to be sure each student comprehends subject matter and allows extra credit time after time. She offers one-on-one sessions before/after class. One cannot leave this course without an appreciation of math.

I don't understand the "awful" ratings for this professor. I found her to be completely fair, willing to help and went to great lengths to teach and make sure everyone in the class understand the processes. She did considerable one-to-one advising as well. She helped and many others understand math, and I truly appreciate your effort &patience.

Ella tries to make sure that everybody passes. She gives a bunch of extra credit but also give s much homework. Math Lab is her best friend but at the end of the semester, the homework will count as XC. She is hard to understand at times and she does not do a very good job of explaining the material. You have to teach yourself the lessons as well.

Ella bends over backwards to give extra credit and wants everyone to succeed in the class. She clearly cares. Unfortunately, Ella apparently evidently doesn't understand how to use the online learning platforms she teaches from. The homework was disorganized and hard to tell what was mandatory or optional, and she *way* over-uses email.
Worst teacher I've experienced at this school. Avoid at all costs. Does not teach the material well and you can barely understand what she's saying. She should not have a job teaching at this school.

I would avoid this professor at all costs. If you can't, take the class in the summer. The instructor does not teach the class in a way that helps the students understand the material, and the material is easy. She makes it harder than it needs to be and everything she does is confusing or spelled wrong. The only good thing is the extra credit.
She's a great woman if you get to know her, my biggest problem was her strong accent. Most of the homework is online and takes a very long time.

She is a very nice lady who definitely tries hard but not a great professor. It's very hard to understand her and she is all over the place during lectures. She gives TONS of extra credit which helps but that's not enough. I recommend avoiding her class but if you can't, you will most likely need a tutor. She made this easy class difficult.

Terrible lady, terrible teacher, avoid at all costs. I say this again, AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I did all the homework, studied, went to class every day, did well on the tests,and somehow ended with a D. Something doesnt add up.
Absolutely horrendous professor. Has no concept of how to teach, well enough how to teach math. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

She really tried to have everyone understand her, but she is a terrible example of a professor. She shouldn't be teaching at a university level and she has no concept of time. Every day I had to walk out of her class so I could go to another class. A joke. But gives TONS of extra credit. DROP. I didn't listen, but DROP no matter what.

She was very disorganized and would get upset if you did not understand her. She definitely played favorites. Some people (African-Americans) in the class got A's and B's even even if they did not do the homework. One girl never purchased a book. One girl did not come towards the end, car broke, she got an A.

Worst teacher I've had in my life. You'd do wise to do anything possible not to take her even if it's a prerequisite for your major. She's not worth your time or money. I honestly don't know how she's still allowed to teach here. Terrible

She means well, you can tell that. However, her delivery of the material is subpar. She is extremely confusing and difficult to understand. Not only can she not speak clearly, she cannot even write legibly on the board. She has sent over 80 emails over the course of the semester attempting to explain assignments. She is the worst teacher I have had

Saddly all is not as it should be. Her personality is sweeter then honey...provided you are not a slacker...and its like confetti of extra credit points. But that is where it ends. stright up...she is a nutty old bat and class quickly goes arye as far as class work. Be prepaired for anything in test, and the infernal "My Math Lab" system much work.

Please for your own sake drop her if you get her. Her accent is awful and you honestly cannot understand a thing, plays favorites majorly, requires attendance and has several items of homework that is collected and graded every day. She is nice but really should not be teaching at a university.
reviews.attendance: and has several items of homework that is collected and graded every day

reviews.comment: Ella has a very thick accent and can be very difficult to understand. She treats her students like they are in grade school. We got homework every day and she collected it and graded it. She's also disorganized. I would really recommend not taking her and picking another teacher if at possible.

I feel sorry for all the students that don't understand Calculus. Your grade was NEVER known because she didn't keep track and it was just all-around awful. I'm sure she means well, but the execution is just terrible. Avoid if possible.
Worst teacher i have ever had, i cant understand her jibberish, she does not know how to teach. I hate her. She is such a bad teacher

Avoid if possible, if not possible then dealing with this class should be okay but not a walk in the park, extra credit system for attendance which raises grade by a letter at the end gets people good grades.
reviews.attendance: which raises grade by a letter at the end gets people good grades

reviews.comment: She is very nice. She gives out lots of extra credit. If you need help on the test she will give you the answers. Even though she is hard to understand you will get an A

Ella is great. She has a thick Hebrew accent and can be hard to understand at times, however, she is ALWAYS willing to help you. She offers a lot of extra credit. If you get 200 points, she raises your grade one letter grade. For perfect attendance you receive 100 extra points. I would highly recommend her!

whatever people say about her, I LOVE ELLlA!!! she is the sweetest lady, WILL HELP YOU and if you ask her during tests and exams, she will tell you how to do them!!! tests are not easy but she will have a very very similar study material. we only had 3 exams, 1 take home. HW didn't even count at the end... loads and loads of extra credit!!

Ella is extremely disorganized and can be very hard to understand. Her assignments are really unclear sometimes. There is a ton of homework. The good news is there is LOTS of extra credit, and she is very helpful if you are having trouble. She offers help on tests, TAKE IT. NEVER miss class and do all the homework. It won't be fun, but you'll pass.

do whatever you can to get out of this class, very nice lady but is impossible to understand and you WILL end up teaching yourself everything, does offer lots of extra credit which everyone will need!!
I will enjoyed math and was always one of the top in my class in math, but this class it's just so hard to pay attention because she is so boring.
this lady is a complete idiot. get out of her class. she is clueless and has no idea what she was doing. she could barely do simple equations on the board.
I dropped the class after 2 days, you do the math
you won't fail if you put forth effort but she's so disorganized that you won't understand crap that she wants you to do - even if you understand calc - and it's def hard to get an A

ok. she hardly speaks english, and cannot teach AT ALL. she is really nice though and wants to help, if you go in during office hours she'll help you out and like you more. if you can, definitely switch teachers, but dont drop it b/c you can get a good grade if she thinks you try really hard.

This class is terrible. If you've taken Calc, you'll get an A easily, but she doesnt know how to teach. If you dont already know basic calculus, dont expect to get much knowlege from her unless you plan on going to her office hours. Im pretty sure i could teach this class better than she can. Oh, and you cant understand what the hell shes saying...

Awful teacher, she doesn't speak English clearly and she moves way too fast assuming we know everything she knows. She also will grade you on how much she likes you. VERY BAD TEACHER, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! You WILL regret it if you take her, find someone else. A goat as a teacher is better than this lady.
No Comments

Ella is freakin insane. She sounds like that chick from Austin Powers when she talks, wich is cool at first, but then sucks when you realize you're supposed to be learning calculus from her. If you're thinking about killing yourself, take her. She'll push you over the edge.
I wouldnt say she was a good teacher, but she really does her best to help the students in anyway she can.If you dont mind working with her outside of class you will definitely get and A.
Terrible teach. Absolutely impossible to understand. English is her 3rd language, literally. Find someone who speaks english b/c this should be an easy class.

She's wonderful, hard to hear clearly but don't believe what others say, they never came to class and then complained about a poor grade Ella's a wonderful lady, I needed help, she said "name time/place for tutoring; I'll be there". 40pts of extra cred on m-term. A in class, best math teacher ever!
Easy class but the teacher is not clear at all.

This is the hardest class ever. Even though I worked with her for hours and hours out of class and office hours, I still got a low grade. She is a horrible teacher and grades on how much she likes you.

Most unorganized BS class I have ever been in. We do group work-all have same answers-some in group get an A, some get an F. Grades are based on how much she likes you. She gets mean in class too..sarcastic- & Doesnt even speak English. Nightmare!
She CAN'T speak English. Her tests are not fair at all. Many times I had not even heard of the concepts on the tests. I'd rather play in traffic than attend a class with her ever again.

teacher's unorganized,hard to understand her English.Notes & class are very unstructured, gives alot of work & attendance is important.always willing to meet ANYTIME for xtra help.tests are long but ask for help during it!she tells u answer$ writes it out
Though hard to understand at times, Ella is a good teacher. If you at least do the work in the class and respect her, you will get an A. Attendance is required, she grades heavily on this.

she flat out does not speak english... you have no idea when the tests are or what you are going over, because you cant understand her. i would rather poke my eyes out than sit thru another class of hers
You can't under stand a word coming out of her mouth. Her extra credit system is nuts. Tests have material that not covered in class. Don't take her if you can.
No Comments
don't take this class...
BAD teached - gives out grades based on her mood for the day
HORRIBLE TEACHER!!! I WOULD RATHER CHEW OFF MY OWN ARM THAN SEE HER EVER AGAIN

She hands out random grades, it's impossible to comprehend her half-english dialect, talks on her cell phone during tests, has no grading system whatsoever, cannot spell, is mean to people. This class was my worst educational experience ever.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Alina Abdurakhimova

reviews.comment: she is literally an angel sent from heaven.

I took her for STAT1100 and I loved having her as a professor. She is very sweet, kind, and always wanting to help students. I am very bad at math so I struggled a lot, but she started to allow us to have cheat sheets for the exams so we could do better. She also helped me with problems I had and explained clearly. Ultimately a great professor.

Definitely recommend her class, she so amazing and caring there is no point that you will get bellow A with her. There is daily worksheets for attendance and online hw that helps you elevate your grades. Maaanyyy extra credit and she is always helping and caring for our grades.her test are so easy, She is the best.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Seth Stahlheber

reviews.comment: Go to office hours if you need help, he is really good at explaining things in depth

Mr. Stahlheber is the best math teacher I've had in a very long time. While the subject itself is challenging and very draining, Seth is great at dumbing it down for us so that it is easy to understand. The homework sucks but it's not worth too much of the grade, the tests are challenging but fair, make sure you come to class every day andtakenotes

GREAT PROFESSOR! I hate math, but his class is great if you don't enjoy math. There are mini quizzes at the end of every week and four big exams, but as long as you study the material, they are doable! I TOTALLY RECCOMEND!

Great Professor, this is my second semester taking classes with Professor Stahlheber and he is just great. He explains extremely well, he is understanding, and he really wants the best for each of his students. I would 100% recommend taking classes with him, he will not hesitate to help you outside of class.

Seth is a great professor. He teaches very quickly but does teach well. He is a genuinely nice person who is willing to help you with anything you struggle with. Email him- he responds quickly. His courses are difficult for sure, but if you study and work with him... you will succeed. Would take again. I wish he taught some aviation courses.

Mr. Stahlheber is my favorite math professor/teacher I have ever had in my entire life. He truly makes math fun and not have me crying on the bathroom floor thinking I can't do it. He always answers emails quickly and always available during office hours. There is quite a few homework assignments but not unmanageable.
Class is difficult but he tries to help you understand the material.

Stahlheber is the man. He does an amazing job of explaining everything and showing his students what to do. His lectures are very throughout and he will take the extra time to go over stuff that people do not know. His tests are not difficult and if you study you will be just fine. Best math professor at SLU by far

Mr. Stahlheber was an amazing teacher. His classes and lectures are very easy to follow and matches with the assignments. He is available outside of class and answers questions quickly over email. He offers so many resources and examples to help students thrive. I highly recommend taking his courses.
Material was very difficult for me but Seth did a very good job explaining things thoroughly.

He is an amazing teacher! he doesn't teach slowly but it is very clear and always tries to make sure you understand his test is pretty hard but he lets you know what will be on the quiz. He is one of the professors I think who is genuine.I loved taking courses with him and now he is one of my favorite professor!

AMAZING! Took Professor Stahlheber for both College Algebra and Survey of Calculus. He is one of the most caring professors you will have in college. He wants everyone to succeed and he is very accessible via email or office hours. One of my favorite professors I have had in college. Highly recommend. He makes math enjoyable.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Brody Johnson

reviews.comment: Incredibly nice and intelligent teacher. Worksheets, quizzes, and exams follow from the lectures. Homework can be harder, but he makes it really easy to ask for help. Either in person or on canvas. While homework was a lot, he has said he will fix it in the future. He is willing to consider the needs of his students to allow for max success.

Brody was very easy to speak to. He is a great person who cares about his students but his class is impossible. The exams were kind of a free for all, with a lot of study material that didn't really relate to the exams. The homework was extremely difficult and we had about 20-30 problems a week. I learned everything through tutoring. Dont take.

Lectures explain the basics of each section and it's your job to learn the more complicated problems with problems from the textbook. That'll help you get by his tests. He has weekly quizzes but they're usually like one or two questions. Also weekly worksheets but he gives great feedback and they were really helpful for tests.

Brody is one of the best MATH professors at SLU. His tests are challenging but if you do homework and practice problems you'll be fine. He typically gives out a review for each exam. These don't exactly mirror the exam but they do help a ton. His office hours truly do help and you can tell he wants to see you succeed in his class.
Great professor the class wasn't too difficult but the homework was. He is very helpful if you ask for help and the practice tests are very helpful.

Brody teaches math in a way that I think math should be taught. He makes sure each and every student succeeds in his class, and always make sure the entire class is participating in his lectures. He is very thorough with his explanations, and very available if you need help. He is also quite casual, and definitely funny. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!

I dont know why these reviews are so good. Dr. Johnson was one of the worst professors I have had here at SLU. His tests were near impossible and his homework was so ambiguous. We turned it in based on a 'dice role' which is was the most unprofessional act Ive seen as a student here. He has been rather condescending and unhelpful. Dont take.

Brody is one of the best math professors in the department. The class and lectures are very organized and thorough. He is very generous with grading and will give you a lot of points for work. The tests are hard, but the homework points, easy quizzes, and group work give a lot of cushion to your grade.
He's a great professor and explains things well. The Calc 3 class was just very fast paced. Homework was about 7 problems a week. Added practice problems halfway through the class.

Best Math Teacher Ever. Brody simplifies hard concepts so that students can easily follow. He puts in a lot of effort to prepare for lectures and it always shows. He incorporates projects and weekly homework assignments but he is super accessible and gives always great direction. He spends a lot of time outside of class to support students as well.

The other reviews could not be more wrong. I took him expecting to have a great prof and a great class. This was one of the worst classes I've ever taken. The lectures did little to help learning and the majority of your grade is based on single problem pop quizzes. I had to teach myself everything for the final. Don't take him.

So great! Gives technical definitions and then breaks them down into understandable terms. Class followed a predictable schedule with hw due Monday, quizzes on Tuesday, and group assignment to be completed in class on Friday. After test is lots of people missed a certain question hed make the quiz on that material for a chance to earn back the pts

Brody is the best professor I have ever had. He makes it extremely clear how to succeed in his class, his lectures are great, and if you ever have any trouble with anything, he is extremely helpful outside class as well. Very nice, funny professor, and while your grade isn't handed to you, it is not a ridiculous amount of work. I learned so much.

Brody is one of the best math professors I've had. He explains the content very well and when you don't understand he will try make it easier. He is even better in office hours. When you go to him he goes over what you don't know in a more simpler way. He gives somewhat hard homework, but just go to office hours. Also the tests is similar to HW.

Dr Johnson's lectures are really clear. He assigns a decent amount of homework, which is challenging to solve. His exams are sometimes easy, but time consuming. He can also make the exams really difficult.

Great professor. Bases tests on how well the students understand the material and is always willing to help. Lectures are dry but he is always cracking jokes. Tests a a bit difficult but if the class as a whole got a bad average, he will curve a good amount! Must take Brody!

Offered homework and class worksheets in preparation for tests and quizzes. Help was always given when needed and he was very open with his office hours. Really strong in making sure his students grasp the concepts he is teaching.
Really tough class (PDE), fair grader, and extremely helpful - this is one of the best math teachers I've had. Open through email, generous office hours, and works at your level once you're there.
Very good professor

Brody Johnson is one of the best math professors I have ever had and probably will be one of the best I will ever have. He is passionate about the subject and truly wants to see his students succeed. Given that Calculus 2 is difficult, don't expect an easy A. His office hours are super helpful and lectures are a must go to.

He is a very good professor. Use examples to illustrate concepts and theories. He usually gives extra credits base on the average grade of tests. The test problems are similar to the homework problems and if you understand homework and you will have very good grade for the tests. I had an A.

Brody is my favorite professor at SLU, I had him this semester for Differential Equations and would not have wanted any other professor. He communicates the material very well, knows what he is talking about, and is very understanding. If you are taking differential equations soon, TAKE BRODY! He may not be the easiest, but he sure is the best.

Brody is really a great teacher. He is personable and funny and makes class interesting. That being said, his class is very difficult. If you are looking for an easy A, look elsewhere. His homework and tests are tough but if you need help he's always available.

Brody is super helpful and will explain things very thoroughly if you ask for help. He makes jokes and keeps the class interesting. He gives hints for every homework which it makes it much easier. The tests are much easier than the homework and some of the tests have take home components.
Not too easy, but he is really helpful when you bring your questions.

Difficult class, and difficult tests. Not too easy, but he is an incredible teacher. He knows how to teach the class, and how to keep them interested. Goes by first name basis and personalizes with the class alot. Spends the first 15 minutes explaining the concept of that day, and the rest of the class time running examples. Very effective.

Phenomenal professor. Crystal clear lectures, extremely helpful, helps students but not too much. Has engineering degrees in addition to mathematics degrees, and so has a deep understanding of both theory and application. That's a powerful combinations, although not one you see every day. Nice guy, too. Highly recommended.

My favorite teacher by far. He's young and has lots of fun with the class. He does a great job of providing practical applications to the material, so it made it much more interesting than most math classes.

Material is difficult. But he explains it very well and is always supportive and helpful. Very fun and easygoing, talks a lot about the Cardinals, and likes to go by a first-name basis (call him Brody). Tests can be difficult, but he tries to schedule them at random times as to not couple them with other tests. Teaches extra material.

He is not easy and the final brought me down a whole letter grade. But he is super nice and funny and helpful. He is very approachable in office hours and even took time to talk to me about an eating disorder I had while taking his class. He nominated me for the Calculus award. He is my advisor for my Math minor. I highly recommend him.
Brody is a great teacher and will help you whenever you ask and is very fair. But his tests are insane and but if you do ok on them then your hw and quiz grades will boost your grade
Smartest math teacher I know. Great teaching skills, very helpful, and fun. However, his tests are pretty killer.

Really hard class. For me, it took going to Office Hours to get a good grade. But Brody's a really good teacher and is so, so helpful. He really cares about his students. He gives hard tests, though. This class takes a lot of time and preparation.
very very very good　ｐｅｒｓｏｎ！

Brody's tests were killer! Disproportionately difficult compared to the homework (which was fun, engaging, and just challenging enough to be rewarding when completed). Brody is funny and willing to help, he is extremely helpful and clear about the material!! The tests destroyed me though, I felt like I learned a ton about Matlab and C++, but I stil

Brody's class is tough; I wouldn't recommend this class if you are a slacker... It is my feeling that if you don't understand comp sci very well to begin with, you will likely have difficulties. If you ask him for help and show that you are trying your best to learn, it shouldn't be too bad. Tests are tough, so do the HW and go to office hours.
CSCI 145 is extremely! hard. Brody makes it more difficult. Avoid if possible.
Brody is a great teacher and a great person. He has high expectations for his students, but he will always meet you halfway. Go to his office hours if you need help, hes a great guy.

Brody is a really good teacher. Pretty young guy, likes teaching. For Scientific Programming, the material is pretty hard to learn, but he makes absolutely sure that you understand what you're doing. Tests are pretty tough, but homework points are gimmes.
I wish I were in one of his classes.
Calc II is hard, but Brody is GOOD. Very funny guy...class was a blast, but the tests are NO JOKE. He's a fair grader, though. Go to his office hours. He's really helpful.
Brody is one of the smartest professors at this university. His class is hard but you will learn so much if you try. He's also really helpful outside of class and genuinely enjoys his job.
The class is a little boring but he's a really nice guy. He's extremely helpful and always tries be fair. He grades really easy on test. He will give partial points even if you made an effort.

Excellent teacher, very helpful. Gives hard tests, but lots of points for partial work and lets you rework them for EC sometimes. Quizes are also not bad, sometimes you can persuade him to let you take them in groups.
great teacher and really nice, but is kind of hard. he doesn't teach exactly by the book, so if you don't get what he is saying, then you hafta read the book and translate a few times.
I WANT TO HAVE HIS BABIES!

One of a kind. Hands down the best math teacher i've ever had. He makes math fun, and although he's challenging, he will never pass up an oppourtunity to help in or out of class. Highly reccomend Brody.
Very hard class, but you will learn. Grading is fair. He also has a sense of humor and is very helpful outside of class, even helping through IM.

Very good teacher, probably the most preferable if you're taking Calc 1. Class isn't easy, but he does all he can to make it easier for you. Very nice guy, very approachable. Office hours help out a lot. I highly recommend him.

Brody is one of the few math teachers that actually understands application of principles. For an engineering student, this is critical. I would highly recommend Brody. Sadly, this means you will work in his class, but the grading is fair.

Awesome professor. He is one of the clearest teachers I have ever met, and really knows what he talks about. I've never seen him hesitate or even back track on anything. He's also really helpful. I highly recommend this guy.
Very good and fair teacher, you take a lot of notes, tests can be difficult, it is not a guaranteed A but you will learn the material and he make it fun.

The material in general is pretty challenging, but he explains everything very thoroughly. If you have any questions, he is more than willing to help not matter what. Expect a difficult in depth project. He is really smart and easy to joke with

Very fair teacher, explains everything well and will go out of his way to help students with any questions. Weekly quiz that isn't bad if you do the homework and tests that are not easy, but he will give you the benefit of the doubt.
Excellent teacher, but pretty hard. Expect him to give you some pretty crazy homework assignments. Tests are pretty hard, but he grades fairly and generously.
nice guy and helpful, but his tests are impossible..."if you are short on time then write in words what to do"-i thought math was involved numbers? MAKE THE TEST SHORTER ARSE!
Good teacher. Explains everything really well and writes EVERYTHING on the board. Hes fun and will joke around with anyone who brings it up.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Jamal Adbul-Hafidh

reviews.comment: This dude canceled class for the whole last week of school and told us that we needed to learn the modules ourselves. Never actually helped us in class with R-studio assignments and told us youtube was our professor instead. If I knew I was going to youtube uni i wouldn't of took this class. He is not the one you want to take for Statistics.
Jamal was a great professor to have and he is good at what he does.
I hated him, he is the worst.

This professor always told you exactly what you needed to know for exams. All notes taken were useful for exams, and we were allowed to have a cheat sheet for all exams. He teaches you how to do everything on the calculator and makes the concepts really easy to understand. Overall, he makes the class fun and is very nice

I basically have no clue what statistics is because he didn't teach it to us. It was basically a list of formulas that he rattled off in class and you have to look at his problems o figure out on your own which to use. His tests made no sense and there were no practice problems ever given to us. Didn't follow book but i taught myself w it

Broken english, is still fine in lectures. However, very unclear about homework, test preparedness, and is very unclear at explain things to people with no background. For example, he will explain topics using other topics that are new, making understanding very hard. Also, he makes a lot of mistakes on his practice tests and actual tests.
tags: is still fine in lectures. However

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Stacey Harris

reviews.comment: Impossible to estimate your final grade because she doesn't know how to use Canvas. Her lectures are very unorganized and often goes into tangents. Will start to yell and get angry if you don't understand something. Due dates often change for assignments and are not posted on Canvas. Exam dates are not on syllabus (we had exam week of Thanksgiving)

Dr. Harris is the most accommodating professor I know. I no showed a testing center exam appointment and she emailed me asking if everything was all right and offered me a time to make up the exam. I don't know any other professor who would do that. If you are willing put in some work outside class to learn the material she is great.

Lectures unstructured and do not match difficulty of hw. Be prepared to self teach! Would not take if you are uncomfortable with pre-calc/calc topics. Can't rely on lectures to pass the class. She is nice and extremely smart for sure. She teaches off the top of her head and it shows. It is a chill class if you know the topics already, otherwise :/

she is a nice person, but a HORRIBLE prof. this prof gives numerous quizzes and hard exams, which is what your grade will primarily consist off. never uploads grades on canvas so you'll be left guessing what you have in the class until the final grade comes out. hw is tedious and extremely difficult. spare yourself from a semester of stress.

Terrible professor, lectures consist of are overcomplicated. And almost every day when teaching the class something new someone has to correct the math that she does. You will not use Canvas. Get ready to have to teach yourself a lot.

I think Dr. Harris gets a bad rep. Dr. Harris is a poor lecturer. She writes very sloppy and is prone to quite a few mistakes due to (it seems like) poor planning for lectures. However, she is very understanding and caring to her students and is very accommodating for missed quizzes and tests. She communicates her criteria very clearly as well.

This is the worst professor I've ever had. He/she, I don't even know, would walk into class every day without any preparation it seemed. The lessons were just tangents with no power point or anything to reference. The homework did not match what we learned in class and tests were hard. I learned everything I knew straight from the textbook.

Shes a genius for sure but maybe teaching isnt her thing. She attempt to be understanding but never really put in the effort. Lectures was a waste of time. She wont help you with anything so dont expect any. Allow some extensions.

Dr. Harris seems like a good person at heart, but she struggles to get her point across in many lectures. Some of the lectures seem unprepared, as most of the lessons are taught right off the top of her head (making examples on the spot). The homework and tests are much harder than what we do in class. I had to teach myself almost everything.
He is a bad teacher. Bad at explaining and teaching in general. He then grades extremely hard

Very sweet, seems like a nice woman. However, would frequently mess up grading on tests/quizzes and refuse to award back points even after admitting she messed up. Extremely harsh grader, and although clearly intelligent, her explanations were very convoluted and unnecessarily complicated. Had to teach myself everything.
Very difficult to follow but always willing to help. Very few tests but lots of partial credit and AWESOME CURVES. Also chances for extra credit.

Would not recommend this professor. Lectures were confusing and I left knowing less than when I came. I would just listen in lecture and then take my notes from the book after class because the lectures were all over the place and difficult to follow. We were supposed to take 3 exams and only took 2 so now the final is worth 50% of our grade.
I took the material before in high school so it was a breeze, if you are new to the material pay attention and read the chapters and you will do fine.

He teaches so slowly. You cannot learn what you want. The tests are so easy and he cannot explain everything clearly. If you are Math major, do not try him. But if you are not math major, you can try him, because you don't have to learn everything on book.

Dr. Harris teaches very conceptually, so it is hard to follow some of his lessons in class. The book explains some of these concepts, but it is difficult to do the homework problems due to the lack of examples used in class.

Harris is obviously very passionate about math, but has a hard time relating to students. If students don't understand his way of thinking, he becomes frustrated quickly. Calc III isn't terribly difficult, but students not strong in math should sign up for a different professor.

"To thine own self be true." He certainly does that. Passionate about his subject and his viewpoint. Don't bother taking notes; they won't make sense anyway. Just watch what he's doing and soak up as much as you can. For a graduate course, find supplementary texts as early as possible and cram them into you brain early before the class ramps up.
Smart guy. Everything he said in class will be exactly what they are in the quizes and exams. Easy A if you had the material before. If didnt, pay attention in class.

Dr. Harris's class is ridiculous unless you have had the material before. I am getting an A but would probably not be. He gets pretty annoying during class and that can be distracting but I do recommend going to class because those are the problems that you will be tested on. Overall, avoid if you have never had the material before!!!

If you are unable to learn from abstract notes and few examples, avoid this professor. He's unfair, flaunts the fact that his grading is subjective, and his exams are ridiculous. The last exam we had consisted of five questions, the first of which was worth 24 points. His grading scale varies from quiz to quiz. It's never consistent.

Dr. Haris is way too smart for his own good. He struggles communicating his knowledge effectively to his students. He gets frustrated with incorrect answers very quickly and is no better during his office hours. He actually threw a pencil at a wall because he got so annoyed with a student who couldn't get the answer! B careful when choosing him
he is an awful teacher and he yells at the students when they don't understand something

WORST POSSIBLE TEACHER! He seems to think his calculations is always the simplest. But oh no, it's not! He tries too hard to make it simple, but it backfires. Everything is so hard if you do it his way. He is also an incredibly harsh grader! Attendance is of course, required. You can survive only if you have taken it before and you're retaking it.
HORRIBLE TEACHER. made me feel stupid and was unwilling to help. I taught myself.
just plain weird.
The worst professor I ever had in 4 years at SLU.
He is what sparticus would call****GUS-MAXIMUS!!!

AWFUL! I dropped the class after i repeatedly asked for him to explain the problems and got no help...this class "math in the real world" is like kids math on crack-my roommate who is in calculus couldnt even help me with the problems. and he REFUSES to help. DO NOT TAKE
The material for the class was very difficult and he was not at all helps students to grasp it. Maybe this is why 8 of 14 students dropped the class.

It took a bit to get over his appearance, but his teaching skills definately distracts you from his outfits. was always willing to help me, even though he made me work/think for the answers. overall I liked his class.

Dr. Harris explains things really thoroughly. The guy is freaking smart; he literally makes up proofs off the top of his head and never uses notes, yet makes things very clear. His tests and projects are pretty hard, but he lets you work in groups. He crossdresses, but I won't hold it against him.
strange man... very strange man.. you may see him riding around campus on his bike.. he'll be the bald one wearing women's clothing...class kinda sucked.. a lot

taught off the wall abstract math concepts in course titled "math thinking in the real world"...wasn't always willing to give help. but, gave a lot of homework assignments to boost grades... however the assignments were a pain and graded harshly
i got out of his class within the first week, could teach makeovers better than math
No Comments
watch out...doesn't really like to help
No Comments
Dead sexy.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Jamal Abdul-Hafidh

reviews.comment: Cheat sheets for exams and teaches you everything you need to know in lecture making it easy to understand. Attendance is not mandatory but the only way to do good is by taking notes and do the mock exams; they are similar to the actual exam. The R assignments for his class are easier than any other professor. Pop quizzes aren't worth a grade!

the exams are online + cheat sheet. easy exams. no grades for attendance but you have to attend to write notes because the slides in canvas are not the same as class. if you are good in math you will be fine. also upgraded me for 2 grades ! he is the best.

He does not communicate well at all, for the final week of classes he cancelled both of them. Didn't teach us the modules for the final either, leaving us alone. He teaches lazily and makes us use YouTube and google for the answers because they're our 'professors'. His exams have questions we never learned in class either, making you lose points.
Would never take him ever again
He for real doesn't know whats going on would not reccomend

worst professor on this campus, doesn't know how to teach or how to communicate properly with his students. the last two classes before finals where we were supposed to learn what was on the final he didnt show up and didn't make it up. -100/10

He actually wants you to learn statistics, and how it applies to your life. This class was the one that I was most scared for this semester, and he has made it my favorite class! He will always answer a question, and wants us to succeed, unlike some other professors at this university. He is one of the good ones!

There were times when test questions just did not make sense. Based on the information given, you would do a certain process but he actually wanted you to do something completely different. Homework is important to get a good grade.

Jamal's OPM 3050 class was pretty easy but lectures were very boring. There is a good amount of online homework & you have 2 attempts for each assignment. You get a double-sided cheat sheet for every test that is taken online in class & quizzes aren't graded. Several test questions come from his practice tests that he posts.

Dr. Abdul-Hafidh is a goat. If you participate, the class will be super easy, and the more you answer questions the more lenient he will be with your grade. Try to sit in the front two rows. He often uses questions that are in his in-class review. He lets you a cheat sheet for every exam. We have quizzes that he says are graded, but they're not.

Professor Abdul is the best. He is understanding and a great person to learn stats from. Participation in class will help a lot, and do the practice problems for the exams! He will also stay after class to help students if necessary. Great prof!

This is definitely a class that I cruised through and was super easy. He is a super easy-going professor and tells you exactly what you need for the exams (and you get a note sheet). I could see how if you were struggling you could get frustrated with him, but I never took AP stats in high school and had 0 problems.

He is an easy going teacher. I had to take this class, but I am not a math major so I didn't mind that his lecture and teachings weren't super in depth. Homework doesn't always line up but it is easy to find answers/ask others for help. For tests, you are allowed a cheat sheet. There are "pop" quizzes but he tells you and just review before class.

This professor always told you exactly what you needed to know for exams. All notes taken were useful for exams, and we were allowed to have a cheat sheet for all exams. He teaches you how to do everything on the calculator and makes the concepts really easy to understand. Overall, he makes the class fun and is very nice

Great humor, and really easy tests. He allows you to bring a full page(front and back) to each test, and the tests themselves are insanely easy even if you have no experience in stats like me. The only annoying thing is RStudio assignments which you can probably leech off of one of your group members if they have the code done.
There's a total 3 exam (30 MC and maybe 1 FRQ) and 1 final exam. No midterm. If you've taken AP Statistics, this class will be easy for you. You also get to bring in a page of notes.

This class is pretty disorganized as the Sapling hw topics and the lecture topics don't complement each other. He is not flexible about hw due dates. This class is an easy A if you do your sapling hw, assignments using r studio, and the exams. Easy exams, but watch the lecture videos and take the practice test.

The most useless proffessor I have seen. He is so lazy and does not want to spend time to teach. please, don't take him he will make you fall asleep. He is so rude also and does not care about his students. Also, you will not understand his lectiures as he is not organized and does not know how to properly explain things.

Literally would give him a -5 if I could. I asked for help and he said "don't take notes". He doesn't respond and none of his homework assignments line up with his lectures. He is inconsiderate and literally puts in zero effort to help.

Hated his class; he comes across as nice, and will push exams back if you complain enough, but his teaching is so confusing it doesn't matter.
