Doesn't use "R studio" at all which is what the class is supposed to be based on, and uses "his English" as an excuse for absolutely anything he does wrong. Never responds to emails and isn't accessible.

Hes pretty chill and gives easy online tests (can use a notecard). The homework he assigns through sapling doesn't line up at all with what we are learning in class, but its easy to find answers. seems like he actually cares that we understand the material unlike other teachers I have had

honestly jamal is a homie, nice guy and gives a notecard for tests. he teaches the material in a confusing/disorganized way so it will benefit you to talk to him outside of class and have him help you organize it in a way that makes sense to you. textbook is not helpful so don't even try. not much homework, daily quizzes will not count against you

He's a very good professor and cares about students who actually put in effort to learn. Don't hesitate to ask questions about R Studio, though you can find almost everything online. He wants you to succeed, but you must do your part.

I enjoyed his class and thought he was very friendly and knowledgable. It is imperative that you take good notes in his class, but if you pay attention and study the material you should do well on the exams. He does not try to trick you, he expects you to have studied. Not a ton of homework, notecard for exams, fair tests, nice guy!

At first, he seems like a great guy and knows what he is doing. After a few weeks, he gets very passive aggressive when he teaches and begins to not explain things because he thinks we should know it. Does not respond to emails and does not put grades into blackboard. Tests are hard to pass because the questions are all trick questions. DO NOT TAKE

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Julianne Rainbolt

reviews.comment: Avoid this professor at all cost for linear algebra! Extreme amounts of homework. The homework is not even productive, it's just questions each with like 8 parts of repeating the same algorithms/methods. The test are terrible, they test you on how fast you can calculate fractions and do book keeping rather than the actual concepts of the material.

Overall, Dr. Rainbolt does a fine job at teaching Differential Equations. She uses a ton of examples during lecture and the exams are based heavily upon the review she sends out. Differential Equations is hard, but show up to class, do the homework, and you will be just fine in her class.
A lot of miscellaneous homework

She was okay form what I heard from all other professors. If you do go to her office hours she will explain the topic more clearly and she does give examples that are fairly easy. I say she is not a bad professor but get ready to stay on top of the work. Her tests are fairly easy when she gives out examples from last years. There is extra credit

The class its self being calc makes the material difficult. She gives tons of examples in class. The book work wasn't mandatory but was a huge help. Using all of her resources will help you succeed. Quizzes are short and test are always out of 100. She curves test grades if everyone did bad and gives extra credit. Grades fairly easy!!!

Dr.Rainbolt is actually the worst professor to ever exist. She is so awkward and moans/laughs after ever word. She doesn't explain anything unless you go to her office hours, but then she laughs at you if you still don't understand. I usually love math she made me HATE it. OVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!!!!
Grades hard, missing a bracket gets you a -3
Calc 2 is known to be a difficult course, but if you stay on top of the homework you should be fine. Also gives extra credits before tests towards the quiz grade.

I didn't really admire this professors teaching skills. HOWEVER, I am glad I took her class for Calculus II (apparently the hardest of the calculuses) because it requires little effort to get a good grade (she gives extra credit often and quiz grades rarely change your grade). Do your homework and show up and you will be fine.

Lots of work outside of class. If you do and understand all of it, you should be fine on tests. She gives extra credit review packets before tests. No curve balls on the tests. She is awkward, so class isn't fun, but she explains concepts pretty well. She goes over problems that she knows will cause issues in homework.

I loved Dr. Rainbolt for Calc 2. She is a little boring but if you pay attention she is an excellent teacher. The tests can be a little tough but it was also Calc 2 so. Overall, definitely recommend her for any math class you have.

Rainbolt was one of my favorite teachers. She was very clear cut and presented the material in a simple way. There was a lot of work outside of class like Webwork on top of the bookwork, but that is what made it so understandable. Also, she is always there to help. You email her your problem and she explains it back. 10/10 would recommend.

I would never take a class with this professor ever again. Had the absolute worst time in this class and found no help outside of it either. She was not understanding or clear in her lectures and just seemed to spit out all of these ideas during class without actually explaining anything. Weekly quizzes and exams are really tough, DON'T take her

Dr. Rainbolt is a good teacher. She really wants you to understand the material well. This is essentially a graduate level class though math majors take it as undergrads, so you should expect to dedicate a lot of time to it. Work hard, and you will do well. Weekly homework assignments are long, but helpful. In the end, you really know your stuff.

Poster child for introversion. Nervous, awkward and slightly strange in front of a group of people. Gets frustrated easily. Not a performer. *However*, if you keep this in mind and talk to her outside of class, she's very friendly, approachable and helpful. Lectures are clear, homework is helpful, tests are reasonable.

Avoid this idiot at all costs. I did fine in the class but she was still the worst prof i've ever had. I can't believe she is actually a prof at a university. I had to teach myself EVERYTHING and if you are not one of those people (which i really am not) then dont take her. She is also has the personality of a door knob. Horrible

Ill be completely honest...i taught myself most of the stuff. i did the assigned homework everynight and if i didnt get something i asked her in class the next day and she would do it on the board. i got an A and sat in the back and did nothing. but i did the hw and studied and taught myself. thats the hard part. dont miss more than 3 classes.

Dr. Rainbolt is the worst professor I have ever had. You would think that she just started teaching yesterday. She can't explain anything. She is defensive when asked questions in class; so don't even bother with your questions. She pretends that she is smarter than everyone in the class and berates her students when they ask questions.

I'm not sure why/how she's been teaching as long as she has... she's probably the worst math instructor I've experienced, and I love math - she made me hate it. She gets irritated when you ask questions, and you can tell she's so nervous/awkward at the front of the room. Avoid her classes if possible. Good person, terrible teacher!
Horrible Teacher. Tough grader and class. Can not explain anything. Weird, laughs at herself randomly.

Socially awkward, I think my knowledge of mathematics decreased while in the class. VERY EASY. She laughs nervously at the chalkboard for no apparent reason. I often got the feeling she had no idea what she was talking about.
Reminded me of a high school teacher. She has a nervous laugh and get flustered when you ask a question.

Not my favorite class. It was pretty easy, but I think that it was due to my previous calc background. She spends too much time explaining easy stuff and not enough time teaching harder stuff. Her explanations are awkward and drawn-out and she seems uneasy and strange when teaching students. Quizzes are every Friday and homework is graded.

Terrible teacher. She took forever to explain how to find the perimeter of something and then couldn't explain anything that was actually a difficult concept. As someone who had no previous calculus experience, I didn't learn anything. She was socially awkward and seemed scared of students in general. Don't take this class!
terrible teacher, doesn't know how to explain anything. students who had taken calc previously did terrible.
She was always available for help. If you don't understand something be sure to ask!! Overall found her to be a good teacher.

Awful teacher, boring, knew more calculus before I took her, teaches basic easy stuff in class then runs out of time to teach you the more difficult material. Yelled at us because she was 10 minutes over and we tried to leave. No respect for her at all.
Boring, not good at explaining things, ackward
No Comments
the class was ok in that I knew more when I got out and it was neither easy or hard. She is hard to get a hold of out of class but is helpful if you do get a hold of her.

the absolute WORST teacher i have ever had. didn't give a **** about her students, didn't care whether or not we were even there. i have never truly hated a teacher before, but if i hadn't dropped the class she for sure would have been the first. HORRIBLE

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Daniel Freeman

reviews.comment: Dr. Freeman was a great teacher. He didn't really try and get to know us, which I think is his main downfall. Being that math is not my strong suit, I think he did a great job of explaining and re-explaining when needed. He is also willing to give homework extensions.

He is one of the best math professors SLU has. He is beyond kind & understanding. He explains things very clearly & prepares you well. Had him for principals of mathematics and would 100% take him for more math class in the future. He is willing to work with you outside of class. Downside is that he doesn't have Canvas, so YOU need to communicate.
Dr Freeman was one of the best math professors I have taken at SLU. He cares about the students and works hard to make sure we all understand the material.

I took Freeman for calc 3 and he was amazing! super understanding and very good at explaining! I highly recommend Freeman if you are able to get into his class. My only criticism would be that he does not use canvas for grades so you will not know your grade in the class except for at midterm. Overall, the best math professor at SLU I have ever had
Good guy and professor. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! He is much better one on one than in person.

You don't use the textbook at all so don't bother buying. Nice teacher. The class is overall easy. The quizzes are based off of the hw and tests are based off the quizzes/hw so there is no surprises. That being said, you have pay attention to the details and drill every problem until you have it perfect (if you are shooting for an A not an A-)
Tough class but Freeman is excellent teacher and prepares you well for exams, ie. no surprises

MATH 135 with Dr. Freeman is really easy, just pay attention in class and do the homework. It's all about logic, some math induction and probability. He is a funny and helpful professor and everyone in the class is a CS majorminor.

Good professor, knows his stuff well. Has a good sense of humor and brings his dog to class every day for you to pet. Homework is useful, but some problems are much harder than examples in class. One of the more interesting math classes that I've taken
Nice teacher

He is new to the university so he was very nervous. He explains concepts a lot and genuinely wants you to do well and encourages students to go to his office hours. Super nice guy and a great professor!
Good teacher very smart very nervous and skidish. Very nice. Takes some time to explain simple concepts.

This is his first year teaching, so I can tell he's nervous, but he knows a lot about the material. Class group work is great, the online homework can be annoying to type in, but it's helpful. The test are sort of hard, but he let's you make up half the points back. The class is even better if you already took Calc. He's easily available for help

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Caden Beddingfield

reviews.comment: The negative reviews are from people who failed his class are are salty. This professor is great! He grades on time he is VERY respectful and we barely get any homework! He respects his students and reaches out to them everyday to check up on them

I have never felt more disrespected by a professor. I couldn't ask a question without him yelling and just repeating the exact same thing that is written on the computer. It's obvious that he knows the material, he just absolutely doesn't know how to teach it. If you value your learning, gpa, and mental well being, DO NOT TAKE HIM

DO NOT TAKE HIM

reviews.comment: He rushed through math and coding. Class felt self taught and coding heavy. He was disrespectful and made students feel hesitant to ask questions. Long homework assignments and difficult coding projects. He doesn't follow his syllabus and moved up an exam with short notice. He has a very negative attitude. Office hours do not help.

This guy is the worst teacher/TA ever. He doesn't respect his students or care for his students' wellbeing. If you go to his office hours he won't be helpful, he won't look at you, and he'll talk to you as if you're an idiot. My other friends had to take MATH 1300 and none of their teachers were as bad or as rude as this guy.

No question is a bad question unless you are asking Caden beddingfield. He knows he is smarter than you and likes to show it. If you ask him a question he talks down to you and makes you feel stupid. His tests and projects are hard. He doesn't know how to teach. This is supposed to be an intro class, but it is not treated like it is.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Daniel Rowe

reviews.comment: Provided plenty of time and opportunities to go over things, IN DETAIL, that we talked about in class during office hours which was key for my success! The homework and class work is straightforward and he does his best to explain the mathy concepts in easy terms. I felt there just wasn't enough class time but that isn't his fault. Would recommend!
Daniel is definitely an OG. There's a lot of homework in the class but he gives everyone a lot of help which is awesome.

Rowe is a really nice guy and does really try to help his students. Personally, his teaching strategy didn't really click for me so I had a hard time understanding a lot of the things he was teaching. He grades easily and gives you points without having the full answer.

Rowe was a good professor. He wasn't anything special, but he made sure you could receive help and would show he cared. Be prepared for a lot of lecturing but no time for him to answer your questions or help you with classwork that you always have to do out of class. He's super relaxed and better than the other 1320 teachers.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Darrin Speegle

reviews.comment: MATH1300x. Very sweet and cares about your success in the class. Attendance is not mandatory but he does not post any lectures or notes. He is not very tech savvy with canvas. His class mostly uses R, instead of statistics by hand. He is overall pretty easy as long as you turn in the homework (which has a 48 hour extensions always). He is lovely.
Dr Speegle is extremely clear. He is a very forgiving grader who wants you to succeed. I would highly recommend taking his course for stress free statistics.

Professor Speegle has been one of my favorite math professors by far. Highly recommend. The material is a little complicated, but he does a good job of breaking it down. If you don't understand something, just email him and he will be glad to meet with you and go over it. His tests are fair, and he gives partial credit.

Probably the most vague and confusing class I've ever taken. No feedback on Tests or corrections so you have no clue what you did wrong. Unhelpful and expects too much. Only took the class because it was required.
I took Dr. Speegle for his Statistics class. Expect to use the program R heavily in class. Dr. Speegle is a very helpful in office hours, but can be a tough grader on projects especially.

Ive taken Dr. Speegle for two semesters now and would absolutely recommend you to take him. He's clear, enthusiastic, open to questions, a fair grader, and extremely helpful during office hours. He's also pretty hilarious. Most classes are basically copying from the board but he usually makes stops to explain whats going on with excellent examples.

He is a good professor. I highly recommend that going to the lecture every and take note carefully. Then you don't need to read book a lot because he gives all contents from the class note. Make sure you understand all examples he gives during the class and use them to finish the homework, and then you will succeed in the test. I had A- for it.

Difficult class, but pretty good teacher. He's very willing to help but you have to show that you have done your part, ie your work first. tests are pretty hard but the homework isn't so bad and can really help your grade. overall, he is a good prof at explaining calculus well.

Dr. Speegle is an awesome teacher, and you will definitely get out what you put in. By that I mean you will have to study and do the homework if you expect to succeed but more often then not it pays off on test day if you take the time to think things through

He's a good guy, very nice. Fun class if you like math, but it's not my thing. Came up with crazy hard problems out of nowhere and having no background of any calc in high school I was clueless. Dropped the class and took in the summer w/another teacher. If you have some knowledge of calc you'll do fine, just do the hw.
TESTS ARE IMPOSSIBLE...the questions are new problems that he comes up with and you need to know theory in and out to do them... but he curves grades..

Dr. Speegle is really funny. He is quirky. The class is really easy as long as you pay attention and you should take notes. Attendance is not mandatory, but you are better off if you go. If you find a friend and you miss class, just get the notes you missed. If you are looking for a class to get rid of you math requirement, take this class!
GREAT TEACHER! Is very helpful in everything. Course work is not the easiest, but he helps so much. 2 Tests a few group project. WOULD RECOMMEND.

Really nice guy, and things got better as the semester went on, but he was really unclear at the beginning of the semester. A lot of long, awkward silences when he asks a question to the whole class and no one has a clue how to answer. Very fair though, and wants you to learn.
Great Teacher. Really subtle yet extremely fun sense of humor. Really enjoys students, will mingle before class etc. Highly recommend!

I've taken calculus twice, folks, and I absolutely hated it the first time. Now, I want to be a math teacher. He is sooo patient and nice, the kind of teacher that tells you you're "sort of right" to make you feel better. You'll learn alot and it's a low stress environment.
Class was an interesting spin on math properties/ principles. Whenever I struggled in class, Dr. Speegle was always there to help and work with me/ other students.

I took CS 1 with Speegle, after which I changed my major to Computer Science. I liked how the class was structured, and I liked his attitude and that lil' mad scientist sparkle in his eye sometimes as he talked about his little programs pulled up on the projector. SLU's CS guru!
If you have to take Calculus II he is by far the best teacher at SLU
Always ready to answer your questions
Hard teacher, but if you survive his class you will have learned a lot

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ryan Landvoy

reviews.comment: If you show up and do your homework it will be an easy A. If he knows you and he knows you care and show up for class, he will be more lenient on quizzes and test. Test questions look EXACTLY like quiz questions. 10/10 teacher. Great guy and made my calc 2 experience amazing.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Kelly Ballard

reviews.comment: Really good at helping students see a different perspective on concepts that might be harder to understand for some students. Not at all intimidating and never makes you feel less than for getting something wrong. Ultimately cares about you and your well being.
She is an amazing teacher who respects and cares for her students while being able to teach the course extremely competently.

Very engaging lectures and cares about students' well-being. She's pretty funny, chaotic, and laid back. She's not strict about anything besides tests. There is not a lot of homework in the class, and the tests are easy to pass if you pay attention. Sometimes, she makes easy concepts a bit confusing, but she's amazing overall.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sarah Morris

reviews.comment: PLEASE TAKE HER!!! Best professor ever. She's super sweet, her tests are extremely easy, linient on late work as long as you communicate, and she loves her students. She always reminded us at the end of class to be kind to others, and it was a true reflection of herself. 100000/10!!!!!

Mrs. Morris was by far one of the best professors I ever had. She made a hard subject very easy and made sure that everyone understood what she was teaching before moving on. Her reviews are very similar to the tests and will normally curve or add points if the average was lower than expected. Loved her. Take her if you can.

Sarah always had the sweetest and bubbliest personality of all my professors. I had her for 8:00 AM pre-calc and she was just AWESOME. her tests are extremely easy, and the reviews are almost identical to all the tests. She just wants everyone to succeed and be happy. I loved her so much. TAKE HER

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Craig Rollins

reviews.comment: Not very communicative, already retired from first job and is very persuadable if you want a due date moved. I found lectures hard to understand, he makes other students help him teach. Hearing aid often go off during class, which can be distracting if you don't like high pitched noises

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Elodie Pozzi

reviews.comment: Favorite professor at Saint Louis. Gives time to both lecture, in class activities, and one on one guidance with all students. Her style of teaching is great and she can read the room well. She is a very patient professor, be sure to keep asking questions and stay curious and you should be able to do very well.

Professor Pozzi is a great professor. She explains the material clearly and gives lots of examples in class. The tests and quizzes are basically just the reviews but with the numbers changed, and she gives a lot of partial credit and good feedback on why things were wrong.
It was such a pleasure having Dr. Pozzi for this semester. She's very caring towards the students and does her best to accommodate everyone to the best of her ability
I absolutely loved having Dr. Pozzi
Very caring and understanding!

Dr. Pozzi is always VERY clear about what will be on the tests. Usually sends out announcements on which specific types of questions will be covered. Very accessible at office hours and always provides specific feedback at the end of every test/quiz. Knew everyone's name after the first day. Definitely recommend!!

Exams were hard, but as long as you do the homework and do well on the quizzes, it'll balance out the hard exams. Lectures are sometimes confusing, but that's just Calc 3. A quick read of the chapter in the textbook will clear things up.

I have had this professor in the past. I did not enjoy the class. Not one bit. The exams were not relevant to anything she taught us. She taught calc 3 (I'm not a Math major so I don't know what calc 3 material is). Her class was so hard. Her accent was thicker than a bowl of oat meal. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

She's a Nice lady but her accent was really thick and it made it hard to understand. She also went really fast and didn't ever do practice problems together. The tests were hard but Calc is a hard class in general so if you try really hard I'm sure you'll do fine but if you struggle with understanding accents then I wouldn't take her!
Exams and tests are easier than some homework problems. Calc isn't easy, but professor Pozzi explains things well and just do the hw and attend class. It will be fine.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Geoffrey Kangogo

reviews.comment: THE KINDEST TEACHER AT SLU. He is super helpful and is very understanding of the technology issues that occur while using R. Truly wants you to succeed and learn biostats without having to stress. He also responds to emails very fast regardless the time of day or day of the week. Homework is very straightforward as well as all other assignments

Super responsive to email which made this class not bad at all. He is hard to understand in lectures but everything is posted online. The tests are similar to his study guides. He can seem strict at times but if you talk to him he is very understanding and always willing to help. His TA is super picky with the grading but the class is fine overall!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James Hebda

reviews.comment: Hebda is a very smart man and a good professor, however his lectures can be confusing. There was no homework for the class, but your grade was entirely exam. This was scary, as the final was really really bad and based on the grading scale I should have received a C, but he gave me a B+ in the class. He is very kind and patient, go to office hours!

Very sweet, extremely qualified guy. He's probably just too smart to be teaching pre-calc. Homework was weighted low, but probably required 5-7 hours of work every week. I'm not sure if exams were actually that difficult, but they were weighted so high in the class that they *ruined* my grade, and so many others. Do not take.

He's smart, but not good at teaching. Assigned way too much homework just for all of it to be 15% of your grade. Whenever you would ask him a question, he didn't answer very clearly either. The average grade for the tests was in the mid-low 60s, and he made the class way harder than it needed to be. Too much material to learn in too short of a time

He seemed like a sweet guy but the way he teaches no one understood what he was talking about. I had to read the textbook and take notes of that to even get C's on the tests. There is a lot of homework and it's only worth 15% of the grade. It was annoying doing homework 3 sometimes 4 times a week with little affect on the grade.

Nice guy, but made Discrete Math super confusing. Obviously very smart but the class was super difficult. Wasn't very good at explaining, and assigned extremely tough homework due every week. Big on partial credit, but some concepts I never understood. Even the "tutor" for the class couldn't help us with assignments. Find a partner in the class.
Study a lot.

Not terrible, but not the best math teacher I've ever had. Smart but has trouble relaying concepts to students sometimes. Weekly quizzes, 3 tests, and a final. Gave topics for every test but they were still pretty difficult. He moved slowly thru easy material and fast thru tough material. Explore other options for professors first, if possible.
Was a little absent minded. Required group projects about every 3 weeks. The test where hard but he curved if the scores needed it. The final was the most difficult test I have ever taken. Good Luck
Good teacher, hard tests.

He is way off in happy-math-land...and doesn't know how to talk to us people stuck in this world. He's a smart mathematician, but he just shouldn't be teaching College Algebra. I feel like I learned absolutely nothing in this class.

He's a nice guy but boy is it hard for him to talk in layman's terms. He's obviously experienced in mathematics and therefore has a tough time relating himself to us college algebra folk who are just taking the class for the credit and hate math. He's willing to help, but he just isn't good at it! Ambiguous..get a tutor and you will do fine.
No Comments
Great Teacher, very smart and knows what he's talking about. Easygoing and helpful. Works with students so they learn.
horrible teacher. teaches to himself not to the class. you have to teach yourself out of the book. drop this class while you can.
Awful Teacher

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Olivia Frank

reviews.comment: Olivia Frank is a grad student, so she is still learning how to teach. Lectures were hard to follow as she would frequently mess up the example problems. Exam questions didn't match study guide questions. She is super sweet and helpful 1on1 though. Don't recommend for those who struggle with math. She'll get better with more teaching experience.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Lauren Miller

reviews.comment: Great teacher and gives extra credit for tutoring attendance.

Dr. Miller was phenomenal!! She is funny, caring, and clearly passionate about the material. She makes math more fun and approachable, and I admire her ability to inspire curiosity and creativity in her students. I have so much respect for her as both a teacher and a human. Definitely take one of this woman's classes if you can!

Best math professor I have ever had. I hate math and have always been bad at it but Dr. Miller made me excited to come to class. Embrace the quirky-ness and try to get as much as you can out of it. She is very helpful and accessible outside of class, as well as understanding and just genuinely a good person. Take Dr. Miller!

Great lectures, additional on-line lessons to help with subject matter. Lots of homework, but if you keep up with it, you'll understand all you need for exams. She is one of the two best Math Professors I've had at the University level. Do the work and you will get the grade.

Very caring and a good person, lots of homework assignments but manageable if you don't procrastinate, tests are average but she gives a practice test that is pretty much identical to the real test. She cares a lot about her students and wants to see them succeed. Tries to make class fun with different activities.
I hate math, and I'm not very good at it either. But Dr. Miller helps you through it however she can. with all the resources she provides such as her youtube. Killer Professor

Dr. Miller is a great teacher and is very available outside of class. Homework on Pearson doesn't necessarily match the lecture but is not too difficult. She makes math fun and prepares you well for tests using "practice tests". Genuinely love her.

Took class for a gen-ed requirement. Unnecessary homework that takes hours and does not match the content of the class. Quizzes are impossible because the homework is nothing like the content of the quizzes and exams. Honestly, haven't learned anything and regret taking this course.

Solid professor, class isn't hard. Go to class, do the homework, GO TO THE TEST REVIEWS, and you will do fine. She is very clear with regards to what she is testing. The material isn't hard, lectures are easy to follow, and the group projects aren't that hardjust time consuming . There is homework for every section but it's helpful.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Álvaro Illán Rubio

reviews.comment: People say he has a strong accent. He teaches with passion. He has a weekly assignments that are normally fairly easy. Exams were fairly straight forward. He does not try to trick you

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Christian Geske

reviews.comment: He was a great professor and his notes were extremely helpful.
Best professor at Slu. Took him for calculus and he explained everything in detail at a perfect pace.

If you struggle with math, TAKE HIM FOR PRECALC. While some of my friends struggled in Pre-Calc, I actually understood it for once. Go to class and do the assignments and you will be successful. Very good lecture, tests were easy as long as you did the homework. Drops 2 lowest grades from each homework category. 10/10 professor.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Isaac Collins

reviews.comment: Isaac is a great guy, but a terrible professor. He didn't teach, instead he copied the rules of pre-calc on a chalkboard expecting you to understand how to use them solely based on copying down their definitions. There's extra credit, cheat sheets on exams (he will allow more than one if the class begs), and multiple choice, his only saving grace.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James J. Munden

reviews.comment: This was the WORST ONLINE CLASS I HAVE TAKEN. Hours of homework, most homework was posted late giving you limited time to complete it. Professor was never available or took days to answer emails. The class consisted of other individuals' lectures/ slides none of this professor's own. Proctors were terrible, hours late, or didn't have the exam.
Tests are completely inconsistant with homework assigned.
Great Teacher. Explains well. Has a fan club also.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Kevin Menos

reviews.comment: Mr. Menos isn't a great teacher at all. He's unorganized, he's hard to work with and he is very manipulative and controlling. You will do better online then having him for a math teacher in math 140.
Best teacher ECC has for math
Kevin is nice. He keeps track of attendance but won't grade you on that. Just do your homework, ask questions when you don't understand the materials, and study for the test, you will get A.
Take anyone else. He makes you feel stupid when you ask questions and is overall a low quality teacher.
Not very good. Hard to understand his accent. Assigns too much homework and doesn't explain concepts clearly. Try to take someone else.
HORRIBLE. Avoid him, his lectures make no sense. He is completely unhelpful. Makes it impossible to prepare for tests because there is so much material.
Boring. Uninspiring. The class drags, but the material isn't hard. Be prepared to teach yourself though, Mr. Menos is about as bad as they come.
No teaching ability

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Oday Hazaimah

reviews.comment: Dr. Hazaimah is a good professor. Sometimes his lectures are hard to understand, but he is always willing to help you with questions during office hours and work problems you are struggling with. His test problems are usually the same or very similar to class examples and problems from the book. Forgiving grader when it comes to partial credit.

Dr. Hazaimah's lectures are sometimes disorganized and sloppy. It is sometimes tough to understand the material at first glance based on how he teaches. However, much redemption is given because the class was not very difficult in workload or material. The homework was targeted and helpful and lots of examples are done in class. He is very caring.
There was no surprise test content and topics were covered in depth. I am leaving this class with an excellent grasp on the covered material.

Took him for calculus one, he is a very nice guy just is not the best teacher. His lectures are confusing and the homework is never like what you learn in class. He didnt input grades until end of semester, and the exams are most of your grade so study a lot. Exams have very few questions but are worth a lot of points per question

We have a quiz every two weeks and it's easier than the examples he gives in class. Homework is quite hard sometimes but you can search on Google or just ask him. He gives practice and has a review day before an exam. Exams are not so hard, but if you're an ambitious student who wants to get above 95 on 100, it'll be challenging. Has extra credit

Oh my god. I'm a 4.0 student and always have done well in my classes. This is by far the worst course I have ever taken at any uni. Went to office hours, got degraded for not knowing "basic math" or what he calls "high school math" if he ever says that head to the department chair. I want everyone to succeed in a math class, just TRUST ME.
tags:
just TRUST ME.
TOUGH GRADER
Helpful

0

reviews.comment: Quiz every Friday, 4 exams, mostly all free response. Very nice professor, willing to explain anything, super generous with giving partial and extra credit as long as you show work. Webwork can be hard but helpful in understanding material, easy A if you took AP Calc in hs. Posts all lectures online but the quality is bad so just go to class.

SLU's math dept is trash. Oday is not the worst teacher, but not the best, a nice guy though. Calc is a hard topic to understand and lectures are fairly straightforward but unorganized. His tests were far harder than example given in class, extremely frustrating. He did offer extra credit and made the final easier. got most test Qs from the book.

Oday made me cry everyday after class. His teaching is very unorganized and nobody ever knows what Chapter/Section we are on. He is very condescending when you ask questions and is not very approachable. Also, his tests average 5 questions so if you don't know one concept you already start with an 80%.

If I could give him a zero I would. The tests scale up in difficulty from what you learn in class, making them impossible. If you wanted to ask a question, don't bother-- he'll just speak condescending towards you and make you think you're the bad guy for asking a question. Everyone fails the exams, and he doesn't curve. So, good luck.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Jeff Mueller

reviews.comment: I loved Professor Mueller. He is laid back, gives us time in class to work on projects, gives us notecards for tests, and even gives out extra credit. I would definitely take him again, couldn't ask for a better STATS teacher.

He teaches lectures in a way where he acts like you already know the material. There were 5 group projects and 2 article projects, which were time consuming. He barely gave us class time and you often had to meet outside of class with your group to get it done. One nice thing tho was he lets you use a flashcard on exams and even the final.

Professor Mueller runs his class in a way where you are expected to learn material and complete homework and assignments outside of class and review inside of class. There are 7 or 8 projects throughout the semester and 2 article projects. Regular homework. Not the worst class ever but pretty difficult if math is challenging for you.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Logan Clark

reviews.comment: Logan is a compassionate and understanding TA who goes above and beyond to help his students succeed in calculus. It's great to have a TA who shows patience and gives extra credit to help students improve their grades. Logan cares about his students and is committed to helping them learn and achieve their goals.
Nice professor

Like most math courses, the tests often do not reflect what's taught in class and through homework. WebWork homework system is really messy and difficult to work with. Nice guy but the tests are hard to deal with even if you study nonstop for them. Will give extra credit for points back on tests at end of semester however. Overall very mid class.

I had a hard time getting help outside of class, hw was on webwork & it didn't correlate with what he was teaching. 3 tests that seemed easy but I didn't do well on them. Had to attend tutoring so many times bc I wasn't understanding anything from him. He does offer extra credit at the end to make up for ur past exams. If u can take someone else.

Professor Clark is a really solid choice for Calculus. I am horrible at math and I came out of this class better than I could have ever hoped. He is willing to hold your hand and walk you through the material if you need his help and is super flexible with assignments and test. Just communicate with him and you'll be just fine!

I was scared to take this class at first but he's really good at breaking math down! He wouldn't go too fast and would take the time to review the things we were confused about. Great calc teacher and lets you know exactly what you need to study before tests!

He is clearly smart and very funny. I was skeptical at first because his voice can be hard to pay attention to, but he actually does a phenomenal job of explaining things when you get over his bored tone. Idk about before/after COVID, but FA'2020 students were given 12+ hrs (no zoom) to do the exams independently, so it's easy to do well on them.
If you have the opportunity to have Logan for pre-calc, do it! He accepts late work without penalties, allows corrections on exams, and gives good explanations in class.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Yunge Wang

reviews.comment: Do not take, literally no matter what. Never curved any tests, considering most of the class failed it. Lectures were boring and made no sense. A lot of homework, projects, and quizzes. Worse professor I have had so far.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Dal Yu

reviews.comment: Nice professor!

Provided very minimal examples. The lecture was absolutely not a lecture, it involved students doing group work which was no help because no one knew what they were doing. If you ask him a question he will be rude to you, talk down to you, and start with a sigh followed by "you should already know this". Half of my class had to retake this course

I had such high hopes for Dal Yu. The actual course isn't difficult: homework and group assignments are easy. The practice tests do not prep for the exam at all. Did not manage class time well at all. My friend ended up retaking the class with a different professor and went from a C- to an A-. DO NOT TAKE!

Dal's okay. Makes jokes during lecture sometimes, good at answering questions during class, tests+homework line up with the lectures. He can be a bit cold when it comes to accommodations or makeups. I missed a test because of a sudden death in my family and he interrogated me about my travel plans and asked if "i really needed to leave"

He told us the first day of class that he didn't like stats and it showed; he just read off the slides. Midway through the semester I missed 2 weeks of class because my dad passed away and when I came back he said "You missed a lot of class." I started to explain why I was gone and he said "Regardless of the reason, you have a lot of work to do."

Personally, I felt that he didn't actually teach the class. He just gave a couple examples of the section we needed to know and moved on. He has a high expectation of pre requisites that most of the class didn't have and he was testing us on stuff that was above what the class curriculum was(my class was calc 1- tested us on stuff from calc 2).

Prof Dal Yu was very funny and approachable; his teaching style wasn't always perfect, but for the most part it was still very easy to follow and comprehend. For anything you didn't understand, he would always be available to give clear explanations outside of class. He provided plenty of examples, extra cred opportunities, and resources to study.

Dal is a nice man but he teaches like he is reviewing and we already know the content. We don't though. He is just extremely smart and doesn't understand that we all cant set our alarms to wake up in the middle of the night and test ourselves on if we can find the critical points.

He was the worst teacher ever. 2/3 of my class had to drop because he didn't thoroughly explain answers and was a terrible teacher. He also was extremely condescending towards people in the class calling them out for not knowing something. He treated me like I was stupid and never gave me the respect of s student.

Lets you make up 1 test and offered extra credit, the overall class was very difficult. The amount of time the homework took was absurd. The textbook we use is free and online but it is not helpful. The small steps are not included. Dal is smart but his lectures are hard to follow and FAST. His extra credit was so hard the math tutor was no help
Very test heavy, but he is willing to help you out outside of the classroom. Almost 80% of your grade will be the exams, and the exams are pretty hard. I wish he didnt expect too much.

This class had its pros and its cons. Pros: Group quizzes, lots of homework (good to pad your grade), extra credit, Dal is funny, and he is very accessible outside of class. It is hard to learn the material in class however if you go meet him after class he is really good at explaining things.

I took him for Survey of Calc, not Stats, but there wasn't an option for that. I gave him a 3 because although he's a great professor, he is always unorganized and all over the place during his lectures which was too much for me. Overall, I felt like there was a bit of work, but good thing is that he does provide an online version of the textbook!

What a guy! I was worried about college calc, but he taught it in a very simple and understandable way. Homework was online and he was really flexible with extending deadlines. Lots of opportunities for extra credit and the tests are pretty straightforward and are similar to the problems he does in class. Chill dude, helpful if you have questions.

Dal is a chill dude. He gives students a chance to earn back points on exams. It's through a process but he wants to make sure you actually know the info. He explains stuff pretty well, sometime he gets confused. Then he clears it up in an email or something. He wants his students to succeed.

I love Dal! He is a super nice teacher and is great with communication! Offers plenty opportunity to make up tests that you did not do super great on. I would only say if you don't learn very well from the teacher just writing down unreadable things on the board, maybe not Dal.

Dal is an awesome guy. He's always around outside of class if you need extra guidance for the assignments. The problems he taught were relatively similar to the problems on the exams. Only downside was the online math assignments as they were tedious - fortunately he understood that the problems were broken so he adjusted scores if necessary.

A professor who is willing to stay after for one student until late at night. you can't really ask more from a professor. He is really patient, goes through every problem with you in detail. Gives a lot of extra credit and always gives good feedback. Take him if you want a good grade.

Dal is a really great teacher, I would say is the best professor I have ever had at SLU. He gives a lot of help outside of class and he is always willing to stay after for you if you have extra questions. Feels like a friend more than a professor. Definitely recommend taking his class, you get a lot of extra credit and help on exams.

Lectures were frustrating at first, but I learned his teaching style. If you want to be successful in this class you have to go see him outside of class. He is very awkward, but once you get used to him the class is easier. He's not good with in class questions or explaining things on the fly. Taking calculus in high school was my saving grace.

Really cares about his students, pretty great guy. His lectures are confusing, but he is always accessible outside of class to help with homework. He makes you work for the extra credit, but it gives practice that help with the tests. Quizzes were open note and partner. Overall a chill class, text book is free online

Loved taking Dal's class. Notes are really long but its definitely a great way to learn. He's really straightforward which I appreciate and it translates to his tests. He's really flexible in working with students, so if you need help don't be afraid to ask for it. He's quite soft-spoken so sit near the front but also really funny so its worth it.

He is a good person,but he needs to know more about teaching. The math examples he taught in class was pretty easy,but the test was way more harder. The calculates in test required you have a really strong basic knowledge about it. There were no easy points in test.

Dal was a great professor to have. Lectures have a lot of information but he teaches in depth with plenty of examples. Exams are definitely fair. Show up to class for the quizzes, easy points. This was a great class to have. You have to study for exams but everything was taught in class.

Dal isn't a bad person, but he's a horrible teacher. so boring and honestly hard to follow because he just talks and writes at the board. theres daily quizzes so you have to be in class everyday, but I guess that was a good thing because it helps your grade in the long run. this class made me want to gouge my ears out and i dreaded it every day.

if you like to write papers in your math class take him! you will write a book each class because that is how his notes laid out. He is a kind guy and has a funny dry humor but you an tell he doesnt want to be in class either. AKA if you love to write and be bored take it

If you only need the one math credit, I highly recommend college algebra. Easy A if you took algebra in high school. All quizzes are group quizzes and open note and the tests are really straight forward. Easily accessible outside of class if you have any issues. Prof. doesn't really teach so much as he uses a lot of examples and analogies.

Dal is a good guy but not a great teacher, in fact I learned halfway through the semester he is a graduate school teacher. He is a real laid back guy but you need to approach him with questions. Like many math classes, you need to be in attendance to pass. I tried teaching myself and did not work out to well.

Dal's lectures are really boring but tests are straight from the notes. The first couple tests were really easy, last two are what messed up my grade. Just study the notes and ask him questions when you don't understand and you'll get an A.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Kathleen Kramer

reviews.comment: She went at a much slower pace than other calc 2 classes which allowed me to not feel rushed much like people I knew in the other classes.

Professor Kramer is an excellent calculus professor. The layout of her curriculum is very clear to follow and ensures that you actually understand material before tests. She is very lenient when it comes to late work and making up things. She often offers extra credit assignments before exams and the exams are very very similar to the review guides

I took her class Fall of 2020 at SLU, and she is a wonderful teacher. She explains everything concisely and gives really clear examples of problems that are gonna be on the test. As long as you attend class or watch the videos she posts (did this bc of COVID-- not sure if this is a regular thing) you'll be fine. Good choice

Amazing Professor and always there for her students! She makes her self available to her students and is quick with replys when help is needed. I would take her again in a heart beat and recommend her to any and everyone. The class might be difficult but she tries to help out as much and that makes the class better.

Kathleen is super nice. Her class is very straight forward, but it is a very dry lecture because she never has anyone participate or have us practice what she taught us. She gives a TON of extra credit

Kramer is clear and concise during class. She writes everything on the chalkboard; that includes definitions for new terms/ topics and practice problems. She gives out a study guide before each exam, and she is usually always available to give help outside of class. Kramer hands out equation sheets and the unit circle- you can use them on her exams

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Virginia Pasken

reviews.comment: A very terrible professor who cared nothing for her students. She would verbally insult students who did not understand the material. No help whatsoever. Avoid at all costs.

Gives very detailed study guides which are exactly like what's on the test. She is good at explaining things and does so in a simple way. Extra credit is offered every class and will help you so so much. Pre calc is hard, but with her as your professor, it is not hard to succeed and get an A!

She gives extra credit quizzes everyday on material learned in the previous class. These quizzes go toward your test grade, which is very helpful. There are also group worksheets that help you to go over material with others in your class. These are helpful if you are confused on a specific lesson. Gives multiple tests. Highly recommend.
Extra credit quizzes make the class easy. Got 3 of my 5 test scores were over 100%. Lectures are clear and if you do the homework and show up you should get a good grade no problem.

Pre-Calc is a hard class but she gives SO MANY opportunities to do well. Every day she gives extra credit quizzes which you can get 3/3 on if you just paid attention in class which adds points to your tests. She gives 5 tests instead of 3 to give more opportunities for points. She replaces the lowest test with final. She makes it easy to succeed.
No.
As long as you pay attention in class the exams are extremely easy.

Profesor Pasken teaches the class as if everyone has taken pre-calc before. I never had a problem with math before this class, she really is tough and its a lot of hard work. She even says on the first day she teaches the class as if everyone has taken pre-calc before. Would not recommend.

She is an awful teacher. Not helpful whatsoever. I took Pre-Calc with her never having taken the class, and she taught it not only thinking, but expecting every student had already taken the course. It is taught poorly. No help at all with preparation, and her teaching method is write a lot down and hope it sticks with her students. BAD IDEA!!!!!!!

She says she cares about her students but acts otherwise. It was suppose to be my easyblowoff class but I ended up working really hard in it. She is not good at keeping track of homework or group worksheets and she seems to not really want to help you if she believes that your not going to succeed.

She will ridicule you if you do not go to class, she's often mocked students in class and presents almost no help before or after class. Extremely difficult and goes through material VERY quickly. Get outside help or you'll fail.
She was a great teacher. Lots of extra credit. Office hours saved me.

Pretty average as far as most math teachers go, but like so many math people I've met, she struggles to relate to non-math people. She moves very quickly through a lot of material, so if you get hung up on a concept, it can really come back to bite you. The speed at which the class moves is even worse due to a cumulative final.

Despite what others say. She is an awesome Lady. As long as you participate and show up to class she is willing to help! Tests are straight off of her review sheets and the quizzes are basic homework problems. I would recommend this class.
Took her class and got an easy A. The tests aren't terrible if you briefly look over your notes before. Extra credit is offered and she is always more than willing to help and answer questions.

Ms. Pasken was a helpful teacher who gave plenty of examples and clearly connected concepts to examples. Her tests were fair, though the final was quite a doozey. She had clear office hours, worked with students who were struggling and was generally more than happy to answer question in class. I had her for pre-calc, it wasn't hard but work.

I should have listened to the comments on this site. She is not an effective teacher, and I dropped her class within a week. Quizzes each class, confusing lectures, very loud speaker, not willing to help during office hours, and slightly rude. If math is not your strong suit I would switch ASAP.
Explains concepts very well but I always did absolutely terrible on her tests.

She teaches pretty fast, so pay attention. The main reason why I gave her a poor rating is because of her tests. She will teach one thing, assign online hw, and then when exam time comes, she gives a study guide that is WAY harder than what she taught. There are daily quizzes over the hw and there is no way to check your grade online. Nice lady tho

Very rude and condescending professor. She frequently will make you feel stupid for asking a question, but her teaching is actually pretty good, and if you pay attention and take notes you should be fine.

Her voice can get on your nerves after a while. But she explains everything thoroughly. Grading can seem unfair at times, but she gives extra credit and all tests are based off homework/quiz problems, and the exam is all old questions from the test. MORE IMPORTANTLY. She is smoking hot.

She really isn't that bad. She does notes on the board with examples of how to do each problem. There are quizes every day to makes sure you're doing the homework. She does give partial credit if you show your work and show you have an understanding of the concept. Just do the work and the class isnt that bad.

Very sweet lady. Apparently a lot of people don't like her, I do not see why. If you have a question, just say excuse me and she will immediately answer it. Very nice and very helpful. The tests are really easy, not much partial credit though. Do the practice tests. She is also very understanding if you need her to reopen homework.

She takes her test questions pretty much right from the review sheets. If you do your homework and keep up in class, the tests are a piece of cake. The final is just made up of test questions from the previous 4 or 5 tests. Homework quizzes are a great way to earn easy points!

Aside from the general consensus I'd have to say that she's an awesome teacher. Do the homework, go to class and you will pass. If you need help she is more than willing to explain things. You just NEED to put effort into the class and not expect to magically receive a good grade. DO WORK.

Let me please glean what little information I have learned from this class to you future students: Take another class/teacher. If it is the 8 am and you have work till 4 am every night, take the 8 am, you will do better in that class. Pasken explains very little and expects very much. Partial credit is a foreign concept. Run. Seriously.

Worst. Professor. Ever. Avoid at all costs if you do not want to fail. She gave me my only F, ever. She expects you to remember every single thing you'e done in math since 7th grade and then teaches it to you in some new screwed up way.
TESTS ARE EASY, and the final just make up by the old test.
She is by far the hardest grader and the tests are very hard. She takes off for everything on the tests. Not very interesting and expects you to know know to do everything from high school
runnn... to the nearest computer and drop her class if you have it ....
3 tests non-cumulative. final is cumulative. gives 1% point on each exam for every time u come to class, but the deal is off after 3 absences. often makes mistakes when teaching in class.

She is by far the hardest teacher. avoid her at all costs. She expects you to know everything is talking about. The online program is really annoying also. 1 tiny mistake and the entire thing is wrong. Does not allow you to ask questions. switch out of her immediately if you have her so you can save yourself time
She is a horrible teacher. Does not allow you to ask questions, just assumes you understand it. homework and quizzes are online and impossible
Dropped after 2 weeks. Has terrible southern accent and can't say many words correctly. Writes on the board and expects you to know it.

if you are not really good at math DO NOT TAKE HER. she does not teach in anyway she just writes on the board and you sit there and copy it then everyone fails the quizzes. i dropped after the first month because it was impossible to get anything above a c. and her voice is annoying and her fupa is out of control

Terrible teacher. Goes through 2-3 sections each day and expects you to know the material. Takes attendance every day but you learn more using the online program rather than attending class. If you miss midterm, the retake will be during the final test. AVOID!
reviews.attendance: every day but you learn more using the online program rather than attending class

reviews.comment: Bad teacher! She talks at you, not to you. yells all the time, and doesn't explain things well. Avoid her at all costs.

HORRIBLE TEACHER. completely ridiculous. She's condescending and made me feel like an idiot for even going to her office hours to ask for help. She does not know how to explain things nor teach this subject. I re-took the class with a different teacher and got a B+. If you care about your GPA then please do not take her!!!!!!
Bad teacher. She don't give us the clear direction to evaluate our final. Horriable. Hard to get A
horrible teacher. i had to drop the class. i asked for help and she told me i should drop to a lower math class. DO NOT TAKE.

I had a really hard time her. I couldn't understand her and when I went for help she just kept repeating the same things over and over expecting me to get it if she just kept going. I couldn't get in to get the tutoring sessions because I had another class and she basically told me I should skip my class to get tutored, wouldn't take again.

Very nice lady. The material is tough but she's always willing to help and wants her students to do well. I thought it would be much easier- I really had to study hard but in the end I pulled out an A-

she was horrible...i understood the material but the test were impossible. the entire class failed the tests every time. she expected me to skip other classes to go to her office hours. totally unwilling to work with me so i could meet with here. avoid her at all costs
Doing well in this class is just a matter of going to class and doing the sample test she gives you before each exam. you're going to have to work, but I think you could do a lot worse than Pasken.

The absolute worst math test I have ever had! My class started out with around 30 people and only 8 finished the year. She does not explain things well and she never stops to explain anything. DO NOT TAKE HER!!

Horrible teacher, she doesn't realize that this is still a 100 level class. She teaches like it's a 500 level course and doesn't stop to give time for questions, much less breathing. Exremely confusing, leaves lots of loose ends lying and doesn't explain how certain things are relative. Overall bad teacher; only take if you want to kill yourself.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Aruna Bandara

reviews.comment: He does a great job, the only problem is sometimes he's difficult to understand but he's always willing to help and give you a hand. His class is fairly easy as long as you show up and pay attention

There is online homework but it prepares you a lot for class and is easy to get through. He is super understanding about extensions and getting help outside of class. The study guides he provides are similar to the tests/midterm/final. I would definitely recommend this class, one of the most understanding professors I have met at SLU so far!

This professor gave many formulas for tests out every test (3 of them and the final), allowed extensions on the online homework, and let students retake quizzes if they were unhappy with him. In class it may drag a bit but he himself as a professor I cannot complain.

He's willing to help outside of class. There's a lot of hw but it's helpful, he gives study guides that are similar to the exam. If you don't get a good grade on the exam he offers extra credit to help bring it up. if you dont understand his lectures its ok b/c he posts another teacher's lecture videos that will help you pass. Definitely take.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James Coughlin

reviews.comment: He is very knowledgeable about Calculus. Theory and proofs were covered in this course so it was challenging. He is a tough grader so you are expected to put lots of time and effort into your homework. He was funny and enthusiastic in class, and made Calculus I enjoyable for students. Put in the hard work and ask questions in office hours.

Calc 2 with Fr. Coughlin; at the start I was indifferent about the class, but I've decided to add a math minor because of him. He is almost too smart, grades hard, cold calls but I've come to enjoy the rigor of the class. Definitely take if you enjoy math, avoid if you just need the credit.

His grading is completely unfair and gives no credit for any correct work if you make any mistakes on the question. You basically have to be perfect, or your grade will suffer. He makes fun of students when they make mistakes in class, and has absolutely no care for any student concern even though he asked for us to tell him our thoughts. DONT TAKE

Spends all of class doing useless proofs and assigns homework thats super difficult. The only reason I did well is because I took Calc in HS. Hes pretty arrogant and tries to act funny but it comes off dry. I liked that he told us what types of questions would be on the test so you didnt have to study everything. Not responsive to emails.

The hardest part of this class is figuring out how to take the class. Fr. Coughlin spends a lot of time doing proofs that you don't actually need to use on the test or anything. The class is set up to make you understand the Calculus theory and not just how to do problems. If you just need Calc 1 or have never taken Calc before, would NOT recommend

Fr. Coughlin is very intelligent and very knowledgeable about what and how he is teaching. He is a very tough grader but I came to appreciate the rigor of the homework. Tests are difficult. He is very knowledgeable about the field of math and is very kind and is great at answering questions. Definitely would take a class taught by him again.

Fr. Coughlin is a very nice guy and covers the material well! The problem comes in when he takes off points for things that neither he nor the question asks you about. He just expects you to explain your answer in the exact way he wants it or you don't get full credit. You must prove your answer to him and he won't do the grading work for himself.

Father Coughlin is a great professor. You have graded (for accuracy) weekly homework, but they aren't too bad. Make sure you explain each step you take in your homework. The quizzes and exams are pretty easy. He tells you exactly what is on them, so take notes when he tells you what is on them and have your notes prepared.

Father Coughlin was one of the best math professors I've had at SLU. The course is homework heavy and can be confusing, but if you have any questions he is happy to answer. The only problems I had were that he teaches quite fast paced and can be confusing but he is available outside of class. Beware that he does like to call on people.

Coughlin made me love calculus! He was a great teacher but also great to have conversation with. He always wanted to get to know everyone and seemed tocare about the students. He was a real gem when it came to taking the class

He is too smart to teach Calc 1. I took Calc 1 in HS, and he often skips steps which can be confusing for new Calc students but is very kind if you have a question. There are quizzes every Friday and paper homework from the book. Webwork is not mandatory. For his tests, he goes over the order which helps a lot, and his tests are worth 105%.

Father Coughlin is an adjunct at SLU. For someone taking calculus the first time this class can be especially challenging, but nothing impossible. He's very understanding and quite fun to talk to outside of class. He will lay out the types of questions as they appear on tests, and go over examples in class beforehand. A great guy overall.

I had this guy for 8 am calc and I could not imagine it with anyone else. He can sometimes come off a little harsh but he's really a wholesome guy. He would walk through the test the lecture before exam day so you basically knew exactly what was on it. Webwork wasn't required which was nice.

I had him for Calc I-One of the best math teachers I've had. You could tell he was knowledgeable about the material and was excited about math. There's a lot of homework, but if you do it all, and put in the work, it's very possible to succeed. Also highly recommend going to office hours- he's very accommodating if you can't make his scheduled one

He spends entire classes to go over spreadsheets that we don't even end up using, so if you want to learn the information do the homework problems (most of the hw is voluntary but it's your best bet for learning the material). Good thing about him is that he goes over the exact types of problems that are going to be on the exams the class before.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Rebecca Miller

reviews.comment: Miller is probably the best stats professor you could ask for. Her lectures are clear, she gives out practice exams that are exactly like the regular exams, and she's understanding if you turn in things late. There's a lot of group projects, but she gives lots of time for you to do them in class. I'd definitely recommend her

One of the better math teachers I've had! The exams line up almost exactly with the practices tests. Her power points are detailed and pertain to the content we need to know. For the stats requirement, def pick her, she is easy compared to some. Effort = A. She is very kind & wants you to succeed. Gets a bit political at times, but overall great!!

Dr. Rebecca Miller is a great teacher and is very available outside of class. Homework on Pearson doesn't necessarily match the lecture but is not too difficult. She makes math fun and prepares you well for tests using "practice tests". Genuinely love her.

Ended up dropping the class because of difficulty. Very peppy, very kind and understanding, but moves VERY quickly and material does not always stick the way she wants. Very nice women who is passionate about math, though.

She makes math fun. She's really easy to reach outside of class and really wants you to succeed. I know so many people who hate math but love going to her class. Would really recommend, one of my favorite professors at SLU! Get ready for the best outfits ever.

Prof. Miller is a solid teacher for a stats requirement. Prof. is peppy & very cheerful, a fun person, but material is super dry (more of a course issue than her, though). Make a friend or two in class, there are group projects for every chapter (1-2 projects a week), and paper articles every 3 chapters (analyzing a study).

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James Grothe

reviews.comment: Pretty easy class with homework and quizzes everyday. If you're confused, go to him during office hours because he'll gladly help you. Do the example questions he goes over in class.

While I was naturally terrible at this class, he was always extremely nice. He always cares about what his students ask, and loves to talk about it. His classes are clearly structured and he offers weekly extra credit. Very nice man.

He is a pretty easy professor and is likable as well. Not necessarily an easy A but I haven't put that much time and effort into the course. You take an open book quiz over the new material learned that day every class. Tests are easy, he understands that his students are just trying to fulfill a math requirement with an easy class.
He will help if you are confused with a specific problem. He uses paper handouts and will do example problems in class. Homework every class. Relatively easy class.

Mr. G doesn't really build a relationship with his students; gives you all the tools you need to succeed - helpful in office hours, additional online help/resources/lectures/videos etc. YOUR GRADE DIRECTLY RELATES TO HOW MUCH WORK YOU PUT IN. TIP: Do bookwork & online work (Extra credit which helps a ton) Tests can be tough, but I would take him.
I honestly had a tough time in his class if your not good at math do not take him. do not let these comments hype you up. the material is not easy and he throws curve balls.

He's a really nice guy, and extremely understanding. Tests and quizzes aren't difficult, and he is a very fair grader. Expect homework, you have to turn it in. But as long as you turn it in before the chapter test, you will be fine. Easy points.
Great teacher, and very helpful!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Philip Huling

reviews.comment: Dr Huling is one of my funniest professors. I think he is easily the smartest mathematician I've met in my life, not even close. This can cause him to teach a little fast sometimes. The tests aren't too bad, and he scales them really well, so you always will have that to fall back on.

He cancels class all the time and he never does anything helpful in class. I always feel like he leaves us hanging as far as the homework; we have to figure everything out on our own. The class is basically a self-paced online course that doesn't have a teacher. I have also emailed him many times during the semester and have never gotten an answer.

I really dont recommend him unless if youre naturally very good at math. He doesnt explain anything, the class was like okay try the homework without being taught how to do it and we may or may not go over it tomorrow, like learning in reverse. I spent many hours in the math help room because of him... Really tough and not a good teacher.
Teaches well, invites questions and then insults you for 20 minutes. He is cool. Maybe the smartest man I know. Another time, he punched me in the face, but we had a really good laugh about it.

Dr. Phil is a good lecturer and tries his best to help students with questions. He is funny and makes Calc 2 interesting to learn by occasionally explaining real-life applications of the concepts. Gives reasonable homework amount and allows quizzes to be taken in groups.

He taught the hard problems in class, and it was up to you to read and figure out the easy problems in the book, so you do not want to fall behind in the readings. I did and I failed my second test. He scales the tests and gives out extra credit. There are 3 tests, quizzes each week, and homework on webworks. Cool and tries to improve his teaching
Our money wan not worth it for his class. We learned nothing. He does not care about his student at all. AVOID HIM
His grading is difficult but if you study everyday you will score well in his class.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sweta Prasad

reviews.comment: Doesn't explain things super well, graded by quizzes, midterm, and the final which was hard, if you're good at math it is easy but if you struggle it can be hard to communicate with her or get help outside the classroom

Took this class in an asynchronous format. I really struggle with math so I wasn't really excited for this class but it turned out fine! Dr. Prasad responded quickly to emails and was super helpful in office hours. The lectures weren't that helpful, but the textbook explained the problems. The quizzes and tests were super similar to the homework.

Prasad is not a good teacher. She reads directly from the slides, and obviously that won't help when trying to learn any type of math. She gives us homework, tests, and quizzes that are nothing like what she does in her hour and a half long lectures. She poorly explains the computer portion of the class and then expects us to do well on the test.

Prasad does not no how to teach AT ALL. She reads exactly what the slide says and her lectures are so long because she just repeats the words on the slide over and over as if they will all of a sudden start making sense. She also never responds to emails and has messed up grades so many times. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

I took this class asynchronous and she is so incredibly bad at explaining things/teaching. Her lectures are long and half the time she just stairs at her screen and says um and reads her right off her slides. Honestly do not take her class she doesn't teach anything. She also doesn't follow her own syllabus so randomly puts quizes up unannounced.

I took this class async. online and it is the worst class i've ever taken. Her accent makes it difficult to understand in her videos sometimes and none of the work follows the syllabus. She randomly uploads quizes whenever she feels like it and if you dont check every night youll miss something. DO NOT TAKE.

She is clearly knowledgeable but utterly fails at clearly communicating and TEACHING math. A majority of her lectures focus on questions that are never seen, and she randomly gives you a part of the problem that she should most definitely work through. If you struggle with math in any sort of capacity, FIND ANOTHER TEACHER

The worst communicator. Basically useless outside of class. Doesn't help or answer questions and takes forever to respond to emails. Homework assignments and quizzes every week. Uses WeBWorK which has so many issues, literally grading things incorrectly and she doesn't even respond to your email when you ask to look over the mistake it made.

Her class was really easy and I barely tried for this class. Take this class if you've taken pre-calc before because she teaches fast and straight out of the textbook. You need to go to class to do well but she's very accommodating if you miss a quiz/test or need extra help. She also lets you bring your own equation sheet so quizzes/tests are easy

She's a nice lady but she can be very difficult to understand. She pronounces words wrong and has an accent which makes it hard to comprehend what she's actually teaching. The online homework was most beneficial to me.

I enjoyed this teacher a lot actually. As long as you don't skip class and keep up on the homework (which there barely is any) you'll do great. Definitely recommend doing practice problems and if you suggest extra credit to her, odds are she'll give it to you.

She is really sweet and friendly. She explains concepts well and takes a lot of time to help us with practice problems. Stat is not a difficult class and if you put in a little effort you will do well.
She is not a very good teacher, goes over the content too fast, there is a quiz every week that you probably will not understand if you have never taken calc. If you can, avoid her at all costs.

She isn't a very good teacher but is a really nice person. Her tests are pretty easy because they are basically the review problems she gives us before the exams. She also gives a lot of extra credit.

Not the best teacher and hard to understand. I skipped most of the time because I couldn't understand the way she taught/it was easier for me to teach myself.
