Try to show up tho bc she randomly gives group assignments. She'll give EC but only if the majority does poorly on a test. One positive: tests are pretty much exactly like the review problems

Avoid at all costs. I took this class as a requirement and I hated every second of it. Went into final with an A and ended with a B- and she didn't curve it. Her tests are BS, the homework is easy online (online textbook is only needed) & her final is crap. So many people legitimately failed the final. Ask her to say H though. It'll make you lol.

She's something else. I thought I was failing the class the entire time. But, with the amount of extra credit she gave me, somehow I ended up with an A+. So, she's extremely nice with handing out extra credit but extremely unpredictable with the tests. Mostly studied two days before. She nice lady though. And she works with your dates.

As a pre-med student enrolled in molecular cell biology and organic chemistry, I would say this course was the biggest stress in my course load. She has literally no clue how to teach, and even laughs when you do not understand something. She will cover a chapter in 20 minutes then do problems no one has an understanding of. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
Confusing, not helpful, and condescending. The workload is inappropriate for the course I took with Sweta.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Zach Sarvis

reviews.comment: Professor Sarvis is extremely caring. He moved our exam date so we could go home for thanksgiving break earlier. His pre-tests are very similar to the actual exams. If you attend class, take notes, & do the hw, you will get an A. He's a great teacher and understands what it's like to be a busy student. I wish all professors were like him.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Anupama Singh

reviews.comment: Hard to understand, but if you go to office hours and stuff shell really help you out
tells us to hurry up during quizzes. walks around the class to make sure youre getting things right. calls on the few people whose names she knows. very condescending

Unprofessional. Singh is the kind of professor who had no interest in being a teacher so she takes it out on her students. Singh doesn't seem to have any desire to help her students learn precalc. At best she's condescending and at worst she's rude. She's taken points off quizzes simply because she didn't believe you could actually get full points.
some quizzes she will put topics we havent learned but use symbolab and mathway. They help the most to teach the stuff.

I dropped Calculus and then chose Pre Calculus and I thought I would get an easy A but still taking the class and I think this teacher is so bad she doesnt know how to teach the actual class like I could teach it better than her even tho I had a B in this class my senior year.

Attending lectures teaches you nothing other than she should not be teaching. She will not explain anything to you and will ridicule you for asking questions and says you should just know it. She doesn't teach anything because she runs through problems without explaining them and skips through her own notes. I don't recommend her to anyone.

Singh is an adjunct staff teaching pre-calc. If she's on your schedule, transfer. She was rude, did not explain any material, and had a quiz the second day on topics she did not tell us about. She gave no time to do problems and got angry if questions are asked. If things were understood the first time she would tell us to go back to algebra.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Mary Vansuch

reviews.comment: Assigns a lot of group projects, so if that's not your thing, I would stay far away. Very accessible outside of class and encourages people to go to office hours. Not an exceptional teacher, but she gets the job done.

She's very energetic, and she makes sure everybody understands the material before moving on. She gives out quizzes as a prep to make sure we know the material for the test. You will use the textbook/program for reading quizzes and homework assignments. She also assigns a lot of group projects. She also makes time if you can't attend office hours.

She is a very energetic teacher when it comes to teaching in the morning. She makes sure that everyone understands the concepts and if not she does have office hours and would try to make time for you. I recommend taking her classes :)

Mary is a very enthusiastic and helpful grad- student- instructor. She answers your emails SUPER fast and really puts great effort into helping you understand the materials. Group projects are a big part of your grade, lots of Pearson homework and reading quizzes, they're not heavy tho. Desmos slides are a daily thing and important for test review.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Holly Bernstein

reviews.comment: Dr. Bernstein was extremely helpful outside of class and she was willing to have office hours or even set up time in her personal schedule to meet up and help with students. Her tests are based on the coursework and in-class problems we do. If you pay attention in class (and write down problems) and do the readings before, you definitely can pass.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Bradley Currey

reviews.comment: Dr. Currey made differential equations easy. His assignments can be tough but he's VERY willing to help if you ask. Tests are similar to assignments and he tells you exactly what you'll be tested on. One group project that he provides lots of guidance on. Overall, a very caring teacher who knows the subject thoroughly.
Dr Currey is the best for differential equations. Tests are like the study guides. Weekly assignments that he gives a lot of help on in office hours. Great professor.
Nuce guy, fair grader, and respects students

Dr Currey was extrememly helpful! I did well on the first test and not so well on the next 2. I went to his office hours all of the time and he was always willing to go over what i did wrong. i ended up with an A in the class because of his help. He is funny in class, he begins one idea and skips to the next, but always goes back. i recommend him.

This man has earned my respect...grad classes are for people who are too scared to study by themselves!...enjoy life !, follow Moore and if you feel like seriously enjoying a class then attend his lectures...sometimes he gives credit to stupid questions asked by students(including me !) but thats because he knows that some students have big egos..

Aweful, dont know what he's twisting about. Grades std based on his own strict solution, though easy class, but easy to lose your pts on your tests. Hands out quizzes for attendence. 8:00 am, make me sad from mid A to final B; Nice guy and helpful though.

Principles of Mathematics, more work than I expected. Dr. Currey was very helpful and made himself available. Need to attend class for in-class worksheets. Tests were fair, and he wants the students to do well. Good teacher overall

Absolutely garbage professor. I heard so or okay 52 times in period of ten minutes once. Lectures directly from notes. Can't explain anything. Gives hard tests. Grades extremely hard. You won't learn anything in his class. Aviod at all costs.
ok ok ok ok, sorry sorry sorry - but dr currey is amazing! he really cares, and knows what he's talking about. fair, straight-forward exams. does his best to keep you up to speed in the class.

He is not clear and in a Statistics and Computers course he said he hated computers. I didn't understand this at all. He is all over the place and does not explain very well. Sometimes he confuses himself. I would not recommend taking him for a class, I think he is burned out from teaching.
the class is called "statistics and computers" and yet he openly says he has no idea what he's doing when it comes to computers...not very clear or very helpful...
All these haters need to back off of Currey. He does know what he's doing, break down information better than some of the other math professors I've had
okey teacher, do the practice tests, u'll b fine
Pretty easy teacher. Don't even need to open the book the whole year.
totally unprepared.has no idea what to do.
Very good professor... reasonable tests. The group quizzes are a good thing.
Great teacher! Was always happy to help. His grading was picky on the tests, but you had plenty of points to make up for it. Thumbs up for Dr. Currey!!!
Amazing teacher. Reminded me of math teachers from high school. Very easy to get along with, but you have to have a sense of humor, joke with the man. He grades rather tough.
um... yeah... un huh... what?? Those are the only words hes spoken this semester. Not a great teacher so avoid if you can.
average
VERY UNCLEAR, grades tough. Cares about class.
not fun...avoid....can easily confuse the smartest person with simple questions he makes hard
Nice guy, but unorganized and not a great teacher. Will help if you go to his office. Not an easy grader.
He's kind of tough, but he's a good professor and cares about his students.
Tests were straightforward, teacher was better than most I've had for math.
Class was ****, ok teacher, but try and avoid
not clear, hard tests, avoid if you can

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Seth Arnold

reviews.comment: I had a mental health crisis and had difficulty with deadlines for homework. Rather than work with me, he took so much late points off and my grade really suffered. The only reason I got the grade I did is because I aced the exam... where I basically had to teach myself what to do beforehand.

If you have the option to take someone else, you should probably choose that someone else. Dr. Arnold is certainly skilled in math, but when it comes to handling his courses, it becomes extremely hard for students to follow. Homework and exams include things we haven't covered in class. He takes pretty long to respond to emails, if he does at all.

Seth is a professor who is dedicated in helping you pass, but you must put in the work and effort. Some of this lectures are difficult to understand, but his office hours are amazing to get additional help.

The first part of Calc was really hard for me. As the year went on, I got more used to the structure of class, hw, and the tests. We had hw for every section and 4 tests. Seth was always willing to come in for office hours whenever was best for students and if we were struggling with something he would tirelessly explain.

He often made mistakes as he did problems on the board which confused everyone. He constantly had to be corrected and made up his math problems on the go which led to even more confusion. His test averages were low for the most part but he did give practice exams which were helpful. Would not recommend him overall.

Does not work well with his student at all. Does not teach. He expects students to understand material without giving any examples. Does not provide assistance in office hours. I left his office more confused than when I got there. He used terminology that no one understood and we constantly had to correct him.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sarah Aljohani

reviews.comment: Did not put the MyLab Math assignments in the grade book until the last week before the midterm and final, even though they were graded for her through the homework site. Made it difficult to keep track of my grade in the course. Never taught topics or concepts, instead jumping right into example problems and speeding through them. :(

Super unclear in her teaching style, don't even bother using the textbook because it doesn't help. She doesn't take time to explain topics, just jumps right into practice problems so you better hope you did the topic in high school.

Didn't even have a syllabus or introduce herself the first day. I wouldn't have gotten an A had I not taken pre-calc in high school because she is so unclear in communication (I'm not even meaning her accent, which you get used to). Wouldn't introduce a topic, would just randomly start teaching and you better hope you knew the topic ahead of time.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Paul Durham

reviews.comment: Out of the many years I've been in school, Prof Durham was the absolute best math teacher I've had. Work the examples in the online textbook, then come to class and you'll be super prepared for his lectures and ready to work through the problems he does in class. He expects class participation which helped and group work made things manageable.

He is a very smart person. He is most definitely the smartest math teacher I have ever had. gives a LOT of homework, but you can do it in advance. He gives you quizzes every Friday, but the last 10 minutes of the quiz you can look over it with a group. Easy tests. He is very sarcastic and will poke fun at people when they get answers wrong in class

Honestly he's not a terrible teacher, he knows a whole lot about math and i don't have an issue with the amount of homework (although there is a lot) but my big problem with him was just his attitude towards students. He randomly calls on students for problems and if you don't know the answer he'll criticize you in front of 80 people

Professor Durham was one of the best algebra teachers. You have quizzes every Friday, but he lets you review it with a group before turning it in. His tests were super easy just like worksheets in class. He explains every concept very well and as long as you show up and do the homework you will do well in his class.

Seriously best math teacher I have ever had. Yeah, there is a lot of homework, and quizzes every week, but he is a very fair grader, and he prepares you for them. There are four tests, and he gives practice tests that are just like the exams! TAKE HIS CLASS you really learn and he is super nice. Everyone says he is the best in the department.
tags: there is a lot of homework
but he is a very fair grader

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Monica Metzger

reviews.comment: The least-accessible teacher I have ever had in my life. My class was at 11am and, no joke, I got an email at 10:59am saying class was online for the day. Do you know how much of a pain that is when commuting from home? she canceled half of the classes and made them asynchronous. She is extremely nice but so inaccessible that the cons outweigh pros
HORRIBLE TEACHER. Do NOT take it with her. She never responds to emails, had "covid" for a couple of weeks and never helped students, and never taught any of the material. WORST teacher at SLU.

This was genuinely one of the worst classes I have ever taken. She does not respond to emails in a timely manner. Easily took 3-4 business days to respond. At the beginning of the semester she said she would post all materials for the week on Monday, and she didn't do that one time. She was consistently unavailable and always came up with excuses.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Terry Tomazic

reviews.comment: As long as you go to the lectures in person and read the textbook you'll be fine! However, you can't do well with just one of those things. The lectures are just sort of reading off the slides, but if you like sociology then it is engaging enough. If you participate in discussions and go to class in person you'll be ok. The exams are tough !
Tests were pretty difficult and prof tomazic was a hard grader. just show up to class read and work hard on your essays and youll get a B.
I took him for Quant 1 and I did not understand his lectures most of the time but the books were helpful and he is a really nice professor.
Not great!

Hard class! No matter how many examples he does in class it does not help for the tests. Open note and book, still half the class get D or lower. The only thing good about the class is easy hw points and computer projects. Dont take unless you have to, but maybe try some1 else. He's the head of the depart so you are probably screwed either way.

Horrible class! Do not take, the whole class never finishes their test on time, the things we go over in class are not even relevant to the test material! Does not clearly explain things and I also wish someone would have warned me before I took his class!

Ok his class is boring BUT he isn't as bad as everyone says, the tests aren't that bad if you can stay awake is lecture. He gives examples that are relevant to the test and will help you if you need it

His lectures are dry, that much I admit, but they reflect what is covered on the tests for the most part. The homework/extra credit do not correlate to what is taught in class and presented on the tests though. His tests are difficult. He is one of the better teachers in the department though, so choose wisely if you must take statistics.
Terrible class. Boring lectures. Homework/Class lectures/Tests do not correlate at all. Extra Credit takes a long time and is only worth a max of 5pts. Do not take this class.
His tests are impossible. Over half the class got F's and no A's. They are to long and nothing like the homework, book, or his notes!! Avoid. He is cocky and thinks he knows it all!!

His tests are hard, and he does not explain anything. Does not answer questions. More than half our class failed a test and he basically said we were SOL. DO NOT TAKE. HORRIBLE TEACHER. I just wish someone would have told me that before I took his class.

Good professor! Offers extra credit that reallly helps. Answers all questions. The tests are easily passed if you do the extra credit. No suprises, you know what to expect every step of the way. Writes the final that everyone in this course will take, so if you must take it, have him as prof!
I agree, the tests were impossible!

Pretty good teacher. He explains things really well. Homework (which most is optional for extra credit) is easy. His tests are pretty much impossible. If you memorize the book, you will still be gussing at the multiple choice.
DO NOT TAKE! He is an awful teacher that does not explain things clearly and expects way more of you on the test than what he teaches in class. Tests are very vague, difficult and LONG!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Simon McCreary-Ellis

reviews.comment: This professor does not grade well. He usually only makes the exams 10 questions, so they are all very high points. He gets irritated when students don't do well, despite that being his fault, and is cold in his feedback comments on your assignments. He does not actually teach very much, but just rushes through the Pearson book powerpoints.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. This professor is never actually willing to help out his students. Every week he implements new rules for his students and it's impossible to keep up! Homework on three different platforms and posts reading quizzes that are due before class only an HOUR before class!! Gets really annoyed when students ask questions on HW in clas

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Anitha Srinivasan

reviews.comment: Had Anitha for a couple classes and whatever I knew about the topic before the course started, I would unlearn it in her class. As a person, she is very sweet but as a prof, her lectures are all over the place, disorganized, and extremely confusing. Really tough grader and not very helpful when going in for office hours. Would not recommend
tags: her lectures are all over the place

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Charles Burnette

reviews.comment: By far the best math teacher I've ever had. Gives fun lectures (as fun as calculus can, be, at least) and it is clear that he really wants his students to learn the material and do well in the course. His feedback is clear and there is a lot of homework, but that is expected for calc II.

Burnette really knows his stuff. He can generally answer any question asked. He is by far the best Calculus teacher I've had. In class he derives a lot of stuff, but occasionally he will ask a derivation question on the test. If you get an A on the final you get an A in the class. He also gives 10-20 points of cushion on each test.

Okay so, this man was cool in that his test were fair and his homework assignments were ALWAYS helpful, but that all can cancel out if the final is 10 times harder than anything he usually gives us. Scaling matters.
He is good at explaining things, and he is generous with partial credit and extra credit. Webwork is a pain, but every calc classes uses it. Definitely take his class!!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Monalisa Munsi

reviews.comment: Doesn't know how to teach. Get a different professor, she is awful.

She doesn't show her work or explain how she got an answer she put on the board. She works through a section very fast and I started to fall behind because I was having to teach myself. It's sometimes difficult to understand her. The one good thing about her teaching is that we sometimes got to work in groups for the quiz.

English second language, which would be fine if she could talk in clear English. No engagement, lectures are impossible to follow, textbook is overcomplicated. This subject isn't that hard--but Dr. Munsi sure makes it seem that way. The class isn't all that difficult--but this teacher should be avoided at all costs.

English is her second language Not remotely engaging Tests have questions my tutors have never heard before; understanding the material doesn't guarantee a decent exam grade Teaching ability is non-existent Can't explain concepts On the other hand, quizzes are mostly group quizzes and the lowest exam is dropped, so class itself is not hard Beware

Monalisa is one of the worst teachers I've ever had. She has ample amounts of homework, 3 30 question assignments a week, a 2 question quiz every Wednesday, and 3 tests. I went to her class every day and still didn't have a clue what was going on. I had to spend at least an hour a day watching tutorials on what she just taught us. Don't take her!!

Ms. Munsi has been the worst math teacher that I've ever had. She goes through the notes so quickly that I can't write everything down, and she obviously just copies her notes onto the board without paying attention to the students. She expects you to know all the material before you learn it, and doesn't answer questions when asked. Rating: 0.

If you want to pass this class, do NOT take it with this professor. The in-class notes tend to be basic compared to the other course material. She skips steps, often goes from the question straight to the answer. She expects us to do every single problem in the book to understand the concepts.

Dr. Munsi is a tough grader when it comes to exams. Quizzes and worksheets typically come from book problems, but definitely understand all concepts. Tends to pick toughest problems for quizzes, but easy ones for in class examples. Can be condescending in class when you give a wrong answer. Expects you to know most everything before she teaches it.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Dennis Wacker

reviews.comment: Dr. Wacker means well and is very respected, but is very hard to pay attention to as he uses the classic/more traditional ways of teaching math. He knows the subject well but doesn't always explain well. The class is extremely test heavy with 2-3 online homework assignments due every other class. Know stats WELL before taking his class!

Dr. Wacker has made me enjoy math again. Calc II is not an easy class, but he explains everything so well and you can tell he cares about his students doing well. The lectures are engaging enough, and if you pay attention you'll pass. Definitely the best professor I've had so far. Wish he taught Calc III!

I love Dr. Wacker!! I was terrified of taking calc but he was an excellent teacher. He explains things really well and genuinely wants you to understand it. He is really helpful during office hours, too. If youre not a math person but need to take it, take him.

This is my second class with Dr. Wacker and I have enjoyed it both times. Calc 2 is a hard course to take in general out of the three Calc series. He takes things slow and is always able to answer any questions. If you make an effort to pay attention and follow along you will do fine. The sample exams/finals are just like the real tests.

Dr. Wacker is an excellent Calc I teacher. I think he makes it about as easy as it gets and he really wants people to do well. Exams are very similar to practice tests and you can pad your grade with homework and attendance.
Very very bland lectures and teaches so slow that it is extremely difficult to pay attention. Material isn't hard, just hard to pay attention. Tests are do-able

Dr. Wacker is a fantastic teacher and makes himself readily available to help you at any time. He does great examples in class and his tests are just like the samples he sends out. Absolutely would recommend!
Great professor, great man to have on your side

He usually does not explain much and expects you to know the course before he has taught anything. During office hours he was not helpful. He was very degrading and condescending when he spoke because this was a lower level math course. If i had not taken Stats in high school, I would not have passed.

I HIGHLY recommend you take this man for calculus. He is such an amazing professor. He is funny, nice, engaging, and if you do the work, you'll get an A. He's getting a bit older so idk how much longer he'll be here so I recommend you take him. Best professor I've had at SLU so far. His Webwork can be a bit challenging but he'll help you anytime.

It astounds me people don't do well in his calculus class. He makes it so easy to do well. He puts up his worked out solutions to the homework online, gives homework quizzes (which if you look at his solutions and do the homework you'll do fine!), gives practice tests (which are JUST like the actual tests), and is a great, funny, engaging professor

If you want to enjoy learning calculus this is the right class for you! This guy makes fun with his jokes and humor. Overall, the tests are hard but you get a study guide which helps. Webworks are hard but helps your grade

Very difficult class. Went from an A in pre-Calc to a D in Calc. He gives limited attempts in the web work homework and you are not given any credit for showing your work, unlike most professors. The tests are incredibly hard. Expect to spend an inordinate amount of time working in this class. The tutors didn't even understand the work.
Really nice guy, and great professor! He gives solutions to the homework problems which is super helpful!

Dr. Wacker knows his Calculus and does his best to relay the information to his students. He has clear-cut office hours and it is easy to contactreach-out to him for help. He is fairly condescending when asking questions though. He is also fairly nit-picky with his grading, partial credit is given at a minimum. The Webwork is rough too.

He's really helpful and always welcomes you to come in and talk when you have questions. The online homework was hard and it didn't correlate with what we learned in class and what was asked on the tests. You should definitely go to class because he factors that in if you have a borderline grade

I seemed to have wronged Dr. Wacker. That's how it seemed. I went into his office daily for help or clarification and it seemed to bother him. He was angry when I didn't understand something. The class loved him at first but then he became a smart aleck and it got old. He seemed somewhat condescending. Be prepared to feel stupid if you talk to him.

I have had a bad strong of math teachers here at SLU, and i was pleasantly surprised when Professor Wacker broke that streak. He is very helpful and actually pays attention to whether you're to how each of his students is doing in his classes. He gives great feedback on where to improve as well as how to understand the material better.

Best professor I've had at SLU. He made Calc II painless. I worked hard, but he does his part too and gives you so many tools to succeed. His teaching style was clear and methodical. He's a very fair grader and willing to give you as much help as you need. I wish he could teach all of my math classes. He's super friendly outside of class too.

He is the best math teacher I have ever come across. He clearly states his point and there are no surprises on his tests or quizzes. Also, if you are struggling with anything he is more than willing to help during office hours.

Do all webwork assignments, great great boosters, and homework quiz problems come right out of the text book. Practice tests are the same as tests but with different numbers. Very clear with examples.

Easily one of if not the best math teacher at slu. Definitely take him if you have chance. The class is a good pace and he is always willing to help at any time. The exams are very similar to the practice tests he gives you so you are never surprised.
Amazing professor. Clear with expectations. Goes over material slowly so everybody can understand.

If you are really good at solving math problems on your own, you should do good. I never took Calculus in high school and I got an average of a C. I had a tutor and studied every night for every exam but still managed to get a C overall. It really depends on your leaning abilities. Dr. Wacker does seem to get mad if you don't understand it at first

I didn't do very well in the class so just some tips to get you through the class:DO THE WEBWORKS- they suck and its hard to remember to do but its a grade booster, do the textbook homework, ALWAYS do the practice test- its basically the same as the test with different numbers, ask him for help- it shows him you

GREAT professor! I am horrible at math and had never taken a calc course before. He went very slow with the material and he was always available to help. The only difficult parts of this class were the group projects.
A nice guy. Doesn't explain much though. Weekly homework quizzes, but no homework besides that. Tests are easy, but there's lots of them.

Really nice guy, but is hard to understand sometimes. I had him for Stat Sports&Politics. Hard to catch outside of class. He usually lectures straight out of book so there's not much use in going to class besides when there's a test or quiz. No homework.

Dr. Wacker is a fun teacher. The coursework is pretty basic for a stats class. (Granted, it was Stats in Sports & Politics.) He goes at a slow pace, but not too slow, and he answers any questions you may have, too.
Dr. Wacker's class is pretty easy. Do the work and you'll get an A. I barley got an B in AP Calculus in high school and got an A in his class. Take him for calculus! He goes at a nice slow pace.

Very organized, schedule is helpful. Gets behind schedule at times. Beginning of each class he will go over HW problems if you have questions. Allows you a lot of time to complete the quizes and the tests (lets you stay after class). Visiting him in office, not much help. Sometimes makes you feel stupid. Got an A in AP calc, still got a B.

Dr. Wacker is organized and is available for help. Students who did not have calc in highschool struggled. But he gives you a new syllabus every few weeks listing homework,lectures,quizes, and tests. If you have taken calc before, you should get an A. If you haven't, then you should still be able to do well if you put in the work.
Great teacher, great guy. Posts answers to all hw problems online. He's very helpful if you ask questions. The class is difficult if you haven't had Calc in high school. I'd highly recommend him.
Good Teacher. Puts homework solutions to every single problem on the internet. Great Speaker. Helpful. Hard Tests. Quizes are all homework problems. Overall Good Teacher.

I thought it was a good class. He gets behind in his syllabus, but explains well. Very thorough when going over example problems. Before tests go through and do the problems at the end of the chapter. Occasionally will throw something weird on a test, but not often. Gives homework quizzes-in total they add up to 100pts for doing the homework.
Worse class I have ever taken!! Would not recommend!!!

Most energetic guy i know. Class can be somewhat hard at times. You have to pay attention to the small details on quizzes and test--that is what will screw you over in this class. Overall thought, very interesting and worth my time.

The class is somewhat hard at times, but he is a very good teacher. Very knowledgeable and organized. If your final exam grade is higher than your pre-final percentage, the final exam grade will count for 50% of the total grade. This makes it very easy to improve your grade on the final. I strongly recommend him to anyone for Prob and Stat.

This guy is a pretty good teacher. I thought this class was fairly hard, though. There are a lot of things to remember. He makes everything clear and tells you exactly what you should expect on a test. Kind of boring sometimes but better than most in the SLU math department.

Good teacher. Knows the material and will go out of his way to help students who need help. Moves at a good pace for those who need refreshing on the material or just plain need to learn it. Hindered by a sub-par book.

Good teacher, his class can be hard if you don't do the homework problems. Almost everything on the tests and quizzes are taken from the homework. He will usually give partial credit on almost everything. If you don't know something, ask!!!! He is more inclined to give partial credit that way.

I had taken calculus last year in high school so this class was a breeze for me. But if I hadn't taken it last year I'm sure it would have still been easy because he explains everything in detail and is very helpful in one on one sessions
Wacker takes too much time to get through the material. He is unhelpful on group projects. He tries to be a hardass but just comes off stupid.

nice guy. takes off points on little arbitrary things. easy problems in class, hard problems on tests. never can find an easy way to explain things. good luck if you've never had calculus previously. be prepared to have him make you feel stupid when he calls on you and you dont know the answer.

Incredibly boring, if i hadnt had this class in high school, i would have been screwed. He cant seem to get across his point easily. Takes way too much time on each lesson so you are always behind schedule, then he expects you to catch up by yourself. Nice guy, cant teach.
good teacher..lots of easy hwk....tests can be hard...jus study and keep up and u will get an A
VERY good teacher. Very fair tests. Challenging course, but fair.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Charles McCauley

reviews.comment: Honestly if I hadn't come in with good algebra experience I would have failed. The way he teaches things is way more difficult than it needs to be, and he gets things wrong more often than most of the students do. I did well because I taught myself. Don't get me wrong, he's a genuine nice guy, he just doesn't really seem like he knows much.

Look into a different class immediately. I dread going to his class every MWF. he thinks that every single 1 of his students will magically know math and will be moving on to calc one and beyond which is rarely the case. He is just an overall bad teacher. if you are in his class, get a tutor

This professor will explain the material in a way in which, by the end of class that day, you will not have understood it, and will find yourself not only even more behind than when you arrived, but also with a feeling of inadequacy that is seemingly inescapable, due to his teaching style. Do not take him.

Difficult teacher, but put in the effort and you will see it reflected on your tests. Study everything, go to his office hours, and do extra problems in the book (beyond homework). DON'T miss class and don't slack off in class. He recognizes effort when he sees it. He's a nice guy in office hours. Get to know him and he'll be kind to you on tests.

Avoid this dude if you can, all my other friends in different sections of stats got easy As on their exams and did not have to study. This guy won't even release a practice guide, questions, previous tests or anything (Others were straight up given their exams). Not sure how a professor who has failed stats, is teaching stats.

Avoid taking this course at all costs. He is extremely hard to follow and his tests are nearly impossible to pass. On exams, he expects you to "apply" the easy information learned in class to hard problems never practiced. When you ask questions he talks in a tone like "I just taught this, you should know this" and makes you feel bad.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael Tsau

reviews.comment: Greatest professor I have ever had. Sad to see him go.

Tsaus quizzes are super similar, if not carbon copies of the notes and homework. Each exam is pretty similiar to the practice exam. I would show up just to get the notes, because you wont really learn by listening to the lecture. Also, you may want the textbook to do the homework but you can honestly just redo the problems from the notes.
Have to go to the lecture to know the material, but he is very accessible outside of class! I would definitely recommend taking him for any Calculus course.
Amazing professor! I had him for Diff EQ and he made that class so easy. His examples in class also matched the tests/quizzes. The best professor I have had at SLU!

I took Tsau for Calc 2, arguably the hardest calc class in the sequence. He does his best to teach the material, is one of the nicest most caring professors I have ever head. Get to know him a little better, joke around with him, and Calc 2 will not feel nearly as difficult.

I took Tsau for calculus 2, and honestly, I wouldn't have wanted to take anyone else. He is an extremely nice guy and gives excellent lectures (albeit he does speak quietly though, so you want to get a seat in the first two rows). Given it was calculus 2, it was hard, but Tsau made it much better than it would've been with inferior professors.

THE BEST PROFESSOR I EVER HAD. I HIGHLY recommend to take his class if you are looking for the class Calc1-3. I had his class for calc1-3, and I had blast. It is not an easy A, but as long as you do all the assignments, also come to every class, you should be good, but you must to really understand the concepts. Good luck!

Dr. Tsau is a great professor that I would definitely take again. The class was definitely not an easy A, but I believe that if you do all of the book problems he assigns and go to each lecture, you will be alright. He is a tremendous help during tests and great at explaining questions that you have during lecture.

Let me start by saying, this class is HARD. That should be expected going into a Calc course. That being said, Dr. Tsau is one of the best professors I have ever had! He is more than willing to explain things over and over in order to have the students understand the concepts. I would definitely choose Tsau over any other professor.
The best professor that I have ever had in slu! If you understand homework problems then you will get an easy A on the test! However, you should know calc very good and really understand it)

He gives a lot of examples during the class. Make sure you understand all of them and use them for homework, and then you will have no problem for the tests. The test problems are all from the homework with changing some numbers.

For Calc III, he was a tough teacher, given that the material is also advanced. He has an accent and it can be easy to zone out during class. Homework is optional, but you should do it if you want to do well on the weekly quizzes and exams. I learned a lot out of the textbook and Paul's Math Notes. Go to office hours if you want help.
He is easily the best math professor I have ever had in college! Homework covers exactly what was learned in class and the tests are a good concoction of all of the material learned!
Nice guy
He is a great guy, but THE CLASS IS HARD! You must know calculus IN AND OUT!
Great Guy. Really wants you to do well in his class. Very helpful, will explain everything a million times over if needed. Very fair grader and very clear with instructions. Awesome professor.

Nice guy but not a great teacher. I couldn't understand what the hell he was saying for the first few weeks. It seems like he's just talking to himself when he lectures us. His tests are okay and the homework is fine but the quickly quizzes can get a bit annoying! Take a different professor.!!!

I <3 Dr. Tsau!! He is absopositively the best math professor I've ever had!!! Take his class, if you don't, you'll suffer. He cares about how students are doing, and wants them to learn the material. He has no problem re-explaining things. No need for a tutor with Dr. Tsau! Nonetheless, Calculus does require lots of studying. Show him you're trying

Outstanding prof! Gives tons of notes/examples to help you and explains everything thoroughly. Always kind and helpful outside of class. But you MUST study and do homework. As he warns, the tests get harder each time! Study, do your homework, and show him you're trying hard and you'll do fine even if you're struggling. Best math prof SLU has!

The best math teacher I've ever had. Ever. He cares about each student and wants you to do well (he gives you so many chances for extra credit, I don't know how you couldn't get an A). Just go to class and take notes and look over them and you'll do well. He's brilliant and cares about how you're doing on an individual basis. Take him! Amazing man!

Calculas. Dr. Tsau is the best. I have no talent for math, but he was ALWAYS there to help me and answer questions, even after class. He really wants his students to do well. For the tests, study the study guide and do the homework problems. No turn in homework, but there are weekly quizzes...unless he says otherwise.

If you're taking Diff Eq Dr. Tsau is the best. I got an F on the first test and still ended up with an A- in the class. As long as you pay attention and do the homework you'll be fine. Excellent professor!!!

EXCELLENT PROFESSOR!!! He really wants everyone to do well, and he is always willing to help and answer any questions. His tests problems are the same as or similar to the hw problems and problems on the review sheet. Definitely take him if you have the chance!!!
Excellent Professor. Always availalbe to answer questions.
Very good teacher. He is very helpful. Tests can be just a little bit tricky sometimes, but overall it is a great class. Gives partial credit on tests. Take him if you have the chance.

Great teacher! I'm not very good at math but he was always ready to help and he doesn't ut any tricky stuff on his test. He really wants you to learn it. If you have to take a math course, take him!!!

without a doubt, the best math teacher I've ever had...he not only knew each student's strong/weak points but really cared that we understood why and not just how...his test questions are similar if not identical to review problems and its obvious that he wants u to learn, not just plug and chug - im sure hes fantastic for any level of math
Great teacher. Will learn alot from him, the class wasn't easy but you definitely feel like you earn your grade. One of the best in the Math Department
Best math teacher at slu, maybe the only good math teacher at slu. I highly recommend
This teacheer is awesome.... his voice will put u to sleep so just pay attention to what he writes on the board... take him as often as you can...
Outstanding. Always available for help. Best teacher I had during 4 years at SLU.
Awesome, all i can say is: Pawabowa (Parabola). Great man
couldn't understand anything
Good teacher. I would take over other options...hmmm...Brody. Does a good job of teaching but has a baby voice that will put anyone to sleep.
Excellent teacher for Calc. III. Very helpful and very clear. Examples in notes are VERY similiar to test and quiz questions. Rearrange your schedule to get him
Great teacher for Calc III. Very smart.
Best math teacher at SLU, take him above anyone
good guy, good teacher. tests are fairly difficult, but it's calc 3!
awesome teacher, for calc II or III, nobody is better
I learned a lot

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Brent Wessel

reviews.comment: I feel extremely prepared coming out of this class. Easily the class I learned the most in this semester because he is such a good teacher.
Very kind professor

Brent is a great guy! Hes always willing to help and give students feedback on quizzes or exams. We used the textbook for homework that was due weekly and we also had a quiz every week. This may seem like a lot of work but it made for ample opportunities to get points and feedback before exams. I would highly recommend Brent
he is the best teacher i have ever had
Highly recommended taking his class. Go to class and you shouldn't have a problem getting at least a B.

Eh. Typical math teacher in a typical math class. Kind of a dry speaker, but then again, he just doing math equations on the board. Nice guy, patient, and willing to help. No complaints, math is just hard for me in general, and thus the rating.
Really nice and helpful. Gives reasonable time for homework and gives extra time if needed. Uses mymathlab and no text book needed. Go to class and you'll do just fine.
Show up to class and do the online HW and you will be fine. He's an easy going guy and explains the material well

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Rob Steward

reviews.comment: Great Survey of Calc professor! He moved around his office hours in order to help students and offered several extra credit opportunities/opportunities to earn more points in the course. If you have above an 80% in the class, you automatically get a 10/10 on homework assignments and participation/attendance is worth 5% of final grade in course.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Katherine Radler

reviews.comment: Easy A. Just pay attention and keep up with online quizzes/homework on Mystatlab. All the projects and paper analysis are done with the people who are in your group. She assigns groups of 5/6 people but you get to pick your groups after the first test. You'll be working in your groups almost all the time. Exam is very similar to her review packet.

Mrs. Radler is a great survey to calc teacher. Her power points are accessible on blackboard and she explains the material pretty well. If you don't understand then ask because she will slow down to explain. Homework is optional, but if you want to do well on the test and quizes that she gives out then do the homework and ask questions! Group quiz

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sadita Salihovic

reviews.comment: Young but very good. Clear concise lecture based teaching. Very helpful.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Seth Wolbert

reviews.comment: Curves the whole class, making in not difficult to get an A if you grasp the material.

Chill guy. He says sort of switches between using real technical terms to using words like "stuff." Lots of homework, but that is expected in a math class. If you can do the homework and quizzes, you can do the tests. He was a little difficult to get a hold of outside of class, but was good about emails. Group project sucks. Very average prof.

There was lots of homework and quizzes, but they helped prepare you for the tests. I did not personally like Dr. Wolbert's teaching style. He does not give concrete examples and his answer keys often have mistakes in them. However, he has lots of knowledge of Calc III and he could have used better examples to teach concepts in class.
has no idea how to explain things in a logical manner; homework and worksheets and quizzes were much harder than the tests

He cares about his students, but he is a new teacher. He is quirky and is hard to follow when he teaches. He will ask the class if you have any questions but no one will respond, don't be afraid to be the one to ask him questions. He is a tough grader though and assigns a lot of homework. Ultimately he cares about his students.
Descent professor with weekly quizzes and homework. As long as you pay attention in class (or at least self-learn outside of class), youll be fine.

Gives weekly quizzes that are super difficult, doesn't go over many examples or explain things very well. Pretty snarky and often condescending, really makes you work for a good grade. If you're new to calculus find someone else. Will give partial credit, but is a VERY tough grader. I recommend someone else, I would not take him again.

Great professor. He's very chill and just gives a normal guy kinda vibe. Won't act like he's above you or knows way more than you. Just teaches like you're on the same level. Gives good lectures, especially once you get to three dimensional spaces and triple integrals. Tests are very straight forward. If you do the review worksheet, you'll do well.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Ben Peet

reviews.comment: Ben is a great teacher. He gives very specific study guides for what is going to be on the test. The hardest thing about this class is the homework, but he offers extra credit to help with the homework grade. Highly recommend.
Ben is an amazing professor! Math is what it is , but you could tell Ben wants his students to do well and tried to be as clear as possible. Very fair and nice guy, one of the best at SLU.

Professor Peet should have nothing less than a 5. He is very good at his job and I wish I could take him for all my math classes going forward. He gets straight to the point and helps out each and every time you need it. You don't need the textbook as everything is on MyMathLab.
Ben was very understanding and a good professor. Lots of homework but clear and a great choice for someone not great at math. Would def take again!

Seriously, if you are taking Survey he should be your only choice. Early morning class isn't fun, but you'll be happy to see an A on your transcript. If you are a mildly good student, it is literally impossible to get anything less than a B+. He's super helpful and makes it way easier than so many other teachers. Best math teacher ever. Seriously.

Ben was the clearest professor I have had and by far the best math professor I have had at SLU. He was understanding that we are in other courses, but still expected us to know the material. His expectations were realistic if you put the work in.

I took survey of calc with excel with Dr. Peet. He is a really nice guy but it took me a while to know how to do well in the class. You'll need to prepare exams, questions will be as the ones he give you in the old test he'll post 1 week before. DO the homework and you'll be good. The key for his class is good grades in exams and do homework

Ben is a really great professor. One of the best math teachers at SLU. His tests are based off of homework assignments and he will also give partial credit if you show your work. 10/10 would recommend

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: James Mixco

reviews.comment: Jimmy is by far the best professor I've had at SLU. I probably showed up to my 8am 50% of the time, which reflected in my grade, but he never held that against me. He went above and beyond to make sure I passed the course, and you can even text him if you're having trouble with the homework. He's very enthusiastic and a truly lovable guy.

I took Calc 1 in high school, and this class was way easier than that one. I barely studied for exams and got As on all of them. Most questions on the exams came from problems worked out in class, so go to class, even though it isn't mandatory. Jimmy cares a lot about everyone doing well, and will answer any question, even during exams.

Jimmy is v chill; he even lets us call him Jimmy. This beautifully awkward MATH GOD is open to answering any question, like seriously you can even text him homework questions and he will respond in a few minutes. I had him for stats and got an easy A, just do the homework (they are literally the test questions)! He does written lecs, so go to class

Jimmy is very very chill, and he makes up the lecture as he goes. He is very smart when it comes to Stats. His class is very boring though, but it's a pretty easy A if you do the homework and pay attention. He is willing to answer any questions.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: CJ Halverson

reviews.comment: Have fun.... You have to teach yourself the material. If you ask a question you feel really dumb when he explains it. If you miss one lecture you will be lost for the rest of the semester.

CJ was a nice guy, and very accessible by e-mail outside of class. However, his class is really difficult, and it is hard to get a good grade. It is often hard to understand what he is teaching unless you have background in Calculus, and even then it might be difficult. He grades harshly and there are only 3 tests, the final, and homework.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sean Corrigan

reviews.comment: Really nice guy, teaches a lot of intro math classes and he knows a lot of people dont like math. Helps all of the students and goes slow enough so everyone can learn.

Sean Corrigan was a fantastic professor! He explains everything so clearly and really hammers down the basic, fundamental needs of the course. He doesn't just give you equations, he proves why those equations are correct. He once let us do exam corrections and allows homework corrections. His classes are SO FUN!! TAKE HIM!!!

If you are required to take a calc 1 class and get the chance, take Sean's class! This beautiful hobo man knows his stuff and entertains you with his random screams and chuckles. His tests are the study guide (WHICH HE DOES IN CLASS) Homework is required, but he lets you redo them for points back. DO THE STUDY GUIDE. GET A. BE SEAN CORRIGAN.
Sean is the best calc teacher there is He is also a speed demon

Sean is an amazing teacher! If you see him on your list, take his class! You won't regret it. I personally felt that I didn't even need to show for class, because I took Calculus BC last year and was just there for credit, but I still went to class every day just because he made class fun. He's funny, awkward, hot, and overall a great teacher.
Great professor, go to office hours

Overall very easy A, given that it is not a difficult course. Honestly, if it was my first time learning the material, I would have struggled to follow along the lectures as notes are unorganized. However he gives study guides with questions very similar the what he'll have on the test. In addition he gives 50% test corrections.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sam Stoll

reviews.comment: Yes its true this guy is the most condescending person I have ever met. The comments of demeaning sense of humor and frowning at questions all true, which gives the worst learning environment during class. I went to office hours for help and I was horribly chastised for not knowing better. The way I was treated is serious grounds for termination.

Overall, he's a decent selection compared to many of the Survey/Pre-calc alternatives. He's very picky grader, and his tests progressively become harder. However, if you do the homework and study well for the tests, you can manage a B or A. He's definitely not the best, but it could be a whole lot worse.

This guy knows what he's doing. I go in almost every morning for help and he is seriously the most helpful guy ever. He gives people the chance every day for help, and people who don't like him are the ones who don't ask until its too late. He respects students who try, and will honestly help if he sees that. If you want to do well, take him
Decently nice older guy (a bit of weird humor at times). I'm pretty good at math so the class was fairly easy for me. Gives a lot of extra credit. Just do your work and study and you'll be fine.

He is not a bad teacher, its the subject. If you have a hard time in Math you will not like this class. The homework is straight-forward, but if you have questions ask! I guarantee they will show up on the test. The tests are literally your homework, so make sure you know how to do it on your homework, but also be prepared to rush through them.

The class is a standard intro class. He knows his material and provides decent examples. It's taught mush like an AP High School Calc class. He's not the most interesting to listen to and lacks personality, but knows the material. He won't baby you, so don't expect him to spell everything out for you. Take time outside of class to learn it.

Rude, tasteless jokes, and dull in class. He views questions as annoying and at times doesn't give an answer. If you go to his office hours for help, he'll make you feel worse for going and asking for help. Marks ALL points off on test questions if he doesn't like your work even if you have the right answer. Do not take him.
So grumpy, never miss class, and he has a very dry and insulting sense of humor. He thinks he is funny but most people think he is rude. If you show up you should do fine in the course.

Overall rude and demeaning class conduct with a slight xenophobic attitude. In class questions are treated as a nuisance at best or a personal offense to him at worst. NEVER SHOW UP LATE and try not to miss class. I would try not to take his class if you have the option. If not, make sure you do well on the quizzes because they are a life saver.
Notes were pointless because he copied everything from the book onto the board (including definitions in a math class). very rude teacher, dull sense of humor. I DO NOT recommend.

Definitely a class I would take over. As long as you study the homework you will do fine. I have ended up with almost 15 extra credit points before each test which is definitely needed in a calc class where mistakes happen everywhere. He offers help if you feel like you are falling behind, just show up and he will have respect for your questions.

He is the worst teacher i have erver had. He is really mean to students, thinks that everyone except himself are stupid and test are extremely hard. If you are not the best at math dont take him, he will mess you up.

He is a very tough professor and expects his students to already know many of the concepts being taught. Very frustrating when giving notes because he writes extremely fast and does not give the students time to catch up. Exam questions are tricky, and his grading is unreal; took of 7 pts on a 10 pt question for missing a negative sign. AVOID!

The only class I have taken where success is based solely on your own effort. While he will teach you all the material in class, if you do not do the homework you won't do well. I thought he was a awesome teacher and really wants his students to succeed. Makes a lot of jokes at students but they are all with the best intention.

How much easier can a class get? I had almost 20 points extra for each test from the extra credit he gave so i got 20% more on every test. The final was 5 more questions than the tests and copy paste from the homework. This class was the easiest one i'll probably have at SLU!

If you have previous calc. experience you probably won't fail, because he writes examples on the board like he has a bomb strapped to his chest, which goes off if he stops writing. If you have low self-esteem he will send your confidence into the next dimension with a smile...by the way his teeth are uglier than rosie o' donnel in a bikini.

3pt extra credit quizzes every day, if you come to class guaranteed 1pt extra credit just for having your name on the paper. TESTS QUESTIONS, come straight from HOMEWORK, and so do the bonus problems! SO, if you do your homework, you can get an EASY A+!

Not for those who get their feelings hurt easily, just show up to class and take notes, and you'll be fine, didn't usually do the hw, just looked over notes b4 ec quizzes. However, if you can get extra time for exams DO IT!
He is rude and not very helpfull. His tests based off the homework, so overall not to bad; however, his grading is extremely critical and tough.
He is so rude and not very helpful. I hate this class. And the tests are hard. Don't pick him as your teacher!!

Probably the worst teacher at SLU. Gives some of the harshest and unfair partial credit. I remember I did an entire problem exactly right, just a negative sign in the beginning of the problem. Counted the whole thing as wrong. Awful teacher. Very smart, but doesn't teach well. Frowns at in-class questions. Close to impossible tests. AVOID AVOID

Pretty good professor. 6 tests throughout the semester, and then a final. Tests are hard, especially tests 3,4, and 5, those are brutal. Final is pretty easy if you prepare. Homework is optional. Daily extra credit quizzes. Doesnt care if the student passes or fails. Overall, hard but not impossible.
good

A good teacher. Knows his stuff, teaches it well. Gives extra credit via quiz at the beginning of each class. Kinda has a rude sense of humor, but hey, that's the real world- you can't be soft. His tests are hard, but straight from the HW- he gives it to you for a reason. A very fair teacher. Show up, do work, and you'll get an A.

Very rude. Does it jokingly. Tests are very hard, however Math is not my best subject. Likes students who are receiving a good grade in his class and doesn't acknowledge you if you do not have a good grade. Would only recommend for those who consider themselves good Math students. HAVE TO SHOW UP TO CLASS!

A few things you need to know: 1. go to class. It's the only way you'll know what's going on. His notes clearly explain the homework, and you review the night's hmwk in class. 2. Igore his rudeness. He's kinda funny, but it often comes across as mean. 3. STUDY for the tests. Besides the daily extra credi opportunity, they're the only grades u get.
Very straight forward class. I would recommend to any college freshman. He used to teach high school back in the day. Willing to meet after class. All around great teacher.

I would avoid him like the plague when choosing math professors. He has a VERY old style of teaching, writes useless definitions and problems on the board and talks to the chalkboard while doing it. Class notes never really helped, had to teach myself the material while doing the homework. Tests are difficult but not impossible.

if u want to do well in this class, its very simple and easy. go to class, do your homework, ask him for help if u need it or go to the tutoring center rm 28 n u will do great. i made an A and so can u!

He teaches ok, but he is extremely rude. He is willing to meet after class, but any questions asked during class will usually be met with sarcasm. He enjoys making people feel bad about their math skills and this, in turn, discourages students from speaking up when they are confused. I wouldn't recommend him to someone with marginal math skills.
Avoid, avoid, avoid. Would not recommend, especially not to business majors who expect an easy core A. Works too quickly and is too unfair on partial credit for tests. Also does not respond to email.
Very straight forward. Class is structured the same way everyday. Go over any problems on homework, 1-questions quiz based off of homework, then lectures on next lesson.

Professor Stoll is a decent teacher, but if you don't have a tough exterior, you might be offended easily because he likes to make really rude comments about people. His tests aren't too bad, but they are hard to get done in the 50 minutes you're given.

He's pretty old and like to crack jokes at the students. Cool guy as long as you don't get offended. Some tests are really hard others pretty easy. id recommend him if you have an interest in math or are already decent at it.

Mr. Stoll definitely knows his subject and made calc enjoyable. Grade consists of 7 ch. tests and a comprehensive final. Must attend class for notes. To do well, you must do all the homework. Test questions come directly from homework. I agree with the other reviewers, it was hard finishing his tests in 50 min. Good professor, would recommend!

Goes thru lessons fast! If ur a slow learner when it comes to math, don't take this class! If u need more than 50 mins to take a test don't take this class! He is very sarcastic which is ok at times but other times he was a smart alec and would make students feel stupid if they asked a question. I know there's easier math professors than him!

I would suggest this teacher only if you are self disciplined enough to keep up on the hw and be able to go over and learn the material on your own. He knows his subject, but i wouldnt suggest him to my freinds, only my enemies
easy class! great professor! I like math so much. take this class!

He knows his stuff, HW every night, if you dont do it you are screwed, tests are hard, he doesnt really get info across to you, if you ask questions he makes you look and feel stupid. dont take this class

Not the guy for you if you don't go to class very much or math bores you. Learn a lot but isn't necessarily the easiest teacher you could take for survey of calc. Runs through the material really fast too.
awesome teacher!

He was an awsome professor. His lectures were clear, straight to the point, and always matched up with the homework assignments. Tests came from homework problems. Just go to class and do the homework assignments.
Go to Class. Simple as that. Definately Recommend.
Great professor!!! Very nice man and very good class. Offers lots of bonus points on tests. Is very funny and helpful. Wants you to succeed. RECOMMENDED!!!
I like Prof. Stoll. He was always willing to help during his office hours. This is one of the few math classes in my life I actually remembered what I learned after the test

Sure he'll crack a joke and try to make you look like an idiot from time to time, but he knows what he's doing and his class is rather entertaining. Make sure you go to class and get the work that he assigns done and you should have no problem with the tests.

sammy!!! loved him! if you go to class and do your homework, you can get an A, great teacher. He's known for his plug and chug techniques, which make the class even more hilarious. he might kick you out of class but that is because he only cares that you pass the class and do well..take him if you want to pass calculus...

Sammy is a wonderful teacher and hes frickin hilarious!! if you arent a baby then his somewhat insulting comments will just make you laugh. he makes survey of calc interesting!! he will help you anytime and he gives a****load of extra credit points. its a wonderful class. id say sammy is one of the best professors at slu!! i lovessssss sammy

Don't take him. It's possible to get an A but he's a mean person and he's incredibly insulting and he'll make fun of you. It's really an hour long class and you're always rushing to keep up with his notes. Better luck taking another section.
No Comments
gives gobs and gobs of extra points. grades kinda hard, but then again he gives you a****load of extra points. Doesnt give a-'s so you have to have like a 94 to get an A. He's a good guy tho
Very sarcastic and not the friendliest prof around but a nice guy nonetheless. Class material is difficult, attendence quizes given and used as extra credit on tests

Great teacher who is very clear, extra credit quizes over homework that go towards the test grades. Real nice guy and easy class if you do the homework assignments which are usually short. If you've already had any calc it will be amazingly easy
tags:
2005
Great teacher who is very clear

reviews.comment: he is the nicest and best teacher i think i've ever had. he has homework quizzes everyday but they don't count against you. awesome teacher!!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Christopher Halverson

reviews.comment: Professor Halverson was nice but was overall not a great teacher. He expected everyone to just understand what he was saying and did not explain things well, even one-on-one. I had to teach myself much of the course material myself. Having a background in calc definitely helps
Definitely didn't mess around with homework but gave us plenty of time in class to finish. Always responded to emails and was available for office hours. Awesome prof - not easy but I learned a lot.

Halverson was a great professor. He was genuine and ended up writing one of my recommendation letters for Honors. He is a caring professor who tries to make the class not unbearable. He was funny and would always joke with us students. With that said, precalc is easy in general and his class is no exception. TAKE HIM! :)))))

He does not teach anything. He simply assumes you will learn the material on your own time without him having to explain any of the content in depth. He hands out a worksheet after around 15 minutes of teaching and lets you leave 25 minutes into an hour long class. If you get a class with him switch out or be prepared to do lots of studying.
Just awful. Doesn't really teach.. I studied hard and constantly left class more confused. This is probably a good class for a math major? Get a tutor if you're stuck with him.

This class was horrendous! He lectured for like two seconds and then gave a worksheet. I couldn't learn anything, so I had to google everything for the whole time. Never taking one of his classes again. The worksheets were due every class and then a book assignment was due every Friday. If you do all of those then the exams are fine.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Haijun Gon

reviews.comment: Prof. Gong's accent is slightly hard to understand. He's not the worst teacher, I have learned a bit from him. For this class in particular, Time Series, I was only barely able to understand it, and the textbook we use is awful. One perk is that he takes all the homework from the book, so if you have the solutions for the book you're good.

Almost half of the calc 1 class dropped the course. He says the tests are exactly like the hw and promises that if you study from it you will do fine. Unfortunately, that is not the case. Only students that have taken Calc in high school are able to do well in the class. Bad teacher!

So, Haijun seemed to be very nice and helpful at first. But it soon became clear that his lectures are not very clear at all and it was difficult to understand him. In fact, half of my Calc I class dropped his course and only then did the math department get involved. He was pressured to improve his teaching, which he has. Proceed with caution.

Really broken English and hard to understand. Accent is not that strong, but he has awful grammar, misuses tenses, and is just overall confusing. If you ask a question, you only have about a 30 chance of him answering it, he wont understand. Teaches with textbook given slides. Half of his test questions are copied from the homework, so do it.
not too easy, try to study hard and limit your time for each problem on the exams

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Carlos Vega

reviews.comment: I love Carlos! He's funny, and his lectures are very easy to follow. Go to class, takes notes, and you'll pass. The grade is based only on four exams, and all homework is optional. An amazing class and an amazing professor. Doesn't grade exams very quickly though.

Dr. Vega is hands down the best math professor/teacher I have ever had. I had him for Calculus III. His skill in communicating information to the students transcends space and time. Not to mention his free-hand drawings of graphs, surfaces, shapes, etc are better than what most can do with a straight edge. I highly recommend choosing him.

I took Dr. Vega for both Calculus I and Calculus III. The only grade you receive in his class is from four exams. Homework is optional, but if you want a good grade, I would suggest doing it. His lectures are more theoretical, so if you are not a conceptual learner, I suggest taking someone else. However, he is willing to help if you just ask.

Man Carlos was great. He has a pretty interesting sense of humor and explained calc pretty slowly. His tests were not that bad contrary to other posters even though the grade is only 4 tests so it is recommended to pay attention to the problems he works out and the book problems he assigns. Other than that he is cool and helps out in his office.

He's kind of a dry guy, but genuinely cares about his students. Very funny in an awkward way. No extra credit, no homework, and no quizzes. Four tests define your grade, which might be bad news for some but in my opinion it wasted the least amount of time/took the least amount of effort out of any other class I've heard of. Tests CAN be hard.

Vega is great at explaining calc. He broke it down really simple for everyone to understand and worked examples with excellent explanation. That being said, his tests are pretty difficult. There is no homework so over prepare for his tests. You only get 3 and a final....

His lectures are mainly conceptualization. Test didn't seem to cover the stuffed specifically learned in class. He will give a great deal of extra credit though. If you are somewhat decent at Calc to begin with he is your guy.

He's a really funny guy & the class has a great atmosphere but his lectures get long & are very theory-based rather than example based. The examples that he does give are easy but rushed bcuz he runs out of time almost every class period bcuz he spends a lot of time waiting for students to answer questions or he's going through irrelevant ideology

He's a pretty fantastic calc teacher, and the least amount of work/maximized learning compared to others (in my opinion). However, the entire class grade is based on four tests (23% for first 3 and 31% final) with NO homework. Overall I would recommend him over anyone else.
Good class if you have taken a Calculus class before. If not, stay away. Not very helpful and makes you feel like an idiot for asking a question.

Pretty good professor. Tests were not that bad even though there were only 3 of them and a final (homework was optional and not collected) and were mostly based off homework problems or in class worked out problems, so pay attention when he's reviewing before the test. He is also nice and helpful in his office when you need it.

Great teacher. Hardest tests i have ever taken. He definetly challenges you. Make sure you study for the tests, they are usually harder than any problems or homework done. He goes through everything very clear and slow. Test will define your grade, no homework or quizes at all.

Dr. Vega is very kind and helpful. He is a bit quirky, but his lectures are clear and interesting. His exams are also very fair. Most of them are based on in class problems. I had Vega for Calc 3 and Diffeq and I would recommend him to anyone needing to take those classes.

Carlos seems like a nice guy; however, as a teacher I had trouble getting any help from him. He was not very personal, and many students dropped the class after learning that passing would be virtually impossible.

Vega is a very good teacher who teaches the class as if none of the students have ever taken Calc before. In fact, most students have, but he does so on order to be fair. He does not move too quickly, but he is not slow, either. Vega is by far one of the best professors at SLU, and if you plan on taking calc, pick him.
Really good professor, would strongly recommend over anyone else teaching this course. Helps a lot and during office hours. Nice and wants students to do well. Easy to talk to, approachable.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Rosanna Speller

reviews.comment: She was very unorganized and wasn't as knowledgeable about her class as she should have been. For example, students were constantly correcting her math and telling her how to do certain things on Excel. She also moved very fast and didn't teach Calc that well which was very hard if you've never taken that level of math before.
quarky teacher. pretty easy class made it hard to judge the quality of her teaching ability. Some of the class seemed to struggle I believe.

Most confusing teacher ever- if you can take a different professor, do it. She is all over the place with her thinking and it's very hard to keep up and understand what she's asking you to do/talking about. She doesn't explain things well and makes you memorize formulas for things that don't matter, and is pretty strict. Her tests are very hard.
Shes a good teacher, but you have to put in the effort. Class can be confusing at time. Use her office alot, you need them.

i dont think math is her primary subject. teaches from the textbook, uses powerpoints and writes on board. voice is kinda annoying but you get used to it. tests aren't that hard if you study, can get partial credit on questions if you talk to her. she is kinda helpful, homework almost every class. attendance is mandatory
She is a pretty good teacher. There's a lot of homework but she helps you out with extra credit. She's funny and helps her students with any problems.
She's awesome! I personally love her as a teacher! Plus her class is sooo easy!

Speller is a quirky professor, and I never paid attention to her lectures. I have a feeling that if I hadn't taken Calculus before this class I would not have done well in the class. You have to do all of the online homework, but she does give review sheets before the test which are helpful! Overall, not a bad class!!

Rosanna is fairly scattered, but her review sheets made tests a breeze. She took attendance and had a policy where if you missed 4 classes, she would replace your lowest test grade with your final grade. Would take again.
reviews.attendance: and had a policy where if you missed

reviews.comment: SO far the easiest math professor i've taken at SLU (not saying a lot). However, the class is still difficult and requires a lot of work. Homework is easy, very open to meeting with studentshelp, and tests are related to class materials. She is very "odd" and makes it kind of hard to learn, but would recommend!

I'm not great at calc but this class is easier than the pre calc class I took in high school. She can be a little all over the place but she's always available for office hours and will set up extra time for you if those don't work. The practice problems she gives are almost exactly what the questions look like on the test. Not hard.
Do not take her class. She is very scatter brained and doesn't really teach much during class. And when she does it isn't clear and isn't really presented in a way that is easy to understand.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Theresa Jeevanjee

reviews.comment: She is a very nice lady but teaches a math class in a very unique way.
