Instead of grading on your ability to do problems she looks at the way you understand the concepts and can explain them. Her tests generally pull directly from homework, quizzes, or other tests. And she allows the use of a notecard on some tests with any material. O
Amazing professor but you absolutely have to work for an A.

Probably one of the worst professor I have ever had. Needed to teach the entire course to myself because she skipped 95% of powerpoint slides even if they were required for HW & tests. She filled in for another professor who was gone for a year. One day that professor came in and taught and it was the one day that I learned anything in that class.

I would not recommend Dr. J to anyone. She is terribly disorganized and often skips over material that you need to know for the homework, quizzes and tests. She also doe't make it clear how she is grading the homework nor does she give any feedback and the assignments or quizzes. If you want to do well in this class, you will have to read the book.

I believe the comments below about the math courses but if you are taking a computer science AVOID as much as possible. She seems nice but her grading criteria is not clear enough making me pissed off several times. Go to classes unless you want to fail. Teach yourself as she is not a very good lecturer.

Dr. J in the beginning was an okay professor, she seemed very organized and knew what she was talking about. For the first half the semester I seemed to learn a lot. However towards the end she would often skip through power points so it was often confusing on what is on the exam, however she is not that hard of teacher but a lot of hwk!

I definitely recommend Prof. J. Math doesn't come easy to me, but she helped me get an A! I had to go in for office hours, but it was well worth it. She helped so much with the homework & tests. Not allowed to use calculator, but it means test questions are much easier. You get note cards on tests, & test consist of homework problems, so do them!!

Shes a good teacher, but honestly it is way too easy to get an A in this class. I literally failed the first two tests and then managed to get an A- by the time the semester ended. She lets you fit information on a notecard for every test. Make use of this. You DONT get a calculator, which threw me off and caused me to fail the first two tests.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Gerrit Smith

reviews.comment: He is very smart and he is a nice person, but he cannot teach. He doesn't make an effort to connect to students at all, the teaching is pretty robotic. The notes he puts on the board are not the best. Don't take him if you have the option.
Run.

In general, he is good, however, he has no social skills, and its like dealing with a robot or a statue. He writes on board a lot, but his notes are organized and clear. Then explains the information. If you take notes, you will need the textbook only for homework problems. Exams are not hard, just reviewing the notes will be enough to pass.

Grad Assistant. Three tests, no quizzes. Huge amount of material on the first two and a culmulative final. Does not explain topics well and often doesn't cover specifics. He won't post a schedule so stay on your toes. Three tutors and I still had to teach myself eveything. Your text book is useless. Choose an actual professor.

Going to class is only going to hurt you when it comes to Gerrit. He does examples during class that he later emails are wrong, he teaches material we will never be tested on or given homework on and when you ask him a question he states that we should just know it already. Save yourself the agony and run far away from this class.

Abandon hope all hope ye who enroll here. Mr. Smith's course has surpassed all of my other courses in terms of sheer awfulness. He has an inept, unprepared, lackadaisical approach to teaching; he refuses to listen to students and does not prepare nor inform them properly for exams. Avoid him at all costs Draconian grading system, awful instruction

He is very intelligent but is not able to teach what so ever. His notes are not at all related to the online homework or worksheets. The homework is SO MUCH HARDER and that's what the exams are on. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!! Never mentioned it much less used it at all. Don't bother asking questions he just mumbles to himself.
AVOID. A smart grad student that cannot teach students. He is so smart, in fact, that he has limiting social skills. Do not take even if it is your last resort. Your GPA will drop.
He knows the subject very well, but cannot explain it to students. Horrible teacher avoid him at all cost. Wait until the next semester if you have to

Graduate Student who knows his subject but is incredibly unclear and cannot teach a proper class. His assignments are on problems that are not even close to those taught in class or in the book. He does reply to your emails in a timely manner. Avoid Gerrit at all costs. You will only do decent if you had taken Pre-Calculus prior to him.
WORST CLASS EVER! Please do not take. It was so hard and he was not helpful.

Masters student seeking is doctorate very unhelpful he definitely knows his subject but just does not know how to not confuse his students. When I stopped going to his classes and was only learning through my math lab my grade actually increased significantly. 30 students at the start all but 14 dropped.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Joseph Eisner

reviews.comment: There's nightly homework, but it's easy. Pay attention in class and take good notes and you'll do fine. He gives study guides before each test that are identical to the test.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Samuel Stoll

reviews.comment: This professor is one of the meanest people I have ever known. He is not cut out to teach, the tone of his lectures is as if you already know all of the material he's supposed to teach, and when someone has a question, he treats the person as if they are completely stupid. The only points he gives are his tests. I would never recommend this prof.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael Lamar

reviews.comment: He is a very considerate teacher and he is required to cram a ton of material within the duration of the semester. His tests are very long for 50 minutes and require a strong understanding of the material. He generally curves the test grades. If you Chegg the homework, don't expect a high grade in the class. He is the best option for MATH 4880.
He's a nice guy but a terrible teacher. His lectures are long and not helpful he barely does any example & expects you to be able to do tons of problems.
awesome guy, very smart and helpful

Professor Lamar really knows statistics. He explains everything clearly and he is extremely helpful during office hour. Test was hard but reasonable. To be honest, he's the best math teacher in my undergraduate life!

mostly theory and proofs in class, and application was left for us to figure out on the homework (we did go over the homework in class afterwards which is helpful) doesn't assign a lot of problems/almost never turn them in, so its really up to you to do the extra work outside of class to make sure you understand the marierial. Overall good.

Lamar is a very intelligent professor. I was nervous about DE's but Lamar explained everything very clearly and I actually liked going to class. The tests were tricky but not if you really studied. 40% of your grade is participation & homework. He was always willing to help and is by far one of my favorite math professors at SLU.

A nice person, but actions are questionable.I am for a challenge but not when it messes with my graduation track.Told me he knows Prob/Stat sequence is easy and he intentionally wanted to make it hard. Understood.For perspective He stopped teaching the prob/stat track (probably because complaints) to let the previous teacher teach-the better one

He is a decent teacher, but has some trouble explaining certain concepts. Do not buy the hardcover book, buy the web version, it comes with the homework problems and sample tests. To understand the class you HAVE to read. Class is all lecture, and can be very boring.

Lamar is a great guy. He's one of those people that's so good at math that sometimes it isn't explained clearly the first time (he holds holds 4 graduate degrees) but if you catch him during office hours he'll go as slow as you need to get it.
Lamar is a good professor teaching difficult material. The class is hard, but Lamar is very helpful during office hours.
He is a great guy, but the class is super hard. Pre meds, be prepared to work for your gpa. If you are a med scholar i suggest you drop this class because it is not an easy A or A-.

This class is harder than organic chemistry, but interesting if you like statistics. It requires a lot of outside work and the homework is very difficult. If you go for help, Dr. Lamar is extremely kind and a great resource for the class.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sean Nemetz

reviews.comment: Not a very clear teacher, go see him to have help or else you won't understand what you have to do.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Paul Taylor

reviews.comment: He is a nice professor but I had to learn a lot on my own. Class is not mandatory but he uses criteria from class on the tests. I would only skip a couple of times if you really need to! Homework is also not mandatory but you will not do well if you don't do it. His class is not bad but you will need to put in work!
He is a nece person. Attendence will not be graded.
He is a nice person and he is willing to help you. Attendance depends on yourself and it takes no credits. Quizs can use notes.
reviews.attendance: depends on yourself and it takes no credits

reviews.comment: AWFUL "TEACHER". Would not EVER recommended him! Unclear directions on tests, whole class hates him. Expect to learn a lot on your own. never had such an awful teacher. Doesn't use examples other than super simple ones

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Feroz Siddique

reviews.comment: I took Feroz for calculus over the summer. With a smaller class size, he was able to answer questions you had in class. Doesn't offer a lot of homework and is there to help if you don't understand it. Attend class & get to know him because he is a great guy! Also offers A LOT of extra credit that boosts your grade.

Feroz is tough no doubt. But he really challenges students to understand the material. He asks us to try and come up with our own solutions to problems before teaching a theorem or gives us new problems and just asks us to brainstorm solutions before presenting one. You will learn calculus! It;s a fun class and the EC will save your GPA don't worry

AVOID TEACHER AT ALL COSTS. I had an A in precalc and went from that A to a D- in Calc. He made class so much harder than it should be. He doesn't use the text book, he doesn't put up and lecture notes online, or has any other resources to help. No study guides, no practice tests, no nothing. He is unfair and says mean comments to you in class.
His class is recommended if you wish to really learn. If not, then it is better to avoid. He does say things well above our heads and lofty but is very helpful re-explaining them. Antics are funny.
No organization
He is a great teacher, he explains very well, and doesn't mind re-explaining something we already went over.as long as you practice and do the online homework, you'll do great in his class.

Like many know, foreigners are a lot better at math and expect others to understand it just as much. Even though this is his mindset, he is 100% COMPLETELY helpful. His office hours are always open, and if you just simply ask for help, he's willing to! So important in a professor. Tests are to see how well you understand the concepts, that's all.
He knows that he is the toughest College Allegra teacher at SLU and he is fine with it. He is completely ridiculous. Makes things that we learned in high school, x10 harder and expects us to know it.
Awesome in class ! . Every class is fun. But his tests are very hard...and sometimes its hard to catch his mumblings. Typical mathgeek.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Darren Garbuz

reviews.comment: Linear Algebra, Summer, 2015. At the beginning of the semester, it is hard. He is usually quiet and shy. He might seem a little akward for some, however, this guy is one of the very few proffesors with a heart, as he is there for you when you need him. As you get to know him, he is actually pretty cool to the point where I enjoyed his class.

Linear Algebra, Summer of 2015. At the beginning of the semester, it is hard. He is usually quiet and shy. He might seem a little akward for some, however, this guy is one of the very few proffesors with a heart, as he is there for you when you need him. As you get to know him, he is actually pretty cool to the point where I enjoyed his class.

Can be a little awkward. Talks kind of quiet and lectures can be dry. As the material is easier, the tests are easier, but further through the semester, the questions become more confusing. 3 tests and multiple computer homework assignments and quizzes.

He is an ok teacher. He could be confusing at times, but if you need help understanding, he'll try his best to help you(especially before tests). He is also very quiet and fades out a lot when he talks. You might want to sit in front of class. Participation is a requirement for easy points.
a lot of homework and participation grades, which helps with the difficult tests. He will always help you if you ask, hard to pay attention during lectures because he speaks very quietly.
Mr. Garbuz is very helpful. His class is straightforward in regards to test and other assignments. Just do the work and you'll be fine.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Carolyn Sur

reviews.comment: Dr. Sur is a very nice woman her explanations during class are often times confusing but if you seek help she is more than willing to help. If you have perfect attendance she will bump your grade up a letter grade and the quizzes can be substituted for a test so if you mess up on a test you can make up for it by doing well on a quiz.
reviews.attendance: she will bump your grade up a letter grade and the quizzes can be substituted for a test so if you mess up on a test you can make up for it by doing well on a quiz

reviews.comment: Took Sur for College Algebra. She is very scattered and all over the place during class. She doesn't teach well in the classroom or in office hours. Exams are confusing and instructions not clearly explained. However, she does offer extra credit and is willing to work with you to raise your grade.

Math seems to come naturally to me, but Ms. Sur seemed to make math extremely difficult. She is a very sweet and caring lady, but her class is ridiculous, and she offers very little help. She spends very little time and detail on her examples, and she flies through two sections per day. I would strongly discourage taking this class.
Waste of time taking this class. DO NOT enroll in her course. There are plenty of other options at SLU for college algebra

This is the worst math teacher I have ever had. You would be better off taking online math because attending class is useless. She never goes through all your sections, and you're pretty much stuck with figuring out everything on your own. Most of the examples she shows are wrong. Is also rude and sometimes insulting. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!
Very nice and friendly, but not the best teacher.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Imre Tuba

reviews.comment: Dr. Tuba is a very nice guy with a great personality, but the homework was confusing and never correlated between online and book assignments. Tests were rather different as well. Despite this, Dr. Tuba was willing to help any student during office hours. Study hard, go to office hours, and you will easily pass.

He's terrible. The clarity of his teaching is just not there and I can't stand it. The questions he asks are very in-depth and his test questions are almost all or nothing. Just find some other teacher. Don't take his class.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Tanya Lloyd-Hepburn

reviews.comment: She was very nice and was able to explain things thoroughly.
Quizzes are hard as are test. Does not know how to teach and does not help when you go and see her during office hours. Horrible teacher.. DONT TAKE HER!!!

She's very helpful, but her tests are very hard and at times she's not very straightforward and can be confusing. You'll need to do the homework and prepare for the quizzes because those are the grades that will really help your grade. Overall not too bad, just frustrating at times.
I felt this class was pretty straight forward. There were no surprises. Overall, anyone can do well in her class.

Math is not my favorite subject, but I felt that the professor made the class enjoyable. I was able to follow what she said in class. She also never surprised you on quizzes or exams. There was always a review sheet which gave problems just like those that were on the exam. She was fair in her grading and very helpful during office hours.

I thought overall she was a great teacher. She was very helpful and nice. She sometimes had difficulty explaining things in the classroom, but did a better job one on one. I would advise anyone to take her class especially if you are not a math major.

Tanya's class is definitely one of the toughest math class. Definitely come to the office hours, she is very helpful and would make sure you know the material. Be well prepared for the quiz and tests. Although her class is difficult than most math prof in SLU, she drops some of your lowest quiz and one test scores, which boosts your grades a lot.

This was a bad math experience. I felt like a fifth grader taking calculus. Am I smarter than a fifth grader after taking this class? Probably not. Tests are nothing like the homework (which makes sense).

Not great at teaching. Does not know much about math. Doesn't make up her own problems so does not know how to solve them. Does no work for the class. Shows up late. Has a dumb picture on her profile. In short, do not take her. DROP HER CLASS! Buy calculus for dummies instead. Cannot believe I'm paying for her to teach me squat.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Tori Reany

reviews.comment: She was very boring in class. If you are not good at math, I would not recommend her. She is very systematic when explaining things, and does not explain the logic behind what you are learning. She would often suggest just memorizing how to do the problems on the handout and said you would be fine for tests. However that was not always the case.

Professor Reany is very nice and is always willing to answer questions. Her lectures are very clear. She uses handouts which are very helpful because I can focus more on listening and not writing every little thing down. She gives reviews for all exams.

She's straightforward and available to help. The class is also structured in a way that so that if you don't necessarily do well on the tests you can make up for it by doing well on the homework and the online quizzes. I would recommend her!
Easy A. Uses online homework program but can re-do it multiple times. Gives study guide for every (3) tests and final and the exam is the exact same problems just with different numbers. Recommended.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael French

reviews.comment: Father French is great. He knows what he is talking about. Lectures are a tad dry, as it's pretty much by the book, but the course is pretty easy. Tests were open book and he drops the lowest test and project grades.

Never had any computer experience prior, ended up with an A. There were 5 hw (he drops the lowest) and 3 projects (also drops the lowest). He also allows 6 absences before it effects your grade. Requires a decent amount of work though, but good class, would recommend to anyone.
The projects are difficult. Also, you have chance to drop the lowest grade. I recommend do your best for the first projects, then drop the third project grade.

French was the nicest professor I had this semester. He truly does want everyone to succeed and is always willing to meet with you one on one. Very responsive to emails. As other reviewers said, his lectures are not always very clear, but he really tries and will do his best to answer your questions.
tags: his lectures are not always very clear

reviews.comment: Father French is so sweet! i am terrible at math but still ended up with an A- because he wants everyone to do well. Just do the online homework consistently and go to class and you'll be fine. He is super nice and will help you with your grade!

This is pretty much your basic college algebra class. Homework, tests and any kind of quiz is through a website called course compass. If you're not comfortable doing math on the computer then don't waste your time. He DOES NOT give examples for test questions anymore, but he does allow open books and notes during tests. Lectures are very boring.

Super easy A! All assignments and tests are through a web called coursecompass. You get hints and examples for every question, which makes them super easy. Buy a TI-84 calculator! Attendence is mandatory and lectres are not exciting, but you can do homework secretely during class.
Great teacher, VERY nice guy. He will help you no matter what. Talks fast during lecture tho, but all homework is on course compass which is made easy. Take him!!
Father French is awesome. He is very helpful. Take this class.
show up to class if you cant let him know....be prepared for a snore fest unless you really like math.......... do all the homework.. and you should be ready for the very simple test and final

Father French is the man!! an assignment is due after every class and you have to submit your answers through a website called coursecompass.com. its really easy to get full marks on those and the midterm test are super easy. if you forget to submit homework you can always get an extension. TAKE HIM!!!!AAAAAAAA+++++++++++

Father French is an amazing teacher. He is willing to sit down and help with w.e he can. He may not be clear in lectures but stick around for a few mins after class and he will def be there to help. He wants all of his students to pass and makes it easily done. I love father french :):)

Father French is a very caring teacher. He really wants all of his students to succeed. He has some problems in clarity, but really tries. He, however, is not the most exciting of lecturers (its more like nap time than learning).

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Alan Von Herrmann

reviews.comment: He's an inspiring person, however his teaching skills are down the drain. He'll ask for us "to think about it" when most of us don't understand the topic that has been explained. I suggest someone take his class if there were other classes open because he exaggerates calculus to a point of confusion. Also, he wastes time on personal anecdotes.

I was terrified of math. I had never had a good teacher before, but Dr. Von Herrmann changed that. He was invested in his students, and wanted only success for them. He was challenging- don't get me wrong- but it was a class that pushed me to be better and work harder. Recommended for those who truly love to learn!

Prof VH always pushes his students to do well and to think of big ideas. Rather than memorizing formulas, Prof VH knows how to encourage his students to think critically. The skills I learned can be applied to any situation which requires critical thinking and I definitely grew as a learner. Worth taking if you're willing to put in the hard work.

Dr. V. is a challenging professor but he definitely knows his stuff and offers as many opportunities as possible for students to learn as well. I trust that he knows what it takes to make a student into a good engineer. I am very glad I took his class.

I loved these classes, and I loved this professor. He was absolutely brilliant and was available at any point in time you needed him, including 2 am. He is often seen around campus and offers great advice for those pursuing a career in high-level engineering.

Dr. VH's teachings most accurately reflect who he is as a person, mentor, and friend.I have never been pushed this far to not only learn and retain, but master the material of a course in the calculus sequence.Take this course with this instructor, if you truly want to accept the challenge of learning in a way you have never experienced before.

Dr. Von Herrmann stresses acquiring knowledge rather than merely a grade and helps students to understand larger concepts and applications. Of course, the homework/exams are challenging, as they should be for students to grow intellectually. I definitely recommend Dr. Von Herrmann to those who are willing to work hard and be rewarded for hard work.

This class was challenging because professor Von Herrmann is concerned with teaching concepts and ideas not just formulas, but the concepts are what is important to fully learn and understand the material. Prof VH was always available outside of class hours which was very helpful. I definitely feel like I grew as a student by taking this class.

Professor Von Herrmann creates a atmosphere that allows you to learn the concepts. Although this course was very challenging, he was always willing to meet outside of class to help with homework and concepts. Homework was very challenging, but prepared me for the tests. Prof VH really wants his students to learn and he encourages you to think.
Von Herrmann is literally the worst professor I have ever come across, and this is coming from somebody who has never *disliked* a professor in his life.

Von Herrmann is hands down the worst teacher I have ever had. Not only is he degrading, but he talks down to you. He doesn't teach well, is hard to understand, and his tests are incredibly difficult. I'm an engineer and he has nearly turned me away from math. He compares SLU to other schools and has called the student body here, unmotivated.
He is awful. I hated taking this class and I could not understand anything in the entire class. I enjoy calculus but he ruined it.

AVH is clearly a genius person. He tells us multiple times a day and is degrading towards his students. Along that line he is one of the most arrogant people I've met. He compares students to those at other schools. He will reward hard work, especially if you are one of his favorites. His tests are quite difficult, and homework is near impossible.
He is the hardest professor you will ever take. He only talks about how good he is and doesn't explain how to do anything. Don't take this class if you haven't taken Calc. before.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: David Jackson

reviews.comment: he first day of class he showed a chart of what your grade will be based on what you go in the previous course. so he told me i was going to fail the first day of class. he also said how in the past students didn't like the way he was teaching but instead of fixing it he wrote a paper defending his crappy teaching. Worst teacher I've ever had.

The worst teacher I've ever had. He doesn't know how to teach anything. It is like he is reading word for word out of a textbook. He also assumes his students already know some things so he doesn't teach us a lot of what we need to know. I would avoid this man or else you will become very frustrated and it will be a loooooong semester.

Take a calculus course before Dr. Jackson. I had no idea what was going on for a majority of the semester. He would write an extremely long explanation of the concept on the board but never really explain how to apply it to a problem. I learned most of the material from classmates or on my own.He has wonderful intentions for his students, though.

I loved math before this class, but Dr. Jackson sucks the life out of math. Class is mandatory because of daily quizzes, but they are very manageable. He provides old tests that mirror your current tests. Daily homework, but he never collects it, so no one does it. Not a high pressured class. Grades seem to be better than other calc 1 professors

He has really great intentions, he is just not the best teacher. He is very nice and wants you to succeed, he just can't always communicate the difficult concepts of the course. He's not a horrible teacher, hes just not the best.

He is a very nice person but not a good teacher! He tries really hard and wants you to do well. However, you have a quiz every day so attendance is basically mandatory unless you want a zero. He is very confusing when he teaches and his class is very boring.
He tries hard but just cant get his thoughts across clearly. If you ask a question, he is more likely to confuse you even more. Luckily he gives practice tests and if you do those it is manageable
Quizzes every day, no calculators, goes off on wild incomprehensible tangets in the middle of explaining difficult material. Not a whole lot of good can be said.

He is one of the most caring professors I have ever encountered. Sometimes it is difficult to judge what he thinks is important and what will be on the test but if you pay attention in class and study EVERYTHING you'll be fine

Worst teacher I've ever had, he wasn't heppful, he couldn't explain anything at all. I went from having never making lower than an A in math classes to making a C here. He is obviously intelligent but has a hard time communicating in other words, he should be in research and never be at thw head of a classroom.

He is smart, but not at all helpful. He talks down to students at times. I have approached him for help and he just told me I should remember the material, or I should go to a lower level class Rude! He does not cover much material in class, and you are expected to learn on your own, his lectures are all over the place and very difficult to follow

This teacher is HORRIBLE!! DO NOT TAKE HIM....thats if u wanna live! He is a terrible teacher and wayyyyyy to old to be teaching. Not much of teaching actually, more of complaining about everything and just talking really slow. BAD BAD BAD.

Professor Jackson is very difficult. Test questions sometimes come out of no where and you will spend half the test doing the long division to obain the right answer (no calculators on tests). I would avoid him if possible.

I took him for preclac and had to drop the class. Does not explain things well and expects you to know the concepts back from high school. tests are hard, no calculator and gives homework although doe not check it. Gives tons of handouts and often rambles on about nothing during class. HE SUCKS

Although Dr. Jackson is very intelligent, he is not very good at explaining concepts. He is slightly more helpful one-on-one during office hours, but lecture is often confusing when he goes off on tangents about more complicated mathematical applications. Tests can be difficult too.

greatest teacher ever! He is kind and helpful, he gives a lot a handout, and if you just read them and do the homework, there is no problem to get an A. He is interesting and very patient. You can not miss his classes!

Quite possibly the best math professor I've ever had. Textbook wasn't my favorite, but do his practice tests and drill homework and you'll be fine. Only downside is that some group projects can be burdensome. He genuinely cares about his students' success. Take him whenever possible.

Calculus II was one of the most difficult classes I have ever taken. Dr. Jackson has a very elitist mentality and although he is quite bright, is difficult to follow in class. His tests are extremely difficult; no calculator, crazy fractions, and tons of memorizing formulas. Good luck if you get him
Dr.Jackson is awesome. If you do your hw and attend the class, you should get an A in the end.

The man is brilliant. As such, he gets very excited and goes off on tangents about difficult topics, but they thankfully won't be on quizzes or tests. He is very difficult to understand sometimes, but he is very willing to help you personally during office hours. Easy to succeed in class with a lot of easy quizzes and projects, tests can be hard.
All he does is say "the obvious answer is...."

Mr. Jackson has a very elitist mentality. If one is in the profession of teaching they should not make learning intimidating, especially when you are paying for it. I refused to go to him for help. I enlisted a tutor. He test you based on homework assignments. You can't go wrong if you do the work and are present.
Linear algebra is not a difficult class, but with Jackson it turned out to be terrible. Many useless homework assignments, and I usually couldn't follow what he was doing in class

Not even sure where to start with this guy. Horrible teacher overall, learned nothing from him. Only go to class if you need so kindle for a fire cause he hands out about 5-6 pages of prewritten notes a day. Best part is if he made an error on it 5 years ago, he still hasent fixed it.

prob and stats for engineers is already a boring subject, but this guy is just icing on the cake. really boring, and i got nothin out of lectures. Test are hard, usually only 2 or 3 A's,.. mainly B's and C's.he gives ridiculous amounts of handouts , and ridiculous writing assignments that he doesnt grade easy.

He is a very nice man. He loves what he teaches and is super smart. Only downfallis getting too excited and going off on tangents. If you've never had Calc, he might not be the easiest to understand at first but he offers mounds and mounds of extra help.

He knows what he's talking about, but can't communicate it to the students. He jumps around a lot and is a strict grader when it comes to tests. Gives small easy quizzes every day which adds up to easy points.

A very intelligent and really helpful teacher. He knows what he is talking about, may be a little too much. you need to be able to ask for help and teach a lot to yourself to do well. studying with others is a good way to study for his class. not the greatest communicator and i probably wouldnt take him again but he is not too bad.

he sucks...he can't teach and is always in his own world...he can't explain anything at all...he always has chalk on his face and waves his arms around like a mad man, so it is so hard to pay attention...do NOT take ANY of his classes...EVERRR....SAVE YOURSELVES!!!!

Gees, where do I start with this clown? This is the worst math class I've EVER had in my life. This class is first of all pointless. I would say over 80% of anything this guy talked about was a complete waste of time. I hope you're good at teaching yourself material, because you're gonna need to.
Better with numbers than people. Shouldnt be teaching
Can be a tough teacher, the key is to do all of the home work that is assigned, and ask him plenty of questions on things that you are un-sure of and you should be alright

If you want to pass this guy's class, you're gonna lose some sleep, he teaches from the book, plus he hands out a gang of handouts. If you suffer from insomina then this is the cure. Take with some one else, like wacker.

jackson is an incredibly smart guy. he definitely knows what he is talking about. however, he has trouble communicating sometimes with students. always available for help. tests look a lot like homework, so if you do the assignments, you should do well on tests. i would probably take him again.

He is not the worst teacher I've ever had. It is important to come to class everyday. ALWAYS do the homework. It is exactly like the test. Go to help sessions with other professors if you are confused. Don't go to him. I got an A with a little work.
Such a introverted Mathematician. Always feels that he is behind in his teaching by three weeks. He rushes everything and is very unapproachable.
Dr Jackson was one of those professors who you knew was incredibly smart, but had a difficulty explaining material. I really enjoyed his class, eventhough it was a bit hard.
Sometimes difficult to learn from... Often I would find myself relying on other sources... First semester was a little rough, but I did enjoy the second semester very much.

If at all possible, do not take Jackson for Calc 3! He rambles during lecture, is very difficult to follow and gives about five different ways to do each example. Tests are graded very harshly, and he simply does not explain the material well.

He's a little hard to follow, but if you keep up with the HW, it compensates for that. I thought he did a fair job for Calc 1, but an excellent job for Calc 2. He's also always willing to help outside of class.

Nice guy but spends most of his time reminiscing about the old classes he taught. I am pretty good with math and got a C. Tests are extremely hard and you can only use a calculator on the last couple of problems.

Taking calc with this professor is not something that I would recommend, even to my worst enemy! I would consider myself decent at calc, and I will be lucky if I can manage a B-. Consider yourself warned.
I have no words to say how crappy this class is. Do not take!!!!!!!!

The only reason I got a decent grade is that I had calculus in high school. Teaches a lot of stuff you don't need to know and isn't good at it. Daily quizzes are easy but tests are unpredictable. Not a good teacher.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Margaret Stock

reviews.comment: Love Mrs. Stock! The class was a breeze. Yes, she does talk about a lot of random things but it's worth it. You have 3 tests (one is dropped), 3 easy group projects, 4 easy quizzes, and easy online homework. She is practically giving you an A. The grading scale is lowered, too. She is very willing to help try to explain things to people. TAKE HER
This Professor is very nice, but not someone I would recommend. She goes off on rants about her family more then teaching the subject.

Mrs. Stock is very laid back. There are three exams and one final. However, she drops the lowest exam. She gives quizzes once in a while, but you always know ahead of time. There are three group projects. She gives random attendance points, so I would attend class. Overall, very easy A.

Stats 110 is awful with Mrs. Stock. She's a lovely lady but she's scatterbrained and has no original ideas about the class. The lectures are straight from the publisher and her examples are all either smoking, cancer, or animal gestation. It's easy, sure, but it's a painful semester.
She was one of the easiest professors I've had. She talks about her kids the whole class. If all you do is the homework quizzes online you will pass. Her tests are easy and she is super nice.

Very nice woman! This class is an easy A. Attendance is part of the grade so you have to go but she talks about her kids the whole class so its not that bad. Tests and quizzes are very straight forward.
reviews.attendance: is part of the grade so you have to go but she talks about her kids the whole class so its not that bad

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Aileen Murphy

reviews.comment: Honestly, only take her if you're really confident in your math abilities. Her notes are straight out of the textbook which normally would be okay but the textbook is HORRIBLE. Exams were difficult and she doesn't return tests back in time. Luckily there are other assignments besides tests to bring your grade up.

Doesn't help at all when it comes to asking for extra help. She never gave back the first test of the semester. She didn't have midterm grades up until a week and a half after the deadline. She can't teach for her life. She makes things very confusing. Overall, she is an awful teacher. Try to avoid her at all costs.

Some of the other raters seem to be a little harsh. It is a difficult course, yes, but she is there to help if you take the time to actually go to office hours and give it the time a four credit hour course deserves. She's actually a really good teacher, all things considered.

Please avoid this professor. I had her last year and she was horrible at teaching the class. She has a monotone voice. And her exams were harder than the study guide and some of the stuff you would study would not even be on the exam.I received a bad grade in this class and ended up taking it over the summer with a different professor and got a A-

Worst class I have taken at SLU. She was highly unclear on all subjects. She rarely responds to emails, graded work has no feedback, and good luck finding out your grade. You are better off taking any other math class. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. You will regret taking this class. No matter how "easy" people say it is, she is no teacher.
The class is straight forward and when you need help she is able to meet up for help or email you. You dont really need the book because all the homework is online.

Judging from the comments, Prof. Murphy has improved slightly. I really like the group quizzes. If you do the study guide she gives you for tests, you should do well. Do the homework so you feel comfortable with questions she throws at you on the test.

Tests are tough, but I didn't really study for them, so I guess it's to be expected. She pushes you, but will help if you go to office hours. Wants you to know how to use the material, not just do the examples in class.
Horrible teacher and class
I am taking her 132 math class now. She doesn't know how to teach math.

The worst math teacher ever, the way she teaches extremely unclear. And simply I don't like the way she speaks english. For international student, avoid her class, I used to be good at math, but she made everything very confused for me.

Avoid taking Aileen Murphy at all cost, she is the absolute worst teacher I have ever had. She has no idea how to teach math, her tests are extremely difficult, and she is horrible to work with. Please save your sanity and avoid her if possible. If you must take her, good luck.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! She is horrible! I have never struggled so much in my life. I am proficient in math and have taken several classes but there is no way you would be able to tell looking at my grade. Regardless of how much I study for the tests I cannot do well. Save yourself and your GPA. Find another professor.
Her exams are extremely hard. It is best if you go to all the classes. Meet with her on an individual basis and that will help you a lot. Online hw could be answered off the examples given.

Worst math teacher I have ever had. Attendance is mandatory, she is not very helpful and makes you feel stupid when you don't know what's going on. Lectures are extremely boring. Textbook is necessary. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!

If you have other options, avoid Aileen Murphy. I had to teach myself basically all the material through mymathlab. She would give the easy examples and then on tests she would put hard equations that we had never talked about or gone over. She is definitely a hard grader--she would take off points for just about anything. I do not recommend her.

Murphy is there to help you. She'll sit and talk if you approach her. Webwork is hell, but it's hell with every teacher. Her tests aren't impossible if you study. I got an A in the class and I studied an hour a week tops. Group quizzes every Friday but they're not bad. In class she's not really clear, but ask her aside and she'll help out a ton.

She can be helpful if you talk to her on an individual basis; however, the class overall is pretty rough. I received a 4.0 throughout my college career and I think her class will be my first B if not a C. Tests are really tough, and I have had to pull several all-nighters to get me through some of them. It's a pretty rough experience

Ask for online test reviews, they help a ton. Reading quizzes are pretty simple and group quizzes are an awesome boost. Exams are tough, but not impossible. I took college algebra before this class and it helped out a lot. A lot of questions on exams are homework questions backwards. Be nice and ask questions and you should be okay.

In AP Calc-I&II, I got one of the only As. This class only covers Calc I, so I should have been over-prepared. But it was very difficult-practice exams/homework were nothing like the actual exams. I asked a math maj. (in Calc III at UofI-Urb.) for help-she was shocked that we had to do something so difficult in Calc I. Other profs. are much easier.

SWITCH. Do not take her class if she is supposed to be your teacher! I had almost 100% all year in my high school calc class and i dont understand a single thing she is talking about! Don't do this to yourself! Worst teacher i think i've ever had!
bad bad bad...writes problems on the board and then confuses you when you ask a question
WORST TEACHER EVER. Don't do it to yourself.

I took high school calculus, and I pulled off a B, but with difficulty. The book is horrible and the webwork homework takes forever and isn't even like the test. Group homework and quizes are nice though. Test suck!

The book for this class is completely useless with horrible examples. I came in here already taking Calc 1 in high school, and I thought it was hard. It's nice because she has a lot of points for other things-group quizzes, group homework. Test were really difficult! webwork homework, sucks! overall, difficult but not impossible

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Hisako Matsuo

reviews.comment: Amazing teacher!!!

Very easy class because she wants everyone to get an A. She will help you with anything, including another teacher who you don't think is being fair (she helped some other kids in my class with another teacher). Always do the extra credit, its easy. Tests and final are open notes/book.
The nicest lady you will ever meet. You don't get much homework and she explains everything very clearly. Definitely recommend the class.
Amazing teacher - easy A! She gives barely any homework. I learned a lot. I highly recommend taking this professor!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Lynne Nisbet

reviews.comment: Professor Nisbet is very sweet & helpful. She is always available for office hours & willing to work with you until you thourougly understand the material. Needless to say, though, the material is really hard if you have no trig background (I had her for Pre Calc). Also, her exams are unbelievably long & many students don't finish them entirely.

Don't let these reviews fool you. Nisbet has a reputation of being a bad professor around slu. webwork is harder than the book work. book work isn't graded. she teaches like she's in a rush, and isn't clear when you ask questions. Test are too long, and she gives quizzes right after teaching the material. AVOID HER. i withdrew.

Don't recommend to take her. I have her for Precalc. She needs to explain new material as our textbook is unhelpful, but all what she does is giving us worksheets for group work. She gave a quiz on a new material right by the end of a lecture. She grabbed my test 6 min. before end of the class and didn't let me to finish a few things. She is mean.
Great teacher... A lot of online problems which helped out your grade. 3 test and a final with homework grade and quiz grades make up your final grade... All-around pretty simple class

Mrs. Nisbet is an excellent teacher. I have a very hard time understanding algebra and she goes through it step by step when you need her to. Very willing to help when you need it. I highly recommend taking her class. You wont be sorry.

I walked into the class with low expectations of my success, however, Mrs. Nisbet was an excellent teacher. Always willing to help with problems and questions, if not in office hours, before or after class time, since there wasn't another class coming into the room for a while. Her advice in class and office hours, etc, was very clear.
Overall good teacher. Very nice person and is willing to help. I enjoyed watching her write on the board. Has some outfits that really accentuate her figure. Lovely.

I took her for PreCal. She is a very good teacher and willing to help. As long as you do your homework it is hard to fail the class. Webworks is done for homework and there is normally a quiz each week. Lowest quiz score is dropped.As long as you pay attention you should be okay. Very through at teaching and makes sure you understand.

Mrs. Nisbet is a WONDERFUL teacher! She is extremely helpful, and she will go out of her way to help each and every student. She's very sweet, and her class is straight forward. She will give you so much help all you have to do is ask. Pre-clac is hard, but she explains it very well! TAKE THIS TEACHER! SHES EXCELLENT!

I really enjoyed her class. Having taken Precal my senior year high school, it was still pretty fresh in my mind. She explains things well. Good grader, tries to give you as much points as possible. The only thing I didn't like is that she is a fan of calling on people who don't have hands raised. Takes attendance, but doesn't give grade for it.

She really is helpful with available office hours. If you need it she does encourage. Teaches straight forward, and explains until you understand. There are quizzes and homework assignments online, if they still do that. Exams are reflection of quizzes but more challenging. I would totally recommend her!

She is really really helpful. She's open for office hours which what really helped me. I didnt do that hot, but did better than what i started with. There are quizzes and homework assignments, if she still does the online. Take her shes GREAT! Takes time to help you understand so you can do better on the exams!! And if you need it..she encourages :

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Jesse Prince-Lubawy

reviews.comment: Awesome teacher, doesn't take himself too seriously, and his Tests and quizzes are very straightforward. Easy A if you're decent at math. Would recommend.
Amazing, laid-back teacher. Provides bunches of extra credit that will pad your grade. Weekly quizzes that are very simple and 3 exams. Highly recommend, easy A.

Really cool teacher. Assigned weekly homework and quizzes but were not difficult if you kept up. Tests are not bad. If I ever have to take a math course again I would try my hardest to get him. I would highly recommend him to anyone. Even people who don't like math (like me)

Jesse was pretty cool and laid back. Assigned homework and weekly take home quizzes along with weekly quizzes in class. If the material was understood all the above was pretty easy and he's very willing to go over all the material. I would take him again and recommend him.

Really nice guy, always had an easy-going aura about him. Homework load not overbearing (problems from the book and take-home quizzes), weekly in-class quizzes not bad (most were in groups). Pretty helpful if you go to his office hours for help. Definitely recommend him!
Very laid back but is very clear in explaining concepts. His class is very easy and well put. I would recommend this teacher.
Very laid back and relaxed. He explains through each topic and concept thoroughly. Always willing to help outside of the class room and has cheezy jokes. I would definitely take him again.
Nice, laid-back guy. Made the class easy and understandable.

Jesse was a very interesting guy. A little boring. He made class attendance mandatory, for my class but next semester he made it option.There were comprehension quizzes every friday which were pretty easy points if you understood the material. Overall not a bad teacher for freshmen.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Daniel Bossaller

reviews.comment: So nice and always makes time to meet with you if you need additional help.

I am not sure if he will be teaching next year but he is a graduate student who still makes constant mistakes with negative signs, multiplication, addition, and subtraction. He is a good teacher, but teaches very fast. He takes the difficult routes when solving a problem, it is frustrating.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Melanie McCabe

reviews.comment: Dr. McCabe is not a good teacher. She doesn't know the material and reads from the power point in class. She has only 2 tests, the midterm and the final and they are both really hard considering that nothing was taught throughout the year. There's a huge project that takes up a lot of time. Stats portal is difficult and a large portion of grades

Dr. McCabe is not a very good teacher. She was not clear about any information and she was more confusing. Be prepared for a midterm and a final, she didn't tell us until the week before. The stats portal is hard and takes up a lot of your grade. If you can take another teacher, you should, you will have an easier more enjoyable time.

Absolutely the worst professor I've ever had. She's confusing and does not explain anything, just expects you to know it all by reading the textbook. Easy online chapter quizzes, easy. Online homework, really hard. Only 2 exams, really hard. And a stupid project. Very time consuming and difficult overall!
This class is awful. The absolute worst teacher I have ever had. She does not know how to teach at all
Can't teach. more or less Garbage all around. Save yourself and don't take this class. if this is the only teacher available. wait until the next semester and take a different teacher.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! very unprofessional. does not know how to talk to students. always uses stats lingo but does not teach it. expects you to just know how to do everything. very unclear in what expectations are. can be rude at times when trying to be helpful. avoid this class if possible!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! You have to teach yourself, she is always late and useless! Exams are extremely difficult and there is a huge project! You will be on ch 21 when other sections are still on ch 11! Very annoying that her goal is to finish the tb! Homework quizzes are easy, but online test grades will bring you down! AVOID AT ALL COST

I understood statistics before this class but now I am confused. She says one thing then realizes she said the wrong thing almost twice a class. McCabe is always late to class and does not seem professional. It is not unusual for her to be barefoot in class, eating, or wearing sweats. If you do not want to teach yourself stats,take another teacher.

Note: I am a great math student. This class was not too bad. The reason I gave her a lower rating for easiness is that for people who aren't good with math and excel (you need skills in both) this class can be very difficult. Class is based a lot homework (every class), chapter tests (once a week or so), a midterm, a final, and a research project.
Dr. McCabe is great. She is extremely lenient on homework and often gives points back on tests. I highly recommend her if you have to take stats.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Lucas Sabalka

reviews.comment: Class is VERY difficult. You will spend the whole class taking notes with very few examples. The majority of his examples are proofs which are not anything like the homework and test questions. Webwork and test questions are completely unrelated as well. Do not take unless you are very very comfortable with calculus.

This was a really hard class, but I think most of the problem was the material. Calc 1 is hard in general. The quizzes and exams were just like the homework problems, so take the time to understand those and you should be fine.

He is a great guy, he is nice and encourages questions. go to his office hours and he will help you even more. Go to as many classes as you can because it would be hard to learn it if u missed class. do all your homework too. the tests are fair and pay attention in class and you should do fine

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Christine Stevens

reviews.comment: Took Professor Stevens for Calc 1, would definitely recommend her to anyway. She is very interested in the success of her students, and if you go to class and pay attention, you will do well. Tests and quizzes mimic the homework.

Extremely easy class and a very nice professor. If you took AP Calculus in high school and you did well then this class is a guaranteed A. She gives out reviews before every exam and the exams are basically the review with different numbers. I only did the review to study for exams and never got below a 95% on an exam.

Dr. Stevens is a fantastic professor in every way. One of the most generous people I've ever met. She goes beyond the call of duty for her students. However, you're expected to do your part, too. You have to do a significant amount of work. Grading is hard, and there are not very many points in the pool, so little mistakes can add up.

Likes in class involvement but not know it alls who don't know it all. She will rip the piss out of you if you're that kind of person. Besides that, the hardest part are the take home homework assignments. Her tests are definitely easier that they could be.
BEST MATH TEACHER I HAVE EVER TAKEN!!!! IF SHE SEES YOU MAKE AN EFFORT SHE WILL NOT LET U SUFFER. HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!

Dr. Stevens is the nicest woman alive. She's also the clearest lecturers ever -- and that's in a graduate class, where lots of of otherwise "good" teachers tank. Her homeworks are doable, and she's very helpful, both in class and in her office. She's really dedicated to her profession and her students.

Mrs. Stevens is very nice and funny. She wastes class by writing definitions on the board, so you have to teach yourself the material to an extent. Study a little everyday and you should do well. She has four major tests and a bunch of little quizzes, but no pop quizzes. If you can learn well on your own you should be fine.

Not at all straightforward. Her notes are abstract, the book is unclear and her lectures don't make any sense. If you ask for help, she makes you feel like an idiot for making simple mistakes. I had to teach myself the entire class.

This is the first math class I've ever really liked. Excellent professor, explains material very well and doesn't make you feel stupid. Tests are very similar to homework problems, and there are a lot of easy homework points.
Tough subject, but she is a very good teacher. Loads of help in class. She's a very nice lady and the course, although tough, was enjoyable.

The material in the class requires a different way of thinking compared to other math courses. She does a good job at breaking the core ideas and her tests are pretty straight forward. She gives a lot of suggested problems that you don't have to turn in

Dr. Stevens is the best. If you don't understand somthing she'll explain IN CLASS what you need help with. Also, she is very helpful in her office as well. If you're taking any Calculus she is the best.
Very clear lectures. If you can, take calc I with this professor especially if you're intimidated by calc. Best math teacher I have ever had.
tags:
2003
Very clear lectures. If you can

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Rebecca Kalhorn

reviews.comment: Dr. Kalhorn is a hard teacher. Both her online homework assignments and tests are harder than most other professors. But she is very helpful if you ask her after class. All in all, if you are not good at math, DO NOT take her class.

When it comes to teaching algebra, she fails. He lectures are monotone and her teaching methods are useless. She hands out NO extra credit AT ALL. Her tests are so hard and are worth 75% of your final grade. She assigns a lot of homework yet it only counts as 10% of your grade. A little under 50% of my class received a D or an F. Don't take her.

Class wasn't that bad except for the online homework which seemed to icrease in amount as the semester went on. Could have used more examples, but I think the professor did a great job at expaining things. However you do have to do the hw to understand the material and be able to apply it to the exam. Would definitey take a class with her again!

Reads off a powerpoint that the text book made. no computers allowed so you have to write out a ridiculous amount of notes(and quickly). I learn more just reading the text at home than i do in class. tests are extremely difficult. i do not recommend taking her class at all unless you enjoy headaches and boredom.

Worst class I've ever taken. Homework is online and intended to be self taught. What she teaches after the homework is all theory and no examples. Completely useless for help. I had class during her office hours and all she told me was to see a tutor. I had to drop this class. 3 hours/night teaching myself stats was hurting my other classes.
terrible. too many notes and mean. i dont like her at all.

Teaches off of a powerpoint, stands there and lectures while everyone takes a ridiculous amount of notes. Doesn't really ever stop to see if everyone is on the same page with understanding the material, she just keeps going through the powerpoint.

HORRIBLE. This class is way too much work and way harder than all the other stats 110 classes. She is an awful teacher. Makes you copy down a ridiculous amount of notes. She "teaches" while you're furiously writing down notes so it's hard to actually pay attention to what she is saying. She is a horrible teacher. Do not take her class.
tough class but not too bad. just a lot of work. she's there if you have questions. make sure you know how to do everything and why

Unlike some math teachers, Dr Kalhorn understands that calc is difficult and she tries to teach it in a way that is clear and easy to follow. Both in class and in office hours she is friendly, patient and helpful. She never made me feel stupid for asking a question; she encourages questions in class. She truly wants to help students understand calc

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Megan M. Witt

reviews.comment: She is a very kind person but was not very good at teaching the material. If you are already good at math and have an understanding of the material on your own, you'll do fine. If not, the only way to get through her class is with outside help from the tutoring center, etc. Again, she's a really nice person but I did not learn well from her.
Best math teacher that I've had at SLU so far. Once you take notes and pay attention in class it's hard to earn less than a B and she's pretty hot too so it's a two-fer.
Very nice and understanding. Keep up with your homework and you'll do fine.

She is very nice and understanding! I had accidentally gotten lost on my first day and was incredibly late! She was so nice about it and told me about her first day in college. Her note packets are long but do them because they really do help!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Michael Bakale

reviews.comment: This man needs to be stopped! He's the worst teacher I've ever had, his final was INSANE. I actually lost math knowledge taking this class. Even though he curved the final grades and it turned out ok, avoid him like the plague

at the beginning of the semester he missed a lot of classes. then he started to come everyday and go over the time limit by five minutes. he seems to try to get everyone to understand but not many do. is willing to answer your questions if you make the time. very difficult to learn new information though. does not review much for the tests.

This guy is ridiculous. If you want to learn anything, don't take his class. He skips class and shows up late constantly. He is completely unprepared and does not cover material necessary for the tests.

completely wothless. skips class and goes on about worthless equations. very slow speaker and very very boring. never teaches what will be on the test and assigns multiple homework problems that are due the in the near future(1 or 2 classes). never notifes class if anything.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Timothy Delicath

reviews.comment: This was an online class and we had to submit a journal every week. He didn't give any feedback on the journal at all. He never gave you any feedback on anything, just sent emails on when things were do. The final was due the day after our final test had to be in. Yet, I dont' think our grades were submitted on time.
This professor is one of the best professors at the university.

This class is super easy - just show up! But I didn't learn anything at all, the only reason I think I passed the final was because I had stats in High School. Fortunately though the final is open book, opoen note. Delicath is a nice man though. He knows what he's talking about. And class is cancelled at least once a month.

Plain and Simple: Attend Class. He gives notes, problems, examples, and states clearly what is expected of you on tests and the final. He is a fun man, and the class is enjoyable even if you hate Stats. He's very straightforward and an A is very attainable.

Class was okay, it was hard. I suggest going to class because you will need to be their to understand the math/stats, problems. Teacher is nice and funny. Study the book, keep your notes togethor and you should do fine.
Worthless.
Very funny man and the class is fairly simple even for those of us who suck at math. Didn't have any problems. Recommended!

I had Inferential Statistics with this man. He's just a great professor, plain and simple. His class was a breeze. He was so funny! He actually did quite a nice job of making his class enjoyable to attend. His department would be found severely lacking without this genius of a mentor.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Charles Ford

reviews.comment: I had Dr. Ford for CS classes in the late 90s. He can be scatterbrained and is not good at explaining things. He is highly regimented with graded material. His homework, quizzes and tests are *VERY* hard but if you *MASTER* the homework you will rock the quizes and tests. If you have a knack for the material or find a good tutor you will do well.

Absolute nightmare! if you feel this is not enough, then do go ahead and take it. After you have failed in every one of his extremely difficult quizzes, which even he cannot answer sometimes, then you will understand.

NEVER TAKE THIS TECHER EVER!!!! He shows up late to class gives you 30 mins to do daily hw quizzes that makes no sense. He belches and farts throught out class no help at all.....avoid please...His test are so hard he dont even understand him and he will give different point for the same exact answer..

Do not take this guy. He didn't show up for one of our tests, he spends most of the class in the bathroom, belches every minute, yells at students when they can't figure things out, quiz every class over material from 3 classes ago, gives wrong info for what he says will be on the test, takes 5 tries to do a problem in class for him. DO NOT TAKE
Definitely avoid!He devoted most his life to theology rather than calculus.If you want to know more about Jesus, take it. Otherwise, avoid!
Extremly helpful! Incredibly nice man, St. Louis University is incredible fortunate to have Charles Ford amongst this faculty!

Coming into this class with a 5 in AP Calc BC, I've been able to keep a B average at best. Comes in late to class, slept in and MISSED one of his tests, and completely incomprehensible when doing examples. Makes too many mistakes in his work and spends the entire period probably doing half a problem. Expect difficulty even with prior knowledge.

I had this professor for 2 days and dropped his class. He gives 3 daily homework problems but doesnt go over the answers. He gives daily quizzes too so make sure you understand the hw. He cant explain anything well and spent the entire class going over a problem only to get the wrong answer and be told it's wrong by the students. It's not worth it.
Absolutely terrible. He teaches nothing, only mumbles and quizzes

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! Everything that everyone has posted is completely true and unexaggerated! I didn't think this site gives legitimate feedback, but it does! I took Calc 2 in high school, got an A and then had to take this old dirt bag. He is about to fall over he is so old. He belches in the middle of class, is very intelligent, but does no

CAN ACE THIS CLASS EASILY... HERE'S HOW. He gives 3 hw problems daily. Wait 2 class periods and do them right before class because they will be the exact thing as that mornings quiz. Once you do good on all the quizes, you just study those for the 3 exams and you are golden.

This professor needs to be reevaluated by the university. the man is extremely intelligent but cant explain things if his life depended on it.He expects you to know calc already and doesn't answer questions or follow any guidelines. This guy is maybe 80-85 years old and maybe needs to consider retirement. Avoid at all costs!!!!!! Don't kill ur GPA

This man is obsessed with word problems and algebra, hence why he's an algebraist (apparently that exists). Once you decipher his problems, you can begin the arduous amounts of algebra to get the answer. His problems look impossible to someone who didn't study algebra their whole life but he makes them look easy and doesn't sufficiently explain.

DO NOT TAKE HIM!!! He is not helpful, assumes you already understand calculus and always wants to prove long, difficult theorems which are unnecessary to learn calculus. I am behind in my classes now because I was not allowed to switch out of his class. I talked to Fr. May, Department Chair and he thinks that Ford is an excellent teacher :(

Not helpful during class, or out of it. Dr.Ford rambles and gets lost in his own problems that he is trying to explain. Not in his office on a normal basis, and has a tendency to be late for class. He gives a word problem quiz EVERY SINGLE CLASS. i have taken calc in high school and got a 3 on the AP test and still had trouble in this class.

I had Ford as my prof for Intro to Comp Sci. I later withdrew from the class and switched sections thanks to the grace of God. He is so incomprehensible and unclear it's not even funny. He walked into class the first day and began spouting off material like we had a clue what was going on. He sucks at answering questions. Avoid at all cost!!!!
His PhD says he was smart, key word being WAS. He's over the hill, his brain just isn't working. Show up to class every day because there will be a quiz. Seriously, every day there is a quiz.

reviews.comment: Ford is tough, but if you keep up on homework, it's not too bad. He is always willing to help, and if you are going on in math classes, I highly recommend him.
