reviews.comment: HORRIBLE!!! smells bad, has no idea what the book is about! its more english and theology than math! all word problems.
This guy sucks!! he expects you to already know calculus! doesn't teach the basics..i taught myself everything!!!!1
Worst teacher ever!!! Teaches the most random things. Never take this guy. More than half the class dropped it.

Don't take this class if you want an easy ride. But if you want to learn calculus this is a good class. Ford knows the subject well and while sometimes it is hard to understand he goes slow enough that it becomes easy to follow. I never had calculus before and I learned a lot in this class. He is a good teacher and I would recommend him to anyone.
This man is satan. Not only the worst math class I have ever taken, but the worst class ever. I mean ever. Anyone is better than him.

First off, his breath smells of hotdogs and stale coffee.He is the worst math teacher I have ever had.His tests are really hard, only consisting of word problems. He doesn't teach anything, you'll sit in the class for an hour and look back and wonder why you wasted your time. I got a 3 on the AP exam in H.S. and still have no clue what hes saying
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Meh. Definitely one of the stranger teachers I have had. The way he teaches is hard to grasp. Daily quizzes made me sad. Tests are pretty straight forward, though. I came in with High School Calculus under my belt and it was STILL difficult. Every problem you do will be a word problem. There are definitely easier teachers out there.
No Comments

He is aweful in explaining the material in class, and out of class for that matter. Be prepared to spend hours outside of class agonizing over the information, and calling all your classmates trying to find answers. His tests only have a few questions, so if you miss one or two, you are already in trouble. TRY TO AVOID THIS GUY AT ALL COSTS.
Simply DO NOT TAKE IT away or another , very hard teacher
Nice guy, but not a very good teacher. He knows the stuff pretty well but can't explain clearly.
Stay away if you can,very unclear in teaching,does not know the stuff himself. If you go ask him for help , he will ask 100 questions back at you :(. Terrible teacher!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is one of the most difficult classes I have had. The tests were very difficult. They were basically about who could write code the fastest. Tough format for a beginners course. Do not take this guy if you have a tough schedule already, it will be too much for you.

I took his pre-calc and chose him again for calc 1. He tends to ramble, but go to class for the daily quizes. He gives some extra credit and has a healthy grading curve. You won't learn much in class, so be prepared to work on your own. I spent 5-8 hours a week studying and came out with an "A".

I had a very hard time in his class, considering I never took Pre-Calc. Gives you a quiz every day and his tests are only 5 questions each worth 20 points. If you take his class get ready to study at least 3-4 hours a day!
STAY AWAY!!!

Man, he doesn't help you at all. When you ask him a question, he will ask back ten other questions that has nothing to do with your original question. It was hell in his class. His tests are very hard and the clues he gives to help your homework is so hard to understand. I suggest not to take him.
ditto, Nice, personable guy, but can't teach for crap. If you're a calc. virgin or if math is not your strong point, STAY AWAY. If you can easily teach yourself, have no fear.

An extremely nice guy, but an absolutely horrible teacher. Just doesn't know how to explain things well. Doesn't teach the homework until after you are supposed to have done it. Nice guy, atrocious teacher.

HA! This guy is a joke! He wears the EXACT same outfit every single day. He also reaks of garlic! Does not teach. Gets through 1/2 a problem/class. Short quiz every class period. I would never recommend him to anybody. Avoid at all costs!!!
terrible, loves the 5 question test. needs a psych evaulaution. wears same clothes everyday, maybe can complete 1 problem in 50 min class period. does not teach. eccentric and terrible.

I had him for Pre-Calc, and he's the worst teacher I've had so far. His lectures are very unclear, so unless you can teach yourself, avoid him. Tests are okay; they consist of 5 questions worth 20 points each. He gives out a review sheet before the test.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Adam Allan

reviews.comment: Very easy class. Taught myself all material and got an A. There's no reason you shouldn't get 100% on all homework..you get 5 chances to get right answer for each question online. Also he gives out pretests and they're the same thing as test, just different numbers. If you do good on all homework, and memorize concepts on pretests, you'll do fine.

Worst teacher I've had so far. Not personable, very dry and boring. If you ask him a question he is very condescending. He basically stands at the board and solves the problems without explaining anything he's doing. Don't buy the book/answers manual...I haven't touched mine yet. Everything is online.
Really easy but hard to understand in class. Flys through lectures. Do online homework and pre-tests and you should get an easy A.
Adam is not very personable, nor will he explain the logic of his math unless you ask. However, online homework and practice tests just like the real one make his class very easy.

Survey of Calculus: The class is overall easy. There are 4 exams, 1 quiz, and MyMathLab hw assignments. His lectures are a bit hard to understand and is not too helpful at explaining something again. He gives out pretests before the exam. If you can do those then the tests are very easy. Overall fast lectures and difficult hw but easy tests.

His class is extremely difficult to follow due to his lack of explanation. He will not get to know you what so ever. I will say he is good about getting you practice tests and made his test passable with an A.

Adam is actually a doctor, which is evident. He is not very personable with students. He won't explain the logic of the math unless you ask, but online homework and practice tests make his course easy.

he seems to be new here, appears like a graduate. He has a smart n efficient brain which cause him t write n teach very very time-saved so that most of us r just stupidly copying notes throughout the whole class. Tests r not difficult if u got exercised by HW.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Jeffrey Breeding-Allison

reviews.comment: Incredibly intelligent professor. Sometimes he has trouble communicating the ideas because he doesn't understand how people don't understand something. LOVES exploding chalk and corny jokes. overall, I enjoyed the class and found it to be very useful.

Great Teacher for Calc II. His homework is very challenging but is reasonable if done with a group. His tests are also reasonable if you correctly do the homework and go to class on a regular basis. His teaching style may seem dull in the beginning but you get used to it and start to enjoy his weird humor with math.

Not bad. Tries to joke around while still moving at a fast pace in class. In calc 1, homework was impossible but I guess he learned from his reviews cause now it's much easier. Possible to get an A but you have to work for it. He can grade harshly but if you think he skeeted you, talk to him with a good argument and he'll often give points back

Had Dr. Breeding for calc I one and agree with everyone else. But I also have him for calc II. It is very different than calc I. He has a day set aside for homework help and it is much slower paced. I actually enjoy going to classes now. His lecture style takes some getting used to, but the class is good other than that.

Overall he was a good teacher. He loves math and is greatly impressed by kids with an interest in math. All the homework is on paper which is way better than online. It is hard, but it's math... The tests were much easier than the homework and the extra credit on the tests helped a lot. If you can stay awake in class, then he's a good teacher.

He is very good at keeping moving in lecture. His homework is all paper work and quite difficult. He does offer EC on all tests and if you don't miss more than 5 classes. He goes over commonly missed test and homework problems. We only use the book for homework problems.

Terrible teacher. Class is near impossible unless you have had prior classes in calculus. HW is a grade killer. Tests are just like practice tests. Incredibly boring guy. Avoid at all costs. He destroyed all interest I had in math.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Wah-Kwan KU

reviews.comment: Really thick accent, speaks very softly, and his notes are very faint on the board. He teaches through examples. He doesn't take attendence but will have random graded group assignments and a quiz every week, they're normally pretty easy. His hw is through webwork, a lot of it is extrememly difficult-but his tests are more based off of his notes.
Really nice guy, exams are easier than the homework everyone can pass it!!
He's a very nice professor, if you want to him, he'll explain everything for you in a very clear way!!

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Katherine Taylor Paullin

reviews.comment: She is so nice. Totally helpful, makes sure everyone understands. Gives tons of bonus opportunities. You ONLY need the online book because ALL the homework is due there. Gives clear study guides like the test. The final is her old tests NO CHANGES. She is so awesome, definitely take her. Easy math credit esp if you already took calc in high school.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Stephanie Thomas

reviews.comment: Stephanie is the best math teacher I have ever had. She was always available during her office hours, and would go to great lengths to ensure understanding of the material. She is one of the few teachers I've had that actually cares about her students. Chili pepper. :]
Best teacher to get for math class, very clear on all her lesson, tests are easy, very helpful, and is so nice. Wish she can teach higher math classes!
tags: very clear on all her lesson

reviews.comment: If you are not very good at math, she is a really awesome teacher. Everything is thorough and she is really nice. If you are good at math, then class is not mandatory. Spent money on a book and only used it once.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Mari Wantanabe

reviews.comment: If I hadn't taken AP Stats in high school, I would have failed this class. She is very confusing and never seems to make sense. Her tests are formatted very confusingly; you never seem to know what exactly she is asking. The class average is always less than a C. My class dropped from 23 people to 10 people because she was failing them.

This was one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. The tests make absolutely no sense, you have random pop quizzes in class and professor wanatabe is very unclear. I know it sounds crazy but its better to take an 8 am then to take her! I'm sure all other stats teachers are better!

This was by far the worst class I have ever taken. The material was not difficult but professor Wanatabe is extremely difficult to understand. She is very intelligent but a terrible teacher and the tests are extremely hard. I usually do well in all of my classes, but I truly had trouble with this class. If possible take another professor!

She is not very good at explaining things. If you want a good grade, don't take her class. She showed us on the first day the grades she administered from the semester before, when she gave out one A, an average of C's, and a handful of F's. She lets you take a paper with anything into tests, but even if you understand the material you won't do wel

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: John Cantwell

reviews.comment: Point Blank-> He can not teach, but the class is not hard. If you teach yourself you will be fine.

Not that great explaining things but gets the job done. Tests are just like homework. Make sure you do every problem of the homework and understand how to do each one. Final is a little more difficult but do-able. Good teacher overall.

This was my second semester with Dr. Cantwell. I find that he extremely helpful and his tests are very fair. The tests are essentially the homework, so if you do the homework and ask questions about it in class, it's not bad at all.
not a good teacher at all. is not clear in class. flies quickly through examples while making many errors on the board. too old to be teaching. grades his exams unfairly. avoid this guy at all costs.

He does not explain things very well, however, if you spend the time doing the homework, then the tests are fairly easy. The final is much harder than the tests, and he does not take homework grades, so you need to be a good test taker to do well in the class
tags: if you spend the time doing the homework
and he does not take homework grades

reviews.comment: The only grades are 4 tests an a final that counts as 2 tests. The tests are straightforward if you do the homework.
doesn't explain material very clearly, very disorganized!Not recommend!

Basically do the homework problems. The four tests he gives are just HW problems. The final, however, will consist of the problems the majority of the class missed on their tests. So study the hardest problems from each test b/c that's what your final will be. He's not a bad guy just way too old to be teaching. Class is always at 8AM so yeah....

Dr. Cantwell is way past his prime. During class, the only time you need to pay attention is to correct his mistakes. The rest of the time, he simply scribbles on the chalkboard. The book will serve to be more helpful. Avoid this teacher.

dr cantwell is really nice and if u go to his office hours he is really helpful but as far as class please dont do it.well we really didnt do nething but go over homewwork answers wich was not graded but it was up to u to do them and we only dide like 2 0r 3 examples of the the next lecture if u want to teach yourself this is the class for you

after attempting to pay attention the first two weeks, i realized how unimportant it was. altho he took attendance every day, i stopped showing up (the syllabus says nothing about repurcussions for not going). taught myself the rest of the course, was prolly for the best. most memorable part - he didnt know what ln(1) was, got out his calculator
A + B = C. Let C = learned course content, A = stuff on the final exam study guide. B was the stuff on the final exam.
Be prepared to teach yourself, as both Dr. Cantwell and the book are of minimal use.

Cantwell is a really nice guy, but way past his prime. He forgets what the problem is asking halfway through the problem. He is really helpful if you ask for help and his tests come right from the homework. Do go to class even though his lectures are boring. Overall, he's a bad lecturer and the book is bad, but if you put in the work it's not bad.
tags: he's a bad lecturer and the book is bad

reviews.comment: Mr. Cantwell is a nice guy, but he needs to retire. He has no clue where the students are in the book, he gets lost while giving examples, and never goes over homework. If you like teaching yourself, Cantwell is the man for you.

Your entire grade is just tests, and most of the material is review of Linear Algebra (if you've had it) or Calc III. I never went to class much, but from what I heard from others, he was a pretty bad teacher. He gives out homework in class, the tests are exactly like the homework, and I just taught myself with the book before all the tests.
tags: the tests are exactly like the homework

reviews.comment: Dr. Cantwell is a really nice guy! His tests are generally straight from the homework, or very similar to it. He is not the best at teaching Calc 2, but if you have a strong math background you will do great! Super nice guy!
He is a horrible teacher for Calc II....Do NOT TAKE HIM
Very nice man..a little confusing when he is lecturing, but if you are confused, go to him during his office hours he really explains well!
he is bad.
Awesome teacher! Made class as fun as it could be... and puts out some easy tests... If you do your homework... Ace in the hole
class is really boring

Decent Calc I teacher. VERY NICE MAN. GRADES REASONABLY. Does not overdo the tests. His lectures are kinda drawn out and become unfocused and sometimes unclear, but if you do some of the homework problems, you learn much more and basically make it ok.
Good teacher, clear can explain, if you are stupid you will be lost
nice guy, easy tests, but can't teach that well. you are best teaching yourself the material

Very easy. Tests are directly from homework problems. Clear and descriptive teaching method. Attendance is not mandatory and still can do very well on tests regardless if you are there or not. A great mathematics professor for Diff Eq.
reviews.attendance: is not mandatory and still can do very well on tests regardless if you are there or not

reviews.comment: I've always heard DifEq was hard, and I'm no math genius, but I never was lost, I always knew what was going on and he made it very clear what to expect.
tests are pretty easy, except he cannot teach the material and he is constantly making mistakes when attempting to teach or when working a problem
Tests are pretty easy but he can't teach worth crap

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Delano Wegener

reviews.comment: I hate math more than anyone and started this class off horrible(D on first test However after truly working hard and going to him and the tudor I got an A. He is helpful only if YOU approach HIM. Be specific with your help requests and he will help. More than fair grader and didn't play "favorites". Challenging, but worth it for the satisfaction!!

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME! he was by far THE worst teacher i have ever had in college. He did not teach a single thing the homework was about. he only gave you a link to his website and wrote definitions on the bored. his tests are ridiculous only about def. its like a vocab class that doesnt teach you how to use the words in sentences

The worst math teacher I've ever had. If you can, switch professors. He does not teach, he posts everything on a huge website that he expects you to know word for word. His handwriting is illelligible, thus so are his examples. very rude and blunt person. He plays favorites. Very strict grading. His expectations of students are very unrealistic.

This guy does not teach. He gives you a link to his website and basically you're on your own. Expect stupid pop quizzes about definitions even though its a math class. Nice guy but way pass his prime to be teaching.

Everyone thought he was hard. Trust me, these people did not study. If you go to class and take notes, you should do well. He takes problems straight from the examples he does in class. He does play favorites though. I hate math, but this class really helped me understand pre-calc. He's a nice guy, class is easy if you show up and study.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Mark Pedigo

reviews.comment: Mr. Pedigo was a really great teacher to take right when you get to SLU. He is really helpful, and makes the final right of the other tests you take. Really helpful

Favorite professor at SLU. Perhaps the nicest man I have ever come across (proctored a test for me a day early because I had an orgo test on the same day as the original calc test). Very easy grader as he curves pretty much every test. Still have to do some work (webwork isn't THAT easy), but still worth the easy A.

Awesome teacher. Likes the subject and explains it well. Homework is usually weekly webwork with an occasional written assignment. Assigns "projects" that are basically take home tests. 3 tests and a final. Lowest test grade replaced by final (if final grade is higher). Fair grader, understands that there's life outside calculus. Highly recommend.
Extremely nice teacher and easy class for Calculus 1. Tests are very straight forward and not hard at all. Web assignments as well. Final is pulled straight off of the tests.

Very nice teacher. Faire grader and gives a week to complete homework. Tests are not too hard if you study and pay attention in class. He sometimes gives tricky problems on tests, but he will give a curve to the class if it is needed.
Amazing teacher. He is really good at explaining things. Always willing to help. Weekly hw assignments, three tests and a final, drops the lowest test score....I would highly recommend.

Professor Pedigo is great...probably one of the nicest teachers at SLU. He is very willing to offer help to anyone that needs it. There are weekly homework assignments, but they're not difficult. Tests were rather easy too, as long as you knew what was going on. I would definitely Recommend.

Survey of Calc was pretty easy because he's an easy teacher. He doesn't take attendance, and he's good at explaining the concepts and is really patient. The tests aren't tricky, so as long as you understand what you've been doing in class you'll be fine.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Mari Watanabe

reviews.comment: I took this class to raise my math/science gpa, but it ruined it instead of helping it. take any other stats professors! professor watanabe is by far the hardest of the stats teachers.

I had the option between taking stats and calc and I chose stats. biggest mistake of my freshman year. and i think most of it had to do with professor watanabe. she means well but she is very hard. she only gave out 1 A. don't take this class if you want to do well!

professor watanabe is extremely hard and very difficult to understand. although she is very smart and wants you to learn, she just isn't a good teacher. stats should be an easy class, however i found it to be my most difficult one. take another professor if possible.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Katee Whitney

reviews.comment: I LOVE HER!She is a great teacher & one always knows exactly what is expected of them. She is also so willing to help you at any time.This was the last math class I would ever take in my life and I am so thankful that I had her. I am awful at math but she knows how to make her students succeed AND she gives extra credit. I ended up with a 98% :)

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Roxie Randolph

reviews.comment: Roxie is smokin' hot!
Extremely easy class. She basically teaches straight through the textbook but makes things understandable. I've gotten a 100% on all my tests. EASY

She doesn't use e-mail. It's obvious she's not passionate about what she teaches. Delivers material in the most basic form. Class corrected her a lot. Some homework, not a lot. Personally, I'm good at math so I had no problems in her class. Tests were pretty easy. Attendance taken everyday (some in-class assignments)
easy material, did not deliver well though.
Great teacher, great class. Not too passionate, but teaches really basic and to the point. Usually class ends early and not too much homework.
She was a good teacher sometimes but then other times the class had to correct her a lot and she would lose track of where she was quite often
Roxie is a bamf....she is amazing, you know that she is a tough cookie but she always looking stylish! Even though i got a D+ i will always love my ROX POX!

ROXIEE!!! PBF! i loved her. I'm not good at math at all, so her tests were a bit tricky but i never studied and passed. She explains things really well. She has this demeanor of "I'll kick you ass" as she looks down upon the room. She's super nice when you talk to her. Sweetheart!
super nice, but the class sucked. She got really tricky on the tests.
attendance required. occasional assignments graded for correct answers. tests are easy if attend class. i would recommend it if you don't need a real math class

Easy course. Homework is given once in awhile, but work is easy. A lot of group work. Quizzes are given, but they are not hard if you look over your notes. Very easygoing. If you do what is expected of you, you should do fine.
Great class if you're not into Math like me. Lots of home-wrk but in the end it helps you understand where you're going wrong. If you're willing to put the time into it, this is the class for you
I thought that she was pretty easy. Not very much homework and about six tests all semester. No quizzes. Pretty easy..but I hate math.
Her tests are not too hard if you study a little. She does give homework though but not too much. Homework is graded for correctness not for completion. Not bad for math.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: April Waugh

reviews.comment: Her last name is now Garrison. There are, quizzes every week (~13 weeks/quizzes) but only 10 count, 3 tests, no homework, no midterm and 1 final. I got a 78 on my first test. At the end of the semester, I had a 98% before the final. TONS of extra credit. if you fudge up you've got a chance to fix it. Pay attention and you'll do Fine.

Very nice, though it seems as if being her "teacher's pet" got you the best grade. And as we know, in college, THERE IS NO TIME TO PLAY THE ROLE OF TEACHER'S PET!!! She knew her material. You MUST be a fast learner becuase she talks EXTREMELY fast and covers a lot of material in a short amount of time. So proir knowledge is a MUST.

Amazing!! weekly quizzes one piece of cake if u do all the assignments (cuz they are from the assignments.) tons n tons of extra credit in fact I had a 109% in the class!!! tests r also super easy once u do the assignments. attendance mandatory take tons of notes actually write down everythin she puts on the board! v. helpful outside class too. hig
reviews.attendance: mandatory take tons of notes actually write down everythin she puts on the board

reviews.comment: Graded fairly easy but often made mistakes in class. If you don't know College Algebra before hand, this could be a harder course. Much better teacher one-on-one than in class and she will like you better! Go visit her! Very nice person

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Paul Koester

reviews.comment: Dr. Koester is an excellent teacher. I had him for Calc 1 and an A is pretty easy in his class as long as you do your homework and his review sheet. His tests aren't too difficult. I would recommend him, he's super nice!

Good professor and a super nice guy. Says that attendance is part of your grade but I think if you get As on the tests he doesnt put up a fuss about it which is nice. His tests are super straight forward - do the homework and youll do good on the tests which is great for a math professor. Would definitely recommend!!
reviews.attendance: is part of your grade but I think if you get As on the tests he doesnt put up a fuss about it which is nice

reviews.comment: Koester went at a normal pace (about a lesson a day) and the tests and homework was really straightforward. He does overcomplicate some example problems, but other than that, I would recommend him, especially if you're like me and did not take calc in high school.

Paul is a great guy. His notes are clear and help on the homework he assigns. Homework assignments are due every friday and are worth 20percent of your grade. Test are fairly easy, and this is coming from someone who has no interest in math. Would def. recommend him!
He is a very nice guy, but his teaching style is hard to understand. He goes very in depth for very simple problems. He wants to help his students but doesn't know how to reach them.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Doug Runge

reviews.comment: Doug is awesome. He's very laid back, patient, and helpful. He gave us his cell phone number incase we had any last minute questions before tests and such. Very nice and approachable-all around a great teacher.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Hongming Ding

reviews.comment: Dr. Ding is possibly the best teacher at SLU. I read with disdain all the negative reviews about him, most of which were probably written by buffoons stymied by his Chinese accent (which does not at all hinder his effective communication if one actually TRIES to listen). Dr. Ding is simply excellent.
Words cannot describe the experience of being in a mathematics course taught by Dr. Ding (a.k.a. Doctor Wizard).
Also known as Doctor Impossible, Professor Ding is a master of mathemagics and is one of the few remaining gentlemen/scholars of our time.
Dr. Ding is a super hero. His super powers include mathematics, a calculator, and his magic wand. His abilities include teleportation, time travel, and intensive tooth-brushing skills.
I love Dr. Ding.
Dr. Ding is my favorite professor of all time.
Dr. Ding is my hero.
Dr. Ding is a mathematical genius. He is the greatest teacher I've ever had.

Dr. Ding is an exciting and engaging professor who really brings the subject matter to life. He is an enthusiastic, helpful and kind mathematics instructor. Certainly the best mathematics teacher I have ever had.
Dr. Ding is an incredible professor. He is a mathematical wizard, and exercises his abilities every day for students who attend his class. It is an extraordinary experience.
Dr. Ding takes a serious interest in his students. It was refreshing as a freshman to have such a caring professor who knows his stuff incredibly well. Great teacher.
Very helpful and informative. A little difficult to understand at first, but very clear with the materials. Overall, an excellent professor.
Dr. Ding is a sorcerer. His native language is Mathematics. By the time you finish his class you will be fluent in this language.
Dr. Ding is incredible. By far the greatest teacher that I have ever taken. Taking his Calculus I class was the best decision I have made while at St. Louis University.

Prof Ding is a tough teacher and it is hard not to like his class for the first couple weeks. However, after couple weeks you can easily understand him and you will know what is going to be on the tests. If you do the homework, you will do well. His tests are exactly from the homework and notes in class so it is your fault if you don't do hw/notes

Worst professor ever. Couldn't understand him; even went in a few times after class for help. Useless. Pay attention to problems he does on the board before the test; you'll see them again. Plan for at least one problem from left field that you'll just have to wing. Get ahold of old tests if possible.
ding is impossible. explains everything well, and assigns tons of optional homework, but tests are way way way too hard. explains eveything well, but has no concept of what his students understand.
tags: and assigns tons of optional homework

reviews.comment: Dr. Ding is absolutely brilliant. Disregard the negative comments here (particularly the previous one--I too thought that he didn't know anyone's name since he never asked and doesn't pass out tests individually, but when I went in and asked to see my final, he found it in his files without even asking for my name).

Ding is a very nice man; he just really cannot teach. Homework isn't graded so it is really hard to make yourself do it, however, it is necessary. Student-teacher involvement is null as well. In a class of 20, he couldn't tell you one student's name. I would not recommend him by any means.

Avoid Him! If you take this class you are basically Shooting yourself in the Foot. He is impossible. Can't understand what he is saying. He hates to give partial credit so when he grades your test you better get it right if not sorry. I loved math. now i absolutly can't stand it . Do not take Do not take Do not Take! IT is for your own good really!

Avoid if you can. However, if you do happen to get stuck with him, pay close attention to the homework problems he puts on the board the day before the test... chances are the test questions are going to be the exact same with different numbers.
Hongming is hard to understand, a ridiculous grader, and shows no sense of responsibility for his students' success. This makes his class very difficult. AVOID HIM
Stay Away From This Guy!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Not approachable, not helpful, is not willing to work with students, inept at lecturing, and very difficult to understand. Avoid, but if you're stuck, get in good with another calc professor, tutor, or be a calc ace going into the class.
Not recommended!
Very difficult to understand. However, he writes everything on the board very clearly. If this class class is not required, don't bother.

Prof. Ding is a good teacher, but not personable. You will have little to no class participation. He really knows what he is telling you even though it comes straight from the book. Overall, I liked him and learned easily from him.
He teaches straight from the book and it is quite easy to get lost when he speaks.
avoid at all costs. very hard to understand but doesnt teach well anyway. plan to teach yourself.

hes very willing to help during office hours, but that doesn't outweigh the fact that he copies straight out of the book and wastes everyone's time. Likes to copy definitons paragraphs long onto the board-- not helpful. Spends more time on copying down whats in the book than on harder, example problems. Slept through many a class for this reason...

He's a VERY nice teacher. His English is perfectly fine; in fact, it makes class pretty funny (funny pronunciations but they are totally understandable). Really fair teacher and he's more than willing to help. His lectures are straight from the book, but so are a lot of teachers'. Advice: do the homework sometimes he puts exact problems on the test

He goes right from the book... liturally, except for a few parts of his tests. While he is an interesting character (oversized nike's, dress pants pulled up high, big smile) I don't think he should teach. I am sorry but I could not understand the guy. The only reason I went to class was attendance factoring into my grade. If
No Comments

My favorite teacher! Class is really fun. I learned a lot from him. He is extremely smart and really knows the material. Takes a few days to get used to him, but once you do the class is not bad at all. I plan on taking Calculus from him next semester! :)

He always has a smile.It is not attractive,but at least he never yells at you.He doesn't tell you what is on the test,but they are right from the homework.He makes class very interesting by pronouncing words funny..model instead of mode.I got used to his strong accent.
TERRIBLE!!!

i had him for calculus coming off of 2 years in high school. i thought teh material was easy, but i could not understand a word he was saying. he did have good handwriting and wrote everything on the board. tests were just stupidly hard

This is the worst class I've taken in my life. Thanks to this man, my GPA will forever be ruined. His tests are RIDICULOUS. He will point you out in class if you've done poorly. I had one of the highest grades on the first and second tests. His final exam brought me down TWO whole letter grades.

Just plain horrible teacher. He doesn't speak clear english and can not help the students. His jokes are about students doing bad. He will add things to the test that were not reviewed. Overall reading the textbook is alot better, you will not learn anything from him.

He is really smart, but he has to write down everything because of the language barrier. tests are pretty simple- right from the homework. not too hard to understand-a few words are difficult. entertaining class because of the things he does

Dr. Ding is VERY hard to understand, due to his heavy accent. It's also hard for him to answer your questions because he can't understand you. It's so tempting to skip class, but he takes attendance and it counts off your grade if you don't show.
reviews.attendance: and it counts off your grade if you don

reviews.comment: Total jerk. Nearly impossible to understand because he can't hardly speak english, and his buck teeth also cause a horrible lisp. He makes jokes all the time and thinks students are laughing with him when they're laughing at him. Very unhelpful.
Impossible to understand as he can hardly speak english. Difficult tests. Not very willing to help students with problems.
EXTREMELY hard to understand, due to his heavy accent. If this class isn't required for your major, don't even bother taking it. It's that boring.
I love Dr. Ding. He has a great sense of humor. The course was challenging, though, and I had to work hard. I felt as though I learned a lot.

EXTREMELY hard to understand. I had to go to math tutors frequently to understand the concepts.Some of his test questions usually come number for number off of the practice problems you do for review before the test.
Doesn't speak english well at all, hard to understand. its hard for him to help you b/c he doesn't understand what you're saying. pretty tough class, don't take if you don't have to.

Dr. Ding is requires his students to have a more than just memorization of the problems for his tests. He will help you at any and all tests, but if you dont want to know Math and only care about gpa dont take. I found myself learning a lot, but tough.
Won't Help. Doesn't speak English. Total Jerk.

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Alexis Forman

reviews.comment: If you are conscientious, and not obnoxious, you have a shot at doing well in her course. I only comment here cause everyone else seems to be ripping her. She isnt great, but she also has a bad job teaching all of us...not sure if she still teaches at slu, but I would still recommend the early/int alg courses...if you cant handle her then give up.

This woman was completely ridiculous! She gave me a bad grade on the final because I forgot to turn in the take home test BEFORE i touched the final packet. As soon as I was about to sit down I remembered she needed my paper, and she was a complete jerk by not letting me turn it in because it was against her made up rules. UGLY, GRADE HARD, STUPID!

She is a funny lady, she gives A LOT of extra credit and if you go to her office hours she willl help you. She grades hard on assignments though! She gives take home tests that are really realy hard too! If you come to class everyday you should be fine though miss more than 2 and u will be SORRY even though she says attendance is not mandatory

Wow Ms Forman was the worst teacher i have ever encountered. not only was she not helpful but her tests were unbeliebably unfair..pay attention to her whacked gradin scale..be prepared for a real witch. notice how she favors girls too....

Teaches class very well and makes it a good refresher for College Algebra. Do all homework, and you'll be fine, class starts of kind of easy and makes you feel a bit ditsy but dont be fooled, skip to many classes and pay too little attention and you'll be failing like Calc. Good class overall.
She made the material very easy to understand. And has great take home tests.

All class she puts examples on the board and we go over them like were back in grade school. Sometimes I do not understand why she takes off certain points on anything we hand in. We race through chapters sometimes we get through 3 sections in one class. DO NOT BUY BOOK you don't use it at all! She gives a paper for math!
No Comments

She is not a very clear teacher. She doesn't make the material harder than it is, but she definitely doesn't make it any easier. Basically she puts examples on the board and you end up disecting them to figure out how to do them. She is good if you are looking to skip and get through on your own
No Comments
The tests are nothing like the homework. She also gives a paper on top of a final.
She makes errors on tests and is not very approachable. She teaches to fast and its hard to keep up with her. The textbook was not helpful either

school: Search professors at Saint Louis University | Rate My
name: Sharlene Allen

reviews.comment: She was very nice and understanding as long as you emailed her. She wasn't always the best at getting back to emails in a timely manner. But because of that she was more lenient. She asks you throughout the semester what she can do to be a better professor. She is open to just about anything and she is very nice. She makes class interesting and fun
